loans.name: Afde N°28 Group

texts.fr:
L’Association des Femmes pour le Développement de l’Entreprise (AFDE) est une organisation de femmes commerçantes de petite échelle travaillant dans Thies, une ville environ 70 Kms de Dakar. L'association a été fondée en 1993 par vingt femmes entrepreneurs pour augmenter leur pouvoir d'achat par le biais  d’une tontine (système de financement tournant dans lequel chaque membre cotise périodiquement une somme convenue et qu’on verse à tour de rôle aux différents membres). 
Cette politique ne permettant pas de financer au même jour tous les membres, elles décidèrent d’adhérer à l’IMCEC afin de s’octroyer du crédit sans des demandes de garanties. C’est ainsi que les membres sont divisés en  sous groupe de 5, avec une présidente désignée et une trésorière pour chaque sous groupe. Ces sous-groupes, au nombre de 63 en ce moment, peuvent être le même pendant de nombreuses années, mais changent souvent de membres selon le financement des besoins et d'autres considérations.
 L'AFDE organise des réunions de membre mensuellement où tous les sous groupes sont conviés et dirige une coopération pour ses membres, en leur permettant d'acheter du riz et d'autres produits à de meilleurs prix.
 L'AFDE est dirigée par une Présidente du nom de Madame Mame Diarra MAR et une trésorière Madame Ndeye Ndella Diouf toutes habitantes de Thiès. 
La présidente de l’AFDE 28 est Madame Bineta S.. Agée de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle s’active depuis 3 ans dans la vente de poissons fumés et séchés, de l’huile de palme au marché Grand Thiès. Avec le crédit, Madame S. veut se réapprovisionner à Mbour et Diaobé deux localités où les produits sont au bon marché. 
Elle est dans ce groupe avec Madame Ndeye Sokhna D. Trésorière vendeuse de produits cosmétiques, de Madame Amy T. vendeuse de thé et de kola, de Madame Fatou F. vendeuse de légumes et de poissons frais chez lui et de Madame Aïssatou S. vendeuse de carottes, choux et de navets au marché Grand Thiès. Elles sollicitent toutes 5 un montant de 250 000 FCFA qu’elles vont partager à part égale pour financer leurs activités.
texts.en:
The Association des Femmes pour le Développement de l’Entreprise (AFDE) is an organization of women in small-scale commerce working in Thies, a city about 70 km from Dakar. This association was founded in 1993 by twenty women entrepreneurs to increase their purchasing power by way of a tontine (a revolving credit system in which each member periodically pays a suitable amount and which funds its various members by turns). This policy does not allow every member to be financed on the same day. The members decided to join IMCEC in order to award loans without guarantee requirements. Thus, the members are divided into sub-groups of five, each with a designated president and a treasurer. These sub-groups, which currently number as many as 63, can be the same for several years but often change their members according to the financing of needs and other considerations. The AFDE organizes member meetings each month, when all the sub-groups are invited. It facilitates cooperation for its members, enabling them to buy rice and other goods at better prices. The AFDE is lead by a president by the name of Ms. Mame Diarra MAR and by a treasurer, Ms. Ndeye Ndella Diouf , both residents of Thiès. The president of AFDE 28 is Ms. Bineta S., aged 46, who is married and the mother of four children. She has been active for three years in selling smoked and dried fish and palm oil at the Grand Thiès market. With the loan, Ms. S. wants to get supplies in Mbour and Diaobé, two towns where goods are cheap. She is in this group with the treasurer Ms. Ndeye Sokhna D., a retailer of cosmetics; Ms. Amy T., a retailer of tea and kola; Ms. Fatou F., a retailer of vegetables and fresh fish at her place; and Ms. Aïssatou S., a retailer of carrots cabbage, and turnips at the Grand Thiès market. All five group members are requesting an amount of 250,000 francs CFA that they are going to share equally for financing their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Philo

texts.en: Philo is a happy and hardworking woman. She is married to a commercial driver and they have four children who are doing well in business and school. Philo sells locally made soap, called soda, at retail prices to her customers. She also sells peanuts and cellophane bags. She works for long hours to support her husband in meeting the basic needs of the family. She hopes to grow her business and is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more locally made soap (soda) to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more locally made soap (soda) to sell

loans.name: Aldiojojan

texts.en:
Aldiojojan B. is from the village of San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. He is 40 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Aldiojojan owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as candies, sugar, noodles, shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc. in the local community. Aldiojojan has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Aldiojojan joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Aldiojojan is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his fifth from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Carol joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Carol is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her seventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Рачабов Баходур проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 26 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Жена занимается растениеводством и одновременно животноводством. Сам Баходур более 4 лет занимается торговлей. Он в основном продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Bahodur R. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 26 years old, married and has one child. His wife is involved in agriculture and animal husbandry. Bahodur has been involved in retail sales for over 4 years. He primarily sells food products. He is requesting the loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

Maris Stella owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as coffee, Milo (a milk beverage), Coffeemate (a cream substitute), noodles, cooking oil, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Maris Stella is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah sells groceries in her stall. She loves her business because her customers pay cash when they come to purchase groceries. She does not tolerate credit because she does not want to incur debt in her business. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell.

Deborah is married with three children and her husband is a commercial driver. She is 42 years old. She is a hardworking woman and she is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Mame Yacine

texts.fr: Madame Mame Yacine D. sollicite un prêt de 150 000 FCFA pour acheter des tissus du genre indigo (thioupe)  qu’elle place à ses clients qui lui règlent par fin de mois. En fait cette dame, célibataire âgée de 44 ans, est dans le secteur du commerce depuis  5 ans pour dit-elle régler ses propres besoins. Elle pratique le commerce ambulant de tissus, d’habits, arachide …etc.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mame Yacine D. is requesting a 150,000 FCFA credit loan to buy indigo-style fabrics (thioupe) she offers to her clients, who then pay her end of month. This 44-year-old lady has in fact been active in retail commerce for the past five years, to meet her personal needs. She is an itinerant vendor of fabrics, clothes, peanuts, etc.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabrics for her business

loans.name: Mercedes' Group

texts.en:
Mercedes M. is from the village of Malamag East. She is 50 years old. Mercedes is the group leader of a eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Mercedes M..

Mercedes is widowed and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Mercedes raises pigs for fattening and sale. Mercedes has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP whenever she sells an animal.

In 2008, Mercedes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. Mercedes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Mercedes from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Madame Adama F. est une femme âgée de 37 ans et qui a très tôt connu la responsabilité de mère de  famille. En effet  tout à commencer après la mort de sa mère en assurant le rôle de sa maman à l’endroit des petits frères et sœurs, il y’a 10 ans. Ce qui l’avait amené à faire le petit commerce  pour mieux prévoir  les frais domestiques.
Actuellement, marié et mère d’un enfant âgé de 2 ans, Madame Adama F. souhaiterait développer son commerce. Ainsi, pour la première fois depuis qu’elle a adhéré à U-IMCEC en 2006,  elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 FCFA afin de financer son commerce. Cet investissement va lui permettre de s’approvisionner en marchandises. Elle pourra acheter de l’huile de palme, du pain de singe des poissons séchés et fumés qu’elle va placer à ses clients qui règlent journalièrement (100 F/jour).
texts.en:
Mrs. Adama F. is a 37-year-old woman, who at an early age learned the responsibilities of a mother. It all began after her mother died 10 years ago, and she had to assume the role of mother towards her younger siblings. This situation made her start retail activities to better handle household expenses. She is currently married, mother of a two-year-old, and wants to expand her commercial activity. For the first time since she joined U-IMCEC in 2006, she is requesting a 100,000 FCFA loan to finance her business. This investment will allow her to stock some supplies. She will buy palm oil, “monkey bread” (fruit of the baobab tree), and dried or smoked fish she then delivers to customers who pay her daily (100 F/day).

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for small retail commerce

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 39 years old and is married with five children, her youngest being 13 years old. Her children attend school and this makes her happy.

Victoria is an honest and hardworking woman. She sells crates of drinks at wholesale and retail prices to her customers. She is very happy doing her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.

Victoria hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Adetola

texts.en:
Adetola, age 47, is married with five children and lives in Lagos, Nigeria. She is hardworking and believes that women are helpmates and need to help their husbands support the family.

Adetola has operated a restaurant for 25 years. She sells drinks and food in other to make a profit and earn a good living. With the profit from her business, she has been able to save a little money and to assist her husband in running the affairs of the home. Her husband is a civil servant who, like his wife, is working hard to meet the family's financial needs. 

Adetola hopes to expand her business by buying more drinks and more cooking ingredients to use in the restaurant. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000, primarily to purchase more drinks to sell. She promises to repay back her loan by its due date. She sends her thanks to Kiva and LAPO Microfinance for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more beverages to sell at her restaurant

loans.name: Nemi

texts.en:
Nemi F. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 59 years old. Nemi is widowed and has one adult-age child. To make a living, Nemi owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. Nemi has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Nemi joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nemi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Nemi is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Nemi from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Omolara

texts.en:
Omolara, age 49, lives in Lagos, Nigeria. She is married and has one child. She sells drinks to make a living and has been managing this business for over 20 years. 

She wants to expand her business, which is why she is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100, 000 to purchase drinks in larger quantities to sell. She hopes to have a car for her business in future so that she can supply drinks at wholesale to her customers at their individual places of business.

Omolara is very supportive of her husband in terms of providing food, clothing, and so on for the children. She intends to repay her loan by its due date. She expresses her gratitude to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Kène

texts.fr: Mademoiselle  Kène G.  est couturière de métier depuis 2 ans. Agée  de 26 ans, Mademoiselle Kène G. trouve sa principale activité dans la vente de divers produits (tissus, produits cosmétiques…etc)  dans sa cantine sise au marché de Thiès depuis 2008. C’est l’amour du commerce et le goût des produits qui l’on poussé dans ce secteur. Ainsi, pour renforcer et développer son commerce, Mademoiselle Kène G. solliciter un prêt d’un montant  150 000 FCFA au niveau de sa caisse UIMCEC à laquelle, elle est devenue membre depuis Octobre 2008.
texts.en:
Miss Kène G. has been a seamstress for the past two years. She is 26 years old. Her main activity since 2008 has been the retail of various products (fabrics, beauty products, etc.) in her Thies market shop. She was attracted to this area of activity through her love of commerce and the products she sells. To strengthen and expand her business, Miss Kène G. has requested a 150,000 FCFA loan from the local U-IMCEC branch, of which she is a member since October 2008.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and expand her business

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a hair stylist and she makes lovely Nigerian and western hair styles for her customers in Ughelli. She also sells hair extensions and cream. Her customers are usually friends and residents. She hopes to own a classic hair salon in the future.

Rachael hopes for a loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell.  She is married with 2 children and her husband is a carpenter and he also supports their home. Her children attend a private school. She is 29 years old. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell

loans.name: Jumoke

texts.en:
Jumoke is a trader who sells spiritual items like perfume, olive oil, and more. The customers who patronize her business and the people who engage in this business are few, but some people use those items for spiritual exercises. Jumoke has been very successful in her business but she has been able to save little from the profits she makes to assist her husband in taking care of her children.

She hopes to expand her business by stocking her shop with more items. She is requesting NGN 50,000 to purchase more spiritual items to sell to make more profit. 

Jumoke is 42 years old, married and blessed with 3 children. Her youngest child is 7 years old and is doing well in school. She and her family reside in Lagos where she manages her business. She expresses her joy to Kiva lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more spiritual items to sell.

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Одинаев Абдусаттор проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 28 лет. Женат, имеет 9 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Живет вместе с родителями. Отец, работает электриком. Сам Абдусаттор занимается растениеводством. Имеет небольшой земельный участок, где сажает пшеницу. Урожай который он получает, вывозит на рынок. В этой области более 5 лет. До этого занимался торговлей. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Abdusattor O. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 28 years old, married and has 9 children. His wife is a homemaker. He lives together with his parents. His father works as an electrician. Abdusattor is involved in agriculture. He has a small plot of land, where he grows wheat. He sells the obtained harvest at the market. He has been in this business for over 5 years and was previously involved in retail sales. Abdusattor is requesting the loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bezhan Group

texts.en:
Maleha is the group leader of Bezhan group.  Maleha is single and lives in the 11th district of Kabul, Afghanistan.  She lives in a household that has 5 members.

She wants to take a loan for her beauty salon business. Maleha wants to buy more cosmetics and some needed furniture so she can expand and progress her business and help with her family. She is very happy with this small loan process in Afghanistan that helps the poor people.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and furniture.

loans.name: Oke

texts.en: Oke sells women's clothes at the Ughelli market. She hopes to own a classic women's boutique in the future. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more women's clothes to sell. She is 34 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a carpenter. She has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization). LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: 06.01.15 Hoang Chau, Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Hoa L. (75) is a 47-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa Thanh Hoa.  Hoa is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 06.01.15 (06.01.15 Hoang Chau, Hoang Hoa).

Hoa is married and has three adult-aged children.  To make a living, Hoa owns & operates a fishing business harvesting & selling farm-raised fish in the local community.  Hoa has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2001, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hoa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to raise.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.000.000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional fish to raise.  The loan will be the eighth loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  L. T. Tap (85) is a 39-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

2.  N. T. Phuong (26) is a 47-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

3.  C. T. Khuyen (100) is a 46-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

4.  N. T. Hoan (101) is a 46-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

5.  N. T. Anh (4) is a 45-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

6.  L. T. Doai (21) is a 48-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

7.  N. T. L. (123) is a 43-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

8.  L. T. Ninh (63) is a 25-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her fishing business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hoa L. (75) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở Hoang Hoa Thanh Hoa.  Hoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 9 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 06.01.15 (06.01.15 Hoang Chau, Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá nuôi tại nông trại trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hoa kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2001, Hoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua cá bổ sung để nuôi.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. Tap (85) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


2.  N. T. Phuong (26) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


3.  C. T. Khuyen (100) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  N. T. Hoan (101) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


5.  N. T. Anh (4) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


6.  L. T. Doai (21) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


7.  N. T. L. (123) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


8.  L. T. Minh (63) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to raise

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen sells foodstuffs in her stall. She loves her business because her customers pay cash when they come to purchase foodstuffs. She does not tolerate credit because she does not want to incur debt in her business. She hopes for a loan of N30,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is married with three children. Her husband is a commercial driver. She is 40 years old. Helen is a hard working woman and she is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Joao Fabiao

texts.pt:
João fabiao S. nasceu em maputo tem 28 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e mãe de uma menina de 4 anos de idade que frequenta o centro infantil. Não responsabiliza se por ninguém e consegue poupar 1.000.00MT por mês porque também tem feito trabalhos de reparação de computadores.

João apos sua nascença perde seus pais e passa a viver com seu irmão, mas velho, este que toma conta dele, quando freqüentava a 9 classe ele vivia no internato e seu irmão já não podia mais custear com as despesas e ele teve que sair. Mas como ele era activista duma organização (Médicos do Mundo) num contrato de 2 anos e auferia 1.200.00MT consegue alugar uma dependência e passa a estudar a noite onde consegue concluir a 12 classes. Mas o contrato finda e ele é contractado pelas irmãs salassianas para trabalhar no colégio Maria auxiliadora como professor de desenho no período da manha das 7h às 10h e no período da tarde ela fazia um curso de reparação de computadores na SISCOM em Maputo três vezes por semana durante 6 meses. Hoje é funcionário permanente no STAE com a categoria de técnico de informática e estatística a mas de 3 anos trabalhando das 7,30 as 15.30h auferindo 3.450.00me mensalmente e um subsídio no período de processos eleitorais de 5.850 em cada 3 meses.


Este e o segundo empréstimo de joão na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva, o primeiro de 10.000.00mt foi usado para legalizaçao do seu terreno, este segundo de 20.000.00mt sera usado para comprrar material de contruçao e dar inicio da sua propria obra e sair da casa alugada.esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo emprestimo para pagar as dispesae escolares pois pensa emcotunuar com os estudos.
texts.en:
João Fabiao S. was born in Maputo. He is 28 years old, married and father to a four-year-old daughter who attends preschool. He is not responsible for anyone else and manages to save 1,000 meticais per month because he also works in computer repair. João lost his parents after his birth and went to live with his older brother, who took care of him. When he was in ninth grade, he attended boarding school, and he had to leave because his brother could no longer pay the fees. But as he was an active member of an organization (Doctors of the World) with a two-year contract and received 1,200 meticais, he was able to rent a room and study at night, finishing the 12th grade. But the contract ended, and he was contacted by the Salesian Sisters to work at the Maria Auxiliadora (Mary Help of Christians) School as a drawing teacher from 7 until 10 in the morning, and he took a computer repair course at SISCOM in Maputo three afternoons a week for six months. For more than three years, he has been a permanent employee of STAE (the Electoral Administration Technical Secretariat) in information technology and statistics, working from 7:30 am until 3:30 pm, receiving 3,450 meticais monthly and a subsidy of 5,850 meticais quarterly during the elections. This is João's second loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. The first loan, for 10,000 meticais, was used buy the title to his land. This second loan of 20,000 meticais will be used to buy construction material and start building his own house so he can leave his rented house. He is confident that he will pay it off ahead of schedule and ask for another loan to pay school expenses since he is thinking of continuing with his studies.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material

loans.name: Borhanudin Group

texts.en:
Husina is the group leader of the Borhanudin group. She is single and lives in district 11 in Kabul, Afghanistan. 
She lives in a household of five members and she is responsible for paying for the house rent and school fees of her sisters. 
She has a small tailoring business in her house and all her family members benefit through the income she generates.
She needs the loan to purchase a new machine, fabric and different kinds of needles and threads.
She hopes to expand her business and to open a shop instead of working in the house.

loans.use: To purchase a new machine for her tailoring business

loans.name: Sareth's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sareth H. is a leader of a four-member group loan offered by AMK, located in Phdau Cheung village in Takeo province. The members of this loan hope to increase their income to support their families. Mrs. Sareth H. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Saroeurn Sam, is a construction worker who can receive a small salary to support his family. Although this couple tries to work hard with their different businesses, they still don't earn enough income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Sareth H. is now requesting 800,000 Riels to buy a cow for breeding. Mrs. Sareth H. is 30 years old and the mother of four children. Two of the children attend the local school while the other two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Octavio Carlos

texts.pt:
Octavio S. nasceu na Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira Suazilândia vive maritalmente é pai de um rapaz de cinco anos que vai ao centro infantil, para além do seu filho responsabiliza se pela sua mãe enviando lhe uma sexta básica no valor de 1.000.00MT mensalmente, e consegue poupar 1.000.00MT porque conta com ajuda da sua esposa que também e docente.


Octavio após concluir o ensino básico (10 classe) faz o curso de professorado que duram 3 anos tempo (regular) com equivalência de 12 classe, é afecto para trabalhar como professor de português. No mesmo ano devido ao elevado numero de agregado familiar e porque ele já tinha  família. saiu da casa dos pais para uma casa alugada onde paga mensalmente 400.00MT. Depois é transferido para trabalhar na Direcçao Distrital da Educação onde se encontra ate então trabalhando das 7:30 as 15:30h auferindo 5.548,00MT mensalmente e ainda consegue ganhar uma bolsa de estudo aumentando assim o nível de escolaridade. Por estar cansado de viver numa casa alugada ele aproxima se a hluvuku solicitando empréstimos para legalização e construção da sua própria obra, mas devido ao roubo do material de construção ele não consegue concluir a obra e nunca perde a esperança de construir. Resolve pedir outro empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00MT para minimizar a sua obra e mudar se para sua própria casa.


Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Octavio na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva. O primeiro de 15.000.00MT foi usado para legalizar o seu terreno, o segundo de 8.000.00MT deu inicio do seu negócio e pede este terceiro de 20.000.00MT para concluir as mínimas partes da sua obra. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir um novo para mobilar à mesma.
texts.en:
Octavio S. was born in Vila de Namaacha on the border between Mozambique and Swaziland. He lives with his wife and has a five-year-old son who attends preschool. Besides his son, he is also responsible for taking care of his mother. He sends her 1000 Meticales each month for her basic needs. He also manages to save 1000 Meticales each month because his wife helps out financially. Like him, she is a teacher. After finishing his basic education (through 10th grade), Octavio completed a 3-year teacher training course that prepared him to work as a Portuguese language teacher. The same year he finished, due to the large number of family members living in his parents' house and because he already had a family of his own, he moved into a rental house costing 400 Meticales a month. Later he was transferred to a job in the Direcçao Distrital da Educação [Regional Education Administration] where he currently works from 7:30 AM to 3:30 PM. He earns 5548 Meticales per month and also has a scholarship that allows him to further his education. Because he was tired of living in a rental house, he approached Hluvuku [the Kiva field partner] for a loan to cover the legal expenses and construction costs of building his own home. Due to the fact that his construction materials were stolen he has not been able to finish the project but he never lost hope that he would be able to build. He decided to ask for another loan in the amount of 20,000 Meticales to finish this construction project and move into his own home. This is Octavio's third loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. His first loan, for 15,000 Meticales, was used to legalize the land he owns. The second, for 8000 Meticales, was to begin the construction. He is asking for this third loan to put the finishing touches on his construction project. He is sure that he will repay this loan on time and will ask for another loan to furnish his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Koemly

texts.en: Mrs. Koemly Y. is a 30-year-old woman who lives in Ampil Rieng village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Ros Tuy, are farmers who own a small field to cultivate rice to support their family of two children — a four-year old and one in school. She is requesting 2,000,000 Riels from AMK to buy timber to fix up her house.

loans.use: To buy timbers

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce sells groceries and soft drinks. She loves her business because her customers pay cash; she does not offer credit because she does not want to incur debt. She hopes for a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She is 38 and married with five children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Joyce is a hard-working woman determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Isaac Alexandre

texts.pt:
Isac Alexandre M. nasceu na vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Suazilândia, vive maritalmente é pai de 2 filhos a primeira de 9 e o segundo de 4 anos. A mas velha esta no ensino primario e o novo no centro infantil. Para além dos filhos rsponsabiliza se pela sua mãe e sobrinho que vive  com ele em sua casa e não consegue poupar nenhum valor por mês pois encontra se a construir e não conta com ajuda da sua esposa que é desempregada.


Isac faz o Ensino Básico e não consegue ingrenar no Ensino Superior devido a falta de condições, ano seguinte candidata se a formação de professores e durante 2 anos consegue concluir e é afecto em Boane. Por ser longe de casa e da  familia. ele pede uma transferência para a Vila de Namaacha onde se encontra ate então dando aulas de educação fisica no periodo da manhã e de matemática no periodo da tarde auferindo mensalmente 5.560.00mt. Seis meses depois recebe um valor acomulado(salário após 6 meses de trabalho de graça) no valor de 35.000.00mt e da inicio da  própria obra que por motivos da subida de preços do material ele não consegue concluir o reboco e minimas partes da sua varranda. Primeiramante  aproxima se a hluvuku solicitando um empréstimo no valor 12.000.00mt para compra de alguns bens(fogao a gaz e um jogo de sofas,) e pagou cem nenhum problema.


Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Isac na Hluvuku e primriro com kiva. o primeiro de 12.000.00mt foi usado para comprar bens, o segundo de 6.000.00mt foi usado para comprar material de construção e este terceiro de 15.000.00mt serão também usados para o reboco e conclusão da varranda que por motivos climaticos é obrigado a ter que permanecer dentro de casa. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo  emprestimo para sua formação estudantil.
texts.en:
Isaac Alexandre M. was born in the town of Namaacha on the border with Swaziland. He is married and is the father of two children, a 9-year-old daughter and a 4-year-old son. The daughter is in elementary school, and the son is in preschool. Aside from the children, he is responsible for his mother and a nephew who live with him, and he does not manage to save anything because he is still building his house and cannot count on help from his wife, who is unemployed. Isaac completed school but did not attend college for financial reasons. After a year he got into teaching school, which he completed in two years and was employed in Boane. Because he was far from home and his family, he asked for a transfer to the town of Namaacha where he now teaches physical education in the mornings and math in the afternoons, earning 5,560 meticais per month. Six months after the transfer his salary of 35,000 meticais was paid retroactively, and he began building his own house. Because the price of materials rose, he could not finish the plastering and some parts of his veranda. He first approached Hluvuku asking for a loan of 12,000 meticais to buy a gas oven and a set of sofas, and he paid it off with no problems. This is Isaac's third loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. The first loan of 12,000 meticais was used to buy the oven and sofas. The second loan, for 6,000 meticais, was used to buy construction material, and this third loan of 15,000 meticais will be used for plastering and for finishing the veranda which he must have because of the climate. He is confident that he will pay the loan off ahead of schedule and ask for a new loan to pay for further education.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Growing corn

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is fashion designer who makes lovely Nigerian designs for her customers as well as selling sewing materials. She loves this business because it allows her to help support her family. Her challenge is funding and she hopes to overcome this challenge. She is 35 and married with one child. She is requesting a loan of N80,000 to buy more sewing materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing materials to sell

loans.name: Adelia Jossias

texts.pt:
Adélia jossias B. nasceu em Inhambane, tem 31 anos de idade vive maritalmente é mãe de uma rapariga de 13 anos e vai à escola. Responsabiliza se pelos seus 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela em sua casa e consegue poupar por mês 1.500.00MT  porque conta com ajuda do seu marido que e proprietário de uma mina de extração de pedra lage (pedra preciosa).

Adélia muda se para Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Suazilândia com a irmã mais velha alegando que iam estudar, apos sua chegada não consegue engrenar a escola por falta de documentos (estavão incompletos) então junta se com seu marido e vai ao lar. Seu marido emigra para África do Sul deixa lhe com um fundo e ela inicia seu próprio negócio e consegue construir sua própria barraca em Jermantino uma localidade que dista 7 km da vila e tem muita aderência por se encontrar na estrada principal. Anos depois o marido regressa e optam em comprar um terreno de extração de pedra Lages (pedra preciosa) e ele também decide ficar a cuidar do seu negócio pessoalmente. Conta com ajuda de 5 trabalhadores que auferem 1.500.00MT mensalmente, mas devido à obra ela fica na beira da falência e pede ajuda a hluvuku e kiva solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 8.000.00MT para reforçar o negócio. Tem como melhor produto o (peixe, feijão, bebidas e refrigerantes) gastando em cada viagem uma média de 10.000.00MT e tem de lucro mensal 4.000.00MT.

Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Adélia na Hluvuku e Kiva. Estes 8.000.00MT serão usados para comprar produtos da sua loja. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para aumentar as ferramentas para extração de pedra Lages porque as que têm já estão gastas.
texts.en:
Adelia Jossias B. was born in Inhambane. She is 31 years old and lives with her husband and her 13-year-old daughter, who attends school. She also cares for 2 nephews who live with her in her home. Each month she manages to put 1500 Meticales in savings because she is helped out financially by her husband, who owns a rhyolite mine. Adelia moved with her older sister to Vila de Namaacha on the border with Swaziland, thinking that they would go to school there. After they arrived, however, they couldn't enroll in school because of a lack of complete documentation. She then met her husband and moved in with him. Her husband emigrated to South Africa and left her with some funds, which she used to start her own business. She was able to set up a stall in Jermantino, which is 7 kilometers from her town and is very popular because it is located on the main road. After some years, Adelia's husband returned and they decided to buy land on which they could mine rhyolite. He decided to stay in order to take care of his business personally. Adelia has 5 workers to help her, who earn 1500 Meticales per month. However, because of the cost of the mine construction, Adelia is barely able to cover all her expenses and she has asked Hluvuku for a loan in the amount of 8000 Meticales to strengthen her business. Her best products are fish, beans, and drinks. She earns 4000 Meticales each month, and spends 10,000 Meticales each time she travels. This is Adelia's first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. The 8000 Meticales will be used to buy products for her store. She is confident that she will repay the loan promptly. She will then ask for another loan to acquire more tools for extracting the rhyolite, because the ones she currently has are worn down,

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beans and drinks.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina D. is married and living with her three children. She has received senior high education. Her husband is a trader.

Christina sells varieties of body lotions and hair creams at Elmina and has been doing this for some time now. She uses her income to support her husband in taking care of the children and any other expenditures that may come her way.

Christina will add the loan acquired to her initial capital to buy more body lotion, hair creams and other cosmetics to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more body lotion, hair creams and other cosmetics

loans.name: Abdul Maqem

texts.en:
Abdul Maqem is the son of N. S.. He is 55 years old and lives in the 15th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has four children which makes a big family: two sons and two daughters. His youngest son supports him in his business and the others are students.

Abdul Maqem has a general store in which he sells different kinds of things. He wants to expand his business and buy more materials, especially the things that are more in demand. On the other hand, he wants to attract more clients.

Abdul Maqem has requested a loan of 42,000 Afghani. He is happy that there is this good process that can solve the entrepreneurs’ problems.

loans.use: To buy more materials for his shop

loans.name: Kanha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kanha C. is the village bank president of this 10-member group loan offered by AMK. The members are located in Kouk TrE. village in Takeo province. The members will each use the loan to purchase supplies, equipment or other items to support their different purposes. Mrs.Chart Pov and Mrs. Keang C., who are group guarantors are also present in the photo with the group loan members.

Mrs. Kanha C. and her husband, Mr. Khoeurn C., are farmers who rent a piece of land on which they cultivate rice. Aside from farming, Mrs. Kanha C. is also a silk weaver from which she can earn a small income to support her living.

Mrs. Kanha C. now is requesting 600,000 Riels to purchase a cart and an ice-cream box to support her husband’s new business.

This couple has four children, one of whom is a seamstress in the garment factory, two others are silk weavers while the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase a cart and an ice-cream box for her husband's new business

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is a fashion designer and she designs lovely Nigerian patterns for her customers. She also sells tailoring materials to boost her business. She loves this business because she is able to make additional profits to support her home.

Felicia is married with four children and she is 39 years old. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home.

Felicia’s challenge in her business is funds and she hopes to overcome the challenge. She is requesting a loan of N120,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.pt:
José António L. nasceu em Gaza tem 55 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e pai de 4 flhos com idades compreendidas entre os 14 aos 26 anos todos vão à escola e somente a filha do meio e que vai a escola. Para além dos filhos responsabiliza se pelos seus dois netos que vivem com ele e consegue poupar por mês 1.000.00MT porque conta com ajuda da sua esposa.


José é recrutado para Sofala onde cumpre o serviço militar obrigatório durante três anos, é desmobilizado e começa a trabalhar como milícia. Anos depois é transferido para Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Suazilândia onde sobe de categoria para oficial de guarda fronteira trabalhando das 7h as 15:30horas auferindo mensalmente 9.486.00MT. José e cedida uma casa do estado e tinha que compartilhar com outros colegas, mas o ambiente não era católico e ele aluga uma casa onde viveram 20 anos com sua família pagando mensalmente 1.000.00MT. Cansado de viver numa casa alugada pede um empréstimo no BIM  para dar início da sua obra, pagou com muito sucesso. A obra não foi concluída devido ao elevado custo do material e pede ajuda a Hluvuku e Kiva para concluir as mínimas partes  porque já mudou se para a casa.


Este é o primeiro empréstimo de José na Hluvuku e Kiva. Já teve no BIM no valor de 34.000.00MT para dar inicio da  obra e pagou sem nenhum problema, este 20.000.00MT serão usados para compra de material de construção . Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo para mobiliar a mesma.
texts.en:
José António L. was born in Gaza and is 55 years old. He lives with his wife and four children with ages between 14 and 26, all students. He also supports two grandsons that live with him and is able to save 1.000,00MT (U$36) every month with the help of his wife. Jose was in the army in Sofala for 3 years, then he left and started working in the police force. Years later he's transferred to the Naamacha village in the border with Suazilandia, where he's promoted to border patrol officer working from 7am to 3:30pm and making U$350 per month. Jose received a house from the govermnet that he had to share with others, but the atmosphere wasn't catholic, so he rented a house where he's been living with his family for the past 20 years paying U$36 per month. Tired of renting, he asked BIM for a loan to start building his own house, which he paid back on time. The construction wasn't finished though, due to the high costs of the supplies, so Jose asked Hluvuku and Kiva for a loan to finish building the house since he already moved into it. This is Jose's first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva and he's asking for $650 to buy construction supplies. He's confident he'll pay it back sooner than the expected payback date and hopes to get another loan in the future in order to buy furniture.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en:
Alphonce is a 60-year-old married man living in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. He has eleven children, ranging in age from 16 to 35 years old, with four of them currently attending school. He is also helping support two of his young grandchildren who attend school.

Alphonce has been running his mixed farm for over ten years now, and primarily sells maize and beans to local brokers. He also earns supplementary income from owning a tailoring shop in his town. Overall, he says that lately the main challenge to his business is low market prices for his produce, which makes life difficult with the high input costs he faces.

Alphonce has a successful history with Juhudi Kilimo, previously completing two loans of Kes 20,000 and Kes 40,000. He has now requested this loan of Kes 80,000 to expand his poultry farming operations and to purchase a dairy animal. He says that the extra income from this loan will help his family meet their basic needs without much struggle, and allow the children to get the best education.

Alphonce has plans for expansion in the next five to ten years, and he recognizes the gains he has made since having access to capital in recent years. He now sees himself becoming a big supplier of milk and poultry products to the neighboring areas and to the Kenya Cooperative of Creameries in the future.

loans.use: To upgrade his poultry farm and purchase a dairy animal

loans.name: Saen

texts.en: Mr. Saen K. is a 28-year-old married man who lives in Tuol Svay village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Sinath Loy, are farmers who own a one-hectare field to cultivate rice. Mr. Saen K. is requesting 1,000,000 Riels from AMK to purchase fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for plowing labor to support his farming crops. Mr. Saen K. is also a fruit seller and his wife is also a farm laborer who can earn a small income to support their family. This couple has two children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah has a wheelbarrow that she uses to hawk Nigerian cooked foods. Her customers love her cooked foods and she has high patronage. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is married with five children and she is 42 years old. Her husband is a civil servant and he supports their home. She hopes to grow her business. She is requesting a loan of N120,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Ana Valente

texts.pt:
Ana Valente Mazive B. nasceu em Gaza, tem 52 anos de idade é casada mãe de 12 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 6 aos 34 anos dos quais 8 são rapazes e 4 são raparigas, os 7 mais velhos são empregados e os restantes 5 encontram se a estudar. Para alem dos filhos responsabiliza se pelo seu sobrinho que e órfão.

Ana perde  pai aindfa muito bebe, a  mãe junta se com o segundo esposo e teve que deixa lá sob cuidados do  irmão mais velho. Mais este o maltratava e ela só consegue fazer a 1ª classe do antigo sistema. Quando tinha 10 anos esta foge com a sua amiga para Maputo a procura de emprego aonde vem a trabalhar como empregada doméstica durante 5 anos, sai de Maputo para Vila de Namaacha na fronteira da suazilândia quando junta se com esposo que era trabalhador da petromoc. Apos a chegada da lhe um fundo e ela inicia com a criação de pintos, cria ha mais de 10 anos tem metido no Maximo 300 e no mínimo 200 pintos gasta 20.000.00MT e tem um lucro de 7.000.00MT mensalmente consegue poupar 2.000.00MT e 1.000.00MT aluga capoeira. no empréstimo passado ela teve dificuldades de reembolsar nos últimos meses mas como conta com ajuda do seu marido ela consegue superar e agora pede este empréstimo de 15.000.00MT para comprar roupas diversas na África do Sul nomeadamente (lençóis, fatos, duvides e calções) e tem como melhor encomenda fatos que tem vendido na sua igreja(velha apostolo). 

Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Ana na Hluvuku e Kiva. O primeiro de 15.000.00MT foi usado para comprar pintos para criação, e este segundo de 15.000.00MT também será usado para comprar diverso tipo de roupas para revenda. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo determinado, pois para alem do negócio conta com a ajuda do seu esposo. Tem como objectivo construir a sua própria capoeira e tornar se uma grande criadora de frangos.
texts.en:
Ana Valente Mazive B. was born in Gaza, is 52 years old, married and the mother of 12 children with ages between 6 and 34. Eight of them are boys and four are girls, the seven older ones are employed and the four younger ones are students. Besides her children she also takes care of a nephew who's an orphan. Ana lost her father while she was still a baby, her mother remarried and left her to be taken care by her older brother, who didn't do a good job so she had to drop school and only finished first grade. When she was 10 years old, she ran away with a friend to Maputo and worked as a maid for five years, moving then to Namaacha in the border with Suazilandia where she got married to her husband who worked for Petromoc. After receiving some money she started raising chicks, activity that she has been performing for the past 10 years. She has between 200 and 300 chicks, and makes a $250 profit every month. From that money she's able to save between $35 and $60. She is asking for a $475 loan to buy used clothes in South Africa to resell. This is her first loan with Huluvuku and Kiva and she's confident she'll be able to pay it back in no time, because besides her two businesses she also has the help of her husband. She dreams of building her own chicken raising farm.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for reselling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Challote

texts.en:
Challote E. is a single parent and has two children. She has received senior high education.

Challote sells Fante kenkey with fried fish at Elmina. Fante kenkey is normally eaten by the Fante’s in the central and western regions of the country and is served with hot pepper sauce and fried fish.

Challote’s main responsibility is to pay her children’s school fees and maintain the home. Her loan, which will serve as an increased capital, will be used to buy bags of maize for the making of the kenkey and cartons of fish to fry and sell alongside the Fante kenkey.

Challote aims to use the new profits that are likely to come, to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize for the making of kenkey and cartons of fish to fry and sell alongside it

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing fabric for traditional clothes

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoem K. is 47 years old and she lives in Ta Ou Khang Tboung village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Soeurn Vann, are farmers who own a 3-hectare (7.5-acre) field on which they cultivate rice.

Mrs. Yoem K. is now requesting 2,000,000 Riels from AMK to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farm crop.

Mrs. Yoem K. is a mother of three children, two of whom are construction workers, while the other one is a student in the local school. Aside from farming, her husband is village chef from which he receives a small income to support his family living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Queen sells groceries in her stall. She loves her business because her customers pay cash when they come to purchase groceries. She does not want to incur debt in her business. She hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more groceries to sell.

She is married with three children and her husband is a caterer. She is 39 years old. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to lift her business and her family above poverty. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Sergio Moises

texts.pt:
Sergio Moises macuácua nasceu em Gaza tem 26 anos vive maritalmente  é pai de 2 filhos a primeira de 4 e o segundo de apenas 3 meses. Nenhum dos dois vai a escola, responsabiliza se pelo seu irmão que vive em Maputo enviando lhe material escolar anualmente e consegue poupar 500.00mt por mês porque tem feito horas extras nos sábados e domingos das 7h as 17horas e ganha 450 diariamente.


Sérgio muda se para Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Suazilândia em casa da avo quando o pai ganha uma bolsa de estudo para Alemnhã antiga(R.D.A) e fica 10 anos sem dar nenhuma satisfação, assim a mãe junta se com outro esposo. Anos depois a mãe perde a vida e deixa lhe com a casa onde vive ate então, Sergio consegue aranjar um emprego nas águas de Namaacha como engarrafador, é funcionario permanente  ha 4 anos trabalhando das 7:30  as 15:30 no periodo da manhã e das 15:30 as 23:00h no periodo da noite auferindo mensalmente 2.300.00mt. Consegue legaizar um terreno e fica sem fundo para dar inico da obra então aproxima se a Hluvuku e Kiva solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt para construção da sua própria casa pois ele quer seder a casa onde vive para seu irmão mas novo.


Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Sergio na Hluvuku e Kiva no valor de 10.000.00mt para construção de uma moradia familiar. Esta confiante que vai terminar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo para a mesma finalidade.
texts.en:
Sergio Moises Macuácua was born in Gaza, is 26 years old and lives with his wife and two children, a 4-year old girl and a 3-month old boy. Neither one of them go to school yet, but Sergio takes care of a younger brother that lives in Maputo by sending him school supplies. He is still able to save a little every month because he works overtime on Saturdays and Sundays from 7am to 5pm and makes $16 per day. Sergio left Gaza to Namaacha village in the border with Suazilandia to live with his grandmother when his father won a scholarship to study in Germany and disappeared for 10 years. Sergio's mother remarried and lost her life years later, leaving Sergio with the house where he still lives to this day. Sergio has a job at a local bottle company and has been working there full time for the past 4 years, from 7:30pm to 3:30pm and from 3:30pm to 11:30pm, making U$85 per month. He was able to get a piece of land but lacks the money to build a house, so he's asking Hluvuku and Kiva for a U$325 loan. After his house is built he plans on giving his old house to his brother. He's confident he'll pay the loan back in no time.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mr. Soeun S. is a villager who lives in Prey Thum village in the Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Khean Kea, are farmers who own a 3-hectare field and cultivate rice to earn a living. In order to support the farming crops, Mr. Soeun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. With the rest of the loan, he wants to repair his plowing machine. 

This couple has five children, two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory, while two others are farmers who support their parents' farm and the last one is attending the local school. His wife in on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap S. is a 32-year-old married woman who lives in Chheu Teal Phluoh village in the Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Ry Neat, are farmers who own a 2.50-hectare field and cultivate rice. Aside from farming, Mr. Ry Neat owns a trailer for transporting sand to sell. He can earn a small income to support his family. 

Although they try to work hard with their different businesses, they still earn less than they need to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Sopheap S. now is requesting 1,000,000 Riels from AMK, a Kiva partner, to buy five piglets for breeding and pig food. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve the family's living conditions. This couple has two children who all both students in the local school. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy five piglets and pig food

loans.name: Soeun's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Soeun M. is 35 years old and lives in Chheu Teal Phluoh village in Takeo province. She is a fish seller who sells fish door-to-door on her bicycle. She is requesting 500,000 to add to her savings to buy a motorcycle for transportation. Her husband, Mr. Sarith Chroeng, is a construction worker who receives a small salary to help support his family of three children; one is a student in the local school and the other two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra sells bags of cement retail. Demand for her bags of cement is high and she hopes to be able to meet it. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is 35 years old, married with four children who attend a public school in Ughelli, Delta State. She hopes for a loan of N80,000 to buy more bags of cement to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of cement to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a very successful and hard-working woman of 46 who is married with five children. She lives in Lagos where she has had a business selling groceries and drinks for over eight years. She manages the business with the help of her husband. Rose is requesting NGN 140,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell as this will enable her to expand her business and increase her profit. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Finish building

loans.name: Sabougnouma ("a Good Cause") Group

texts.fr:
Sabougnouma est un regroupement de cinq femmes toutes mariées qui vivent dans des familles monogames à Koutiala (région de Sikasso). Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et sont mères d’au moins 4  enfants. 
Elles mènent différentes activités telles la vente de condiments alimentaires, de bois de chauffe et d’habillements.
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant quatre ans. Elles ont leur septième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien  remboursés. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter,  des condiments  et des habits à Bamako. Quant au bois de chauffe, il est acheté au fur et à mesure dans les coins de brousses. Ces  femmes vendent leurs produits à la maison (bois de chauffe) et au marché, en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.  
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 95 000 FCFA. de bénéfice au cours de ce cycle. 
En plus du remboursement du prêt, elles utilisent une partie de leur revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Sabougnouma is a group of five women, all married and living in monogamous families in Koutiala (Sikasso region). On average they are forty years old and mothers of at least four children. They run various businesses, such as selling condiments, firewood, and clothing. To increase the size of their businesses, the group members decided four years ago to become part of Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their seventh solidarity loan (group loan), and all of their previous loans have been fully repaid. This loan will be used to buy condiments and clothing in Bamako. As for the firewood, it will be bought little by little in back country areas. The women sell their products in homes (firewood) and at the market, retail for cash to male and female clients. With this loan, they plan to make an average profit of 95,000 FCFA during the course of this cycle. In addition to repaying the loan, they will use part of their income to meet their everyday family expenses.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of condiments, firewood, and clothing

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru: Махмадзиёев Тохир проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам Тохир занимается строительными работами по найму. Кроме того занимется растениеводством. Он в основном выращивает оващи и вывозит на рынок. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 8 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Tohir M. lives in the Yavan district. He is 36 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife works at a dekhan farm. Tohir does construction work for-hire. Besides this work, he is involved in agriculture. He primarily grows vegetables and brings them to the market. Tohir has been involved in this business for 8 years now. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Rustambek

texts.en:
Born in Istaravshan town in 1941, Rustambek now lives with his wife and their adult children. A teacher by profession, Rustambek is also a farmer. Recognized by the people of the neighborhood as a serious man, Rustambek would like to expand his business into a viable source of income. In order to do that, he needs a loan of 10 000 Somoni to buy seeds and fertilizer to expand his crop. With part of the loan, he will buy young cattle. The income from it will help him cope with the needs of his large family. Rustambek is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle, seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica has a stall where she sells cooked foods. Her customers love her cooked foods and she has high patronage. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is married with seven children and she is 56 years old. Her husband is a civil servant and he supports their home. She hopes to grow her business. She is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Thièyacine

texts.fr:
Monsieur Thiéyacine D. est un chauffeur transporteur depuis 20 ans. Il est très connu dans ce métier et il est l’un des responsables des chauffeurs de la ville de Thiès depuis 1996. Cet homme marié et père de 4 enfants compte dans son actif immobilier 2 voitures (cars de transort en commun) qui font le transport urbain dans la ville de Thiès.
Monsieur D., âgé de 53 ans, est à sa première demande de crédit depuis qu'il est membre de U-IMCEC en 2007. Il compte avec ce financement réfectionner une de ses voitures pour mieux tirer profits du business.
texts.en:
Mr. Thiéyacine D. has been a bus driver for the past 20 years. He is very well known in the business and has been one of the leading drivers of the city of Thies since 1996. He is married with four children, and owns two vehicles (transit buses) that are used for urban transport through Thies. Mr. D., who is 53 years old, is requesting a first loan from U-IMCEC, of which he is a member since 2007. This loan will allow him to overhaul one of his vehicles and profit more from his business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: overhaul his transit bus

loans.name: Lumiere Group

texts.fr:
Etita L. est présidente du groupe Lumière, elle lève sa main sur la photo, cliente au 5e cycle, âgée de 35 ans, mariée, mère de 7enfants parmi lesquels 5 étudient et 2 autres n’ont pas  l’âge scolaire. Son mari exerce le petit commerce.
Elle a commencé son petit commerce avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Son business  est de vendre des produits divers notamment des tricots, assiettes de ménage,vétêments, sous  vétêments, cadénats, ciseaux,torches, etc. Elle s’approvisionne dans la Ville de Goma au centre commercial de Birere et va revendre ces produits à 50 km dans la zone rurale  de Minova. En plus de cet activité , elle vend des tomates, la farine de manioc, farine de maïs, des fretins, des choux,arachides à son domicile. Il y a deux ans qu’elle exerce ces activités.
Avec ce credit de l’IMF Hekima,elle souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant plus des produits divers.
Dans l’avenir  elle souhaite louer un magasin à Goma et eviter le commerce ambulant. Elle projete acheter une parcelle ,scolariser, nourrir confortablement  ses enfants. 
La cliente Etita L. remercie Hekima pour le crédit qu’elle recoit  pour renforcer ses activités commerciales. 
Ce groupe Lumière est composé de 31 membres majoritairement femmes.
texts.en:
Etita L. is the president of the Lumière (Light) group. She is the one who is raising her hand in the group photo. On her fifth loan, Etita is 35 and married, the mother of seven children, among whom five are enrolled in school while two are not yet school-aged. Etita's husband is a small-scale businessman. Etita began her little business with her own money that she received from her husband. Her business is to sell various products, notably jerseys, dishes, other clothes and underwear, padlocks, scissors, flashlights, etc. She buys her merchandise in the town of Goma, at the Birere shopping center, and takes her merchandise to sell about 50 km away, in the rural area surrounding Minova. Besides this business, she sells tomatoes, manioc flour, maize flour, small dried fish, cabbages, and peanuts out of her house. She has been in these two businesses for two years. With the MFI Hekima loan, she hopes to increase her sales by buying $50 worth of jerseys, $100 of dishes, $30 worth of underwear, $30 worth of padlocks, $10 worth of bras, some boxes of razors, and pay for transport costs to and from her supply point. In future she hopes to be able to rent a store in Goma so that she won't have to sell her wares on foot. She would like to be able to buy a plot of land, and to educate and comfortably nourish her children. Our client, Etita L., thanks Hekima for the loan she is to receive which will allow her to expand her commercial activities. This group, 'Lumière,' is composed of 31 members, most of them women.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying goods to expand her business inventory and paying transport costs

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Amaka

texts.en: Amaka is 50 years old and married with nine children. Her children and her husband, who she supports with profits from her business, reside in Lagos, Nigeria. She sells bags and has been in the business for 10 years. She is requesting NGN 100,000 to purchase more bags to sell and increase her profit. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their huge support.

loans.use: To purchase more bags to sell.

loans.name: Fousseyni

texts.fr:
Monsieur Fousseyni C. est agé de 41 ans, marié et père d’une fille. Il réside avec sa famille au quartier Babemba, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Pour des raisons sociales il ne fréquenta pas l'école. Il s’intéressa très vite aux activités génératrices de revenus, notamment le commerce d’articles divers avec l’achat et la vente d’huile alimentaire,  de sel e cuisine, de  spaghetti,  de savons etc, il y a environ 6 ans. 
Il dispose d’une place au nouveau  marché de Médine avec une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes de ménage. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
 Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter, 1 fût d’huile alimentaire, 2 cartons de spaghetti et 1 sac de sel de cuisine. Il s'approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes de  la place, avant de les revendre en détail, au  comptant et à crédit.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Fousseyni C. is 41 years old, married, and father to one girl.
