He lives with his family in the Babemba area, one of the peripheral areas of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). For social reasons, he does not attend school. He quickly became interested in income generating activities, in particular the trade of different items and the purchase and sale of cooking oil, salt, spaghetti, soap and more. It has been about six years. He is in the new Médine market, generally his customers are housewives. He is very sought after because of the quality of his products. To increasingly satisfy his customers, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with which he is on his first individual loan. With this first loan, he will buy one barrel of cooking oil, two cartons of spaghetti, and one bag of salt. He stocks up from wholesalers before reselling by retail, cash, or credit. He envisions a monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA that will be used mainly to increase his business, to contribute to family expenses, and to pay his loan interest.

Translated from French by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase different items for sale.

loans.name: Koura

texts.fr:
Koura Berthé a 63 ans, veuve et mère de 3 enfants. Elle  vit avec ses enfants dans la maison de son défunt  époux à Médine, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 N’ayant pas été à l’école pour des raisons sociales, et après avoir mener plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle décida  finalement de mener l’activité de vente de galette à base de farine de blé depuis plus de vingt ans. 
Afin de mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, elle rentre en collaboration avec l’institution Soro Yiriwaso il y a  cinq ans. Après deux  prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) et deux prêts individuels, elle est à son troisième prêt individuel et tous les prêt précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Elle compte acheter,  8 sacs de farine de blé, 8 bidons d’huile alimentaire, 6 sacs du sel, et 4 sacs de sucre sur place auprès des grossistes. Elle vend ses galettes au grand marché de Sikasso et sa clientèle est composée des femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour résoudre l’essentielle des dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Koura Berthé is 63 years old, a widow and mother of three children. She lives with her children in the home of her deceased husband in Medine, one of the neighborhoods in Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). As she was unable to attend school for social reasons, she then tried her hand at different activities without meeting success, and finally some twenty years ago decided to run a business selling wheat-based pancakes. To increase the satisfaction of her ever increasing customers, she joined Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. After two group loans and two individual loans, all correctly reimbursed, she is now requesting a third individual loan. She intends to buy: 8 bags of wheat flour, 8 containers of vegetable oil, 6 bags of salt, and 4 bags of sugar, all of which will be purchased from local wholesalers. She sells her pancakes at the main market in Sikasso, and her customers are essentially women. With this loan she hopes to reach monthly earnings of 150,000 FCFA, which will be used to deal with the majority of family expenses, reimburse the loan, and reinvest the remainder in her activity.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pour acheter  de farine de blé, de sucre, sel et d’huile d’arachide. Buy wheat flour, sugar, salt and peanut oil.

loans.name: Sitan

texts.fr:
Sitan Diamouténé est une femme mariée de 41 ans et mère de quatre  enfants qui vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Sitan Diamouténé s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la  vente du bois de chauffe et des poissons fumés depuis maintenant 10  ans. Elle réjouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout en hivernage.
Afin de  satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Après cinq prêts individuels tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son sixième prêt individuel qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 5 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso  et 4 cartons de poissons fumés à Gao (7ème région administrative du Mali).
Elle vend les bois de chauffe à domicile et les poissons fumés au marché, en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée.  
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 115 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  réaliser subvenir aux dépenses personnelles, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Sitan Diamouténé is 41 years old, married and mother of four children, and lives with her husband and children in Sanoubougou I, one of the neighborhoods in Sikasso. Ten years ago she became interested in revenue-generating activities, in particular the retailing of firewood and smoked fish. She enjoys a solid reputation in what she does and receives many orders, mostly in winter. To satisfy a demanding and ever-increasing customer base, she called upon Soro Yiriwaso. After five individual loans, all correctly reimbursed, she is now requesting her sixth loan, which will be used to buy five cartloads of firewood from villages in the vicinity of Sikasso, and five boxes of smoked fish from Gao (seventh administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She sells the firewood from her home and retails the smoked fish at the market, for cash or credit to a diversified range of customers. She hopes the loan will help her achieve monthly earnings of 115,000 FCFA, which will serve to cover personal and some family expenses, and pay off the loan. The remainder will be reinvested in the business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood and smoked fish

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en:
I. Mutabar is 46 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two adult children. Mutabar has been running her business for about 14 years. She sells clothes for teenagers and men. Her trading place is located in the local market. Mutabar has taken out several loans from IMON and has proven herself as a reliable client. Today she requests $1500 US Dollars. She is planning to enlarge the range of goods she is selling. Mutabar thanks everyone supporting her and promises to manage the loan as accurately as usual.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Siaka

texts.fr:
Né le 19 Avril 1978 à Sikasso ville, Monsieur Siaka  B.est marié et père de 2 enfants. Il réside avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle avec ses parents et ses frères à Lafiabougou, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Très tôt Monsieur B.s’intéresse aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et  la vente d’articles de quincaillerie. Il dispose une quincaillerie au grand marché de Sikasso où il est très beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, il est à son premier prêt individuel.
 Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter, 10 boîte de colle, 15 cartons baquette, 15 paquets de peintures, 50 mètres de fil, 5 pelles et 5 piquaches. Il s’approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes à Bamako avant de les revendre en détail à une clientèle composée généralement d’entrepreneurs de bâtiments (architectes, ingénieurs, maçons, etc.).
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born 19 April 1978 in Sikasso, Mr. Siaka B.is married and father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in an extended traditional family (along with his parents and brothers) in Lafiabougou, one of the neighborhoods in the periphery of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Quite early Mr. B.became interested in revenue-generating activities, in particular the retail of hardware. He runs a hardware store in Sikasso’s main market, where he is very much in demand due to the quality of his products. To satisfy an increasing number of customers, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso MFI, where he is requesting a first personal loan. With the loan he intends to buy: five boxes of glue, 15 packages of metal rods, 15 boxes of paint, 50 meters of wire, five shovels and five pickaxes. He gets his supplies from wholesalers in Bamako before reselling them to a customer base essentially made up of building contractors (architects, engineers, masons, etc.). He hopes to reach monthly earnings of 200,000 FCFA which will mainly be used to increase his working capital, contribute towards family expenses, and repay his loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hardware items

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a widow with two children. She is 47 years old and sells groceries and drinks in her stall. She loves her business because her customers pay cash when they come to purchase groceries. She does not tolerate credit because she does not want to incur debt in her business. She hopes for a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Tolibboy

texts.en: I. Tolibboy is 53 years old and lives in Istaravshan town with his wife who helps him with the living expenses since she is a shop keeper. Tolibboy has four sons who also help him. For 15 years, Tolibboy has worked his land which produces potatoes and carrots. At the same time, he raises cattle in his house. His greatest dream is to be able to establish more crops so that he can leave equal parts to his children. He started farming when his parents taught him to work in this way. Tolibboy is requesting financing to buy supplies for his crops in order to get a good yield and sell more in the market. With part of the loan, he will also purchase calves. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en:
Iyabo is 40 years old and married with two children. Her husband’s name is Mr. O.; he works very hard to meet his family's needs. She and her family reside in Lagos. She owns a poultry business rearing and selling chickens to make a living. Iyabo has been in the poultry business for 10 years now.

Iyabo hopes for expansion of her poultry business by buying more chickens to rear and sell. She is asking for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more chickens to sell and make more profit. She sends a big thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens to rear and sell

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.en: M. Mavlyuda is 44 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three children. All her children are in school. Mavlyuda's husband is an entrepreneur and his income is not very high. That is why she decided to start her own business so that she could help him cover their living expenses. She is selling kid’s clothing at the local market in Istaravshan city. She is trying to have a wide range of goods to meet the requirements of her customers and to satisfy the needs of clients with different levels of income. Today Mavlyuda requests $1500 USD to purchase additional merchandise to increase the range of her goods. Be an important part in the growth of Mavlyuda’s business! More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing

loans.name: Nolvia

texts.es:
La señora Nolvia B. es Peluquera con mas de 14 años en el rubro  tiene 37  años de edad. Es madre soltera  de 2 hojos que actualmente se encuentran estudiando la secundaria vive    en la ciudad de Encarnación.
Es propietaria de una Peluquería  que atiende en su domicilio . El salón de belleza es atendida por ella misma, gracias, a las actividades que realizan han podido salir adelante e ir creciendo en sus micro-empresas,  además mediante esta y las otras que la familia realiza ellos pueden mantener su hogar, llevar una vida digna y solventar cualquier imprevisto que se le pudiera presentar.  

El destino del crédito es para realizar ampliación y mejora de su local.
texts.en:
Novia B. is a hair-stylist with more than fourteen years of experience in her field. She's thirty-seven, single and has two children currently in middle school. She lives in the city of Encarnación. Novia has a beauty salon in her house, which she runs herself. Thanks to the work they put in, they've been able to succeed and keep growing the small business. Between the salon and other family activities, they are able to maintain their home, live a decent life, and resolve any eventualities that might come up. Novia plans to use her loan to expand and improve her salon.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to improve the shop, including brick, sand, and paint.

loans.name: Okemute

texts.en:
Okemute sells groceries in her stall. She loves her business because her customers pay cash when they come to purchase groceries. She does not tolerate credit because she does not want to incur debt in her business. 

She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more groceries to sell. She is a widow with three children. She is 55 years old. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to lift her business and her family above poverty. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en: At 53 years old, Genoveva wants to be enlightened and find a way to improve her family's standard of living. For this reason, she joined Kiva partner ASHI in 2000, and felt very glad to be given the opportunity of a loan. As a busy entrepreneur, she has been running a sari-sari (variety) store for almost 10 years. Her husband is a fisherman in the neighborhood. Building her business, Genoveva would like to receive a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to increase the inventory of goods sold in her sari-sari store. She is planning to purchase additional products such as sugar, rice, charcoal, canned goods, coffee and other supplies. Genoveva believes that offering a larger assortment of goods to customers will increase revenue from her store and maintain customer fidelity. Her long-terms goals are to provide a better future for her family, sustain the profitability of her store and start a savings account for her children. Through hard work and determination, Genoveva is focused on improving her quality of life through her entrepreneurial initiatives and support from ASHI and Kiva lenders. About ASHI Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom-tier poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase additional products such as sugar, rice, charcoal, canned goods, coffee and other supplies

loans.name: Pir

texts.ru: Олимов Пир проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 48 лет. Женат, имеет 9 детей. У него средне- специальное образование. Более 13 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Сыновья вместе с ним занимаются животноводством. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количества.
texts.en:
Pir O. lives close to Yavan. He is forty-eight years old, married with nine children. He is a trade school graduate. He has been raising cattle for over thirteen years at his home. His sons are involved in the business as well. He is asking for a loan to purchase more cattle to increase the sales of his livestock.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Busayo

texts.en:
Busayo own a grocery store where she sells items like milk, tomato paste, eggs, drinks and more. She manages the business with her family in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

Busayo is requesting a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. Having more goods in her shop attracts more customers, increases her sales and makes more profit. This will enable her to save and reinvest into the business, which will lead to expansion of the business in the future. 

She is 45 years old, married and blessed with three children. They are all doing well and live in Lagos, Nigeria. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their wonderful support.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married and has one grown daughter. She sells women's clothing at the central market in Pavlorad. Nataliya has been in this business for five years. She's got a good location and good quality inventory. 

Nataliya was let go because her company was downsizing. She decided to start her own business to make additional income for the family. Her husband works at a coal mine. Their daughter is a second-year student at college. Nataliya and her husband help their daughter pay for tuition.

Nataliya would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to purchase spring jackets. She has used business loans before and found them very helpful.

loans.use: To purchase spring jackets

loans.name: Gerito Ramos

texts.pt:
Gerito Ramos pimpão nasceu no Distrito da Maganja da Costa, Província de Zambézia, centro de Moçambique tem 41 anos de idade casado e pai de 3 filhos de 9, 7 e 3 anos de idade os 2 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta um sobrinho que vive com ele.
Saiu de Zambézia para Maputo quando foi incorporado no serviço militar obrigatório aos seus 18 anos de idade. 5 Anos depois foi desmobilizado e preferiu incorporar se no Ministério do Interior como Policia de Protecção permanente desde1993. Não possui nenhum empregado, tem um salário mensal de 4.030.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua conta bancária.
Já teve empréstimos na cooperativa de crédito TCHUMA e decidiu não continuar devido a vários motivos. Conheceu a Hluvuku pela simples curiosidade de entender os moldes de empréstimos. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com ampliação da sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt para os dois e ambos para a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais emprestimos para adquirir uma viatura, para ajudar no transporte pessoal.
texts.en:
Gerito Ramos Pimpão was born in Maganja da Costa District in Zambezia, center of Mozambique. He is 41, married and the father of three children ages 9, 7 and 3, the two older ones go to school. He finished 8th grade himself, but had to drop school for financial reasons. He lives in his own house with his family and also supports a nephew that lives with them. Gerito left Zambezia for Maputo when he was drafted into the army at 18. Five years later he left the army and became a policeman, activity he's been performing since 1993. He makes U$145 per month and he's able to support his household and save some in a savings account. This is Gerito's third loan in the amount of $475 which he'll use to buy construction supplies (cement, iron and others) in order to fix his house. His previous loans where for the same purpose. He hopes to pay this back on time and get another loan in the future in order to buy a car.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies

loans.name: Yoribek

texts.en:
Born in 1949, Yoribek is married and the father of three adult children. Although he is primarily a farmer, he also raises animals, a sideline that he feels passionate about. Selling animals he has raised is his special source of income. However, Yoribek raises his animals in the traditional fashion, which does not provide much in the way of financial returns. Interested in modernizing his operation to earn more from it, Yoribek would like to build a pen for his animals and also add other cattle to his flocks. Accomplishing this will allow him to increase his income and better provide for his family.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To build a pen and purchase cattle

loans.name: Mable

texts.en:
Mable Mourine M. is 45 years old and married to a plumber. They have four children, whom they hope to educate to the university level. 

Mable's business is located at Mutuli, a quiet place with minimal competition in Kakamega. She has been selling such items as detergent, soft drinks, parrafin and more, for the past ten years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable, but the major challenge she has is debtors not being able to pay on time. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more general use items in order to expand her business. She hopes to open a supermarket in future. She is very hardworking, ambitious and welcoming.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, cooking oil, flour, etc., to expand her business

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia L. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more cassava flour and rice in the restaurant.  Silvia is 39 years old and is married to a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more cassava flour and rice

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is 40 years old and married with five children. Her children are doing well in school. She is a hardworking and friendly woman. She sells groceries and loaves of bread to make a living. She loves her business and family dearly and she hopes to help her husband meet the basic needs of her family. She hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more groceries and loaves of bread to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and loaves of bread to sell.

loans.name: Pathé

texts.fr:
Monsieur Pathé S. est un mécanicien qui s’est converti en commerçant boutiquier. Il a commencé à gérer la boutique de son oncle en 1995 et menait paraléllement une activité d'aviculture à coté. Et  6 ans après, il met sur place sa propre alimentation générale, une boutique située à Cité Senghor un quartier de Thiès. C’est à ce moment qu’il bénéficie pour la première fois un prêt au niveau de U-IMCEC qu’il a payé sans aucun problème.
 Ainsi, pour renforcer son capital et augmenter ses revenus, il demande à nouveau un prêt de 300 000 FCFA afin de s’approvisionner en marchandises pour la boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Pathé S. is a former mechanic who reconverted to retail commerce. He began running his uncle’s store in 1995 and had a side business raising chickens. Six years later, he inaugurated his own general store, located in Cité Senghor, a neighborhood of Thies. At that time he was granted a first loan from U-IMCEC, which was reimbursed without problems. To strengthen his working capital and increase his earnings, he is requesting another loan for 300,000 FCFA to stock up on supplies for his store.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock up on supplies for his store

loans.name: Herminia Agostinho

texts.pt:
Hermínia Agostinho S. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 28 anos de idade viúva e mãe de 2 filhos de 10 e 3 anos de idade, o mais velho vai a escola. Fez somente 6ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e sustenta ainda sua irmã que vive com ela.
Nunca saiu da sua cidade natal, estudou e casou se na Matola. Tem um negócio próprio nesta zona há mais de 10 anos, não possui nenhum empregado. Vende mais colares de ouro, fatos para homens e roupa para crianças, neste negócio consegue um rendimento de cerca de 8.000.00mt a 10.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de u ma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (fatos para homens, colares de ouro, roupa para crianças e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt, para a mesma actividade.
Compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aquisição de uma viatura para ajudar no transporte da sua mercadoria.
texts.en:
Hermínia Agostinho S. was born in Matola, Maputo Province, south of Mozambique. She is a 28 year old widow and the mother of two children ages 10 and 3, the first one goes to school. She finished 6th grade but had to drop school for financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her children and also supports a sister that lives with them. She never left her hometown, went to school and got married in Matola. She has her own business in the area for the past 10 years, and has no employees. She sells gold chains, men's suits and children's clothing, and makes between U$280 and U$350 per month, which she uses to support her household and save some. She's never asked for a loan with other agencies and heard of Hluvuku through a friend. This is her second loan with Hluvuku and she's asking for U$475 in order to buy more merchandise to improve her business. Her previous loan was for U$350 for the same purpose. She's committed to pay it back on time so she can ask for other loans. In the future she would like to get another loan to buy a car to help with her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for reselling

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
R. Alisher is 33 years old. He is married with three children. He is a strong and brave man who finished secondary school but who, at not being able to continue with his education, dedicated himself to working. This is how, for five years now, his business has been the purchase and sale of livestock, which he offers at the Sunday market where he takes his animals. He has always liked the countryside, and being close to nature is very gratifying for him. The difficulty arises in transporting his livestock, but Alisher isn’t discouraged by this and works very hard to fulfill his dreams. He wants financial stability, so he can educate all his children. With this loan, Alisher hopes to acquire more heads of cattle to help generate additional income, as he would like to start another business, which he is still analyzing and deciding on.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Iponde

texts.en:
Iponde J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Iponde is 35 years old and is a widow. She has two children who do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store at the market.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Esperanca

texts.pt:
Esperança N. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 45 anos de idade divorciada e mãe de 4 filhos de 23, 21, 12 e 9 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 6ą classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e sustenta ainda uma neta de 3 anos de idade que vive com ela.
Saiu da Matola para a cidade de Maputo quando casou se, tendo fixado sua residência com o marido em Maputo. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 20 anos, não possui nenhum empregado conta apenas com ajuda de seus filhos. Vende mais açúcar, peixe, frangos e óleo, onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum com as amigas através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Já teve empréstimo na associação KANIMAMBO decidiu não continuar devido a vários motivos. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de conversas com amigas que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (açúcar, rachel, peixe, frangos, jam, óleo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a mais outros. Sonha em ter uma mercearia própria, vai solicitar mais empréstimos para habitação.
texts.en:
Esperança N. was born in Matola, Maputo province, south of Mozambique. She is 45 years old, divorced and the mother of four children ages 23, 21, 12 and 9, all students. She finished 6th grade but had to drop school for lack of financial help. She lives in her own house with her children and also supports a 3 year old grandaughter that lives with them. She left Matola for Maputo when she got married, and has had her own business for the past 20 years. She doesn't have any employees but her children help her out. She sells sugar, fish, chicken, oil and other items and is able to make around U$370 per month, which she uses to pay household expenses and save some. She learned about Hluvuku through friends that are clients. This is her first loan in the amount of U$475, and she'll use it to buy more merchandise (sugar, fish, chicken, jam, oil and others) to improve her business. She's committed to pay the loan back on time and hopes to get more loans in the future, as she dreams of having her own grocery shop one day.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Phelomina

texts.en:
Phelomina A. cooks banku (locally called by the Fante’s as 'etiw') and fried fish to sell at Elmina. She is married and has been blessed with two children. She has been through junior high education. Phelomina has been selling banku with fried fish for some time now. Her husband is into wood work production. Phelomina uses her income generated from her banku business to help her husband take care of the home. Phelomina will add the loan to her income to purchase bags of maize for banku to be able to meet the demands of her customers. With the new profits that may accrue from her expanded business, Phelomina plans to reinvest back into her business. 

To prepare her banku, she makes sure she gets her corn dough. (Maize that has been milled and left for a day. usually after milling, is not used immediately but left until the following day before it can be used.) and cassava dough. She makes a mixture with the cassava and corn dough in a porridge form, stirring on fairly hot heat for sometime to get a firm but fine texture, a texture firm enough to be eaten. The accompanying dish can either be any kind of soup or sauce of your taste such as palm nut soup, groundnut soup or peanut soup, okra soup, hot pepper sauce with fish of any kind.

loans.use: To purchase maize for banku

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero sells mouth-watering Nigerian cooked foods. Her customers love her cooked foods and she has high patronage. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is married with six children and she is 45 years old. Her husband is a civil servant and he supports their home. She hopes to grow her business. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Horacio Inacio

texts.pt:
Horácio Inácio L. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo, vizinho com o reino da Suazilândia tem 38 anos de idade casado e pai de 4 filhos de 18, 08, 06 e 02 anos de idade, os 3 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez 9ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta um primo que vive com ele.
Nunca saiu do Distrito, iniciou sua actividade comercial muito jovem. Tem um negócio próprio de produção de Hortícolas, onde conta com dois empregados que lhe auxiliam nos trabalhos de lavoura. Produz mais repolho e pimenta e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 13.800.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (insecticidas, sementes, fertilizantes e outros) para aplicar na sua machamba. O emprestimo anterior foi no valor de 10.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar no melhoramento do seu negócio e ampliação das áreas de cultivo.
texts.en:
Horácio Inácio L. was born in Namaacha, Maputo province, in the border with Suazilandia. He is 38 years old, married and the father of 4 children ages 18, 8, 6 and 2, the three older ones go to school. He finished 9th grade but had to drop school due to lack of financial help. He lives in his own house with his family and also supports a cousin that lives with them. He never left the District and started his business at a very young age. He has his own business planting vegetables, and has two employees that help him out with farm work. He grows cabbage and pepper and makes around U$185 per month, which he uses to support his household and save some. He's never taken loans with other agencies and heard of Hluvuku through friends that are clients. This is his second loan with Hluvuku in the amount of U$450, which he will use to buy products he needs like fertilizers, seeds and so on and invest in his business. His previous loan was used for the same thing. He hopes to get more loans in the future to keep improving his business and expanding his farming land.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of farming products

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack O. O. is 30 old, married and has three children who are all in primary school. His business is located at Manyatta estate, a highly populated and busy market in Kisumu. He sells dining tables, coffee tables, wall units and couches. He has been doing this business for six years now and has two employees. 

Shadrack says that this business is profitable. The major challenge he has is limited space to display his products. He is using his loan of Kes 60,000 to buy more timber to grow his business. He hopes to produce in large scale and open up a display center in Kibuye, Kisumu. He is very hardworking, humble and reliable.

loans.use: To purchase timber in order to expand his business

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
La señora Delfina C. V. tiene 49 años y estuvo casada por más de 20 años pero su esposo la abandono y ahora vive sola. Tiene 2 hijos para los cuales saco un préstamo para poder comprarles un equipo de soldadura y así puedan trabajar. La señora Delfina vive en la comunidad de Maica Sud en Cochabamba, donde tiene 3 vacas, cuya leche utiliza para elaborar queso y venderlo en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Cochabamba y a las vendedoras de Charque (un plato tradicional de Cochabamba que se come acompañado con queso). La señora Delfina se dedica a elaborar queso hace más de 32 años.

Con el crédito otorgado por kiva el año pasado la señora Delfina pudo comprar alimento para su ganado lechero (Challa) que por problemas de sequia el costo de la misma subió mucho y no le alcanzaba para comprar todo el alimento que sus vacas necesitaban. De este modo no tuvo problemas de seguir produciendo la misma cantidad de leche que ya produce y la cantidad de queso. La señora Delfina espera poder obtener este nuevo préstamo para poder comprar una vaca lechera y aumentar su producción de leche y así sus ingresos, y agradece mucho a la gente que por medio se kiva confió en ella y le dio la oportunidad de superarse.
texts.en:
Delfina C. V. is forty-nine and was married for more than twenty years, but her husband left her, so now she lives by herself. She has two children, for whom took out a loan to buy welding equipment so they could work. She lives in the Maica Sud community in Cochabamba. She has three cows, and uses their milk to make cheese, which she sells in the different markets in the city of Cochabamba as well as to the people who sell Charque (a traditional Cochababma dish, eaten with cheese). Delfina has been making cheese for more than thirty-two years. With the loan she received through Kiva last year, Delfina was able to buy food (corn husks) for her milk cows. Due to drought, prices increased significantly and she wasn't able to buy all the food her cows needed. With the loan, she had no problem continuing to produce the same amount of milk and, accordingly, cheese. Delfina hopes she'll be able to get this loan to buy a milk cow so she can increase milk production and with it her income. She really appreciates the people who, through Kiva, have put their trust in her and given her the opportunity to better herself.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is single and has received no formal education. Mary sells spices, onions, canned tomatoes, beef and other food supplies at Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now. Mary uses her income from her sales to pay for her rented apartment and electricity bills. The loan, which will serve as additional capital, will be used to purchase provisions for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to build a house for herself.

loans.use: To purchase provisions for sale.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina sells tubers of yam and has been in this business for nine years. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is 47 years old and married with two children. One of her children is a graduate while the other child is still in school. Regina has been using the proceeds of her business to support her family and to reinvest in her business.

Regina hopes to become a major supplier of tubers of yam. She is requesting a loan of NGN100,000 to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She says thanks to all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Rakai

texts.en:
Rakai C. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnut paste at the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more groundnuts to make paste to sell.  Rakai is 41 years old and is married to a builder. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more groundnuts to make paste to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is indeed happy that she cooks and sells cassava dough. This is a staple food in Nigeria, which comes from cassava. She sells cassava dough in an open area in the market.

Rosemary is 44 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a farmer and he also supports the home. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more cassava to cook more dough to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava

loans.name: Deisy Virginia

texts.es:
Deisy tiene 27 años de edad ella vive con su mama la señora Francisca L. y su hermano que tiene Síndrome de Down, ellos viven en Esquilan Chico al sud Carretera a Quillacollo que es una provincia de Cochabamba.

Deisy es una muchacha trabajadora que se dedica  a producción de leche y la elaboración de quesillo junto con su madre, ella trabaja desde que era una niña colaborando para ayudar en la educación de su hermano ya que en nuestro país es algo ignorado las personas que tienen síndrome de Down son personas rechazadas a las cuales no les brinda la atención para poderlos ayudar a salir adelante ya que los centros de ayuda son en la ciudad los cuales se les hace muy lejos para la doña Francisca el poderle llevar y que le ayuden a su hijo es por esa razón que Deisy tuvo que dejar la escuela y poder trabajar para ayudar a su madre porque el papa murió en un accidente de tránsito en la cual ellos quedaron solos y la madre de Deisy es una persona ya mayor y ella tiene que hacerse cargo de su hermano como también de madre al ser la única responsable de su familia y tratarle de ayudar  ella es una persona que le duele el haberlo dejado la escuela porque ella soñaba con estudiar  medicina para saber el porqué su hermano tenía ese problema la situación en la cual se encuentra Deisy es muy triste porque ella tiene que ser la responsable de su hermano.

Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de soya para poder aumentar la producción de leche y la elaboración de quesillo y teniendo más ingresos podrá ofrecerle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida y seguir con el apoyo constante a su hermano y  tal vez en un futuro ella tiene la esperanza de terminar el colegio ella no sueña con tener su propia familia porque no quiere que le lastimen a su hermano ella lo quiere mucho porque él es un muchacho muy tierno y ayuda en la casa con las vacas y a veces se va a cortar alfa con su madre a quien quiere mucho y no la deja sola.
texts.en:
Deisy is 27 years old. She lives with her mother, Francisca L., and her brother, who has Down syndrome. They live in Esquilan Chico to the south of the road to Quillacollo, which is a province in Cochabamba. Deisy is a hard-working girl, who devotes herself to milk production and making “quesillo” (soft cheese) with her mother. She has worked since she was a girl. She was contributing in order to help with her brother’s education. In our country it is ignored. People with Down syndrome are rejected. They are not offered the help they need to get ahead. The help centers are in the city. It is very far for Francisca to be able to take him there for help. That is the reason that Deisy had to leave school to be able to work to help her mother. Her father died in a transit accident, and they were left alone. Deisy’s mother is elderly. Deisy has to be in charge of her brother, like a mother, as she is the only responsible person in her family. She tries to help him. It hurts her to have left school because she dreamed of studying medicine in order to know why her brother has this problem. Deisy is very sad to be in this situation because she has to be responsible for her brother. She is requesting a loan to buy soy in order to be able to increase the milk production and the making of quesillo. Having more income will allow her to offer her family a better standard of living and to keep up her constant support of her brother. She hopes that in the future she might be able to finish school. She does not dream of having her own family because she does not want to hurt her brother. She loves him a lot because he is a very affectionate boy. He helps at home with the cows, and sometimes he goes to cut alfalfa with their mother. He loves her a lot and does not leave her alone.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food for dairy cows (soy)

loans.name: Maria Francisco

texts.pt:
Maria Francisca Pereira de S. Évora nasceu na cidade de Pemba, Província de Cabo Delgado, norte de Moçambique tem 39 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 3 filhos de 18, 15 e 10 anos de idade, todos vã a escola. Frequenta a faculdade prestes para a sua defesa. Vive numa casa de aluguer com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Pemba para Maputo com intenção de viajar para Inglaterra, depois de não ter concretizado o objectivo principal, resolveu ficar na cidade de Maputo e arranjar um emprego. Trabalha no restaurante Nautilus há mais de 2 anos, possui uma empregada que lhe auxilia nos trabalhos de casa. Para alem de trabalhar conta com um negócio de criação de frangos de corte. Aufere um salário mensal de 4.070.00mt e um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt após a venda de seus frangos, onde aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Já teve um empréstimo no banco PROCREDIT, mais tarde decidiu não continuar por vários motivos. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua amiga que é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 26.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (ração para pintos e vitaminas) para desenvolver o seu negócio.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimo para ampliar ainda mais o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Maria Francisca Pereira de S. Évora was born in Pemba, Cabo Delgado province, north of Mozambique. She is 39 years old, divorced and the mother of three children ages 18, 15 and 10, all of them students. She goes to university and is about to get a degree. She lives in a rented house with her children and doesn't support anyone else. Maria left Pemba to go to Maputo in the hopes of traveling to England, but that dream never came through so she set foot in the city and got a job. She works at the Nautilus restaurant for the past 2 years and has a maid who helps with her household work. Besides the restaurant job, she also has a her own chick raising business. She makes about U$360 in her job plus an extra U$400 by selling her chicken, and she uses the money to support her household and save some. She's had a loan with the bank Procredit before but decided to go with Hluvuku this time, which she heard of through a friend. This is her first loan with the institution and she'll use the money to buy chick ration and vitamins to improve the quality of her chicken and grow her business. She is committed to pay it back on time so she can ask for future loans to keep improving her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chicken food and vitamins

loans.name: Ludia

texts.en:
Ludia M. is currently in the business of selling dried fish at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more dried and fresh fish to sell.  Ludia is 40 years old and is a widow. She has four children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy some cows to raise at home. 

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more dried and fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola is 51 years old, married with four children and lives in Lagos, Nigeria. She is hard working and very supportive to her husband in keeping the home. Some of her children are still in school and some are out of school. 

Bola operates a restaurant. She sells drinks, pepper soup and cooked food. She does this business to sustain herself and her family. She has been in the business for over 12 years. Her husband is a businessman who also works to meet his financial responsibilities at home. 

Bola is a member of LAPO microfinance with a good record. She hopes to expand her business by buying more drinks and food items to cook and sell. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and food to sell.

loans.name: Fatima Maria

texts.pt:
Fátima Maria da Gloria M. nasceu na cidade de Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 33 anos de idade casada e mãe de 3 filhos de 14, 7 e 3 anos de idade, os mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 9ą classe, parou devido a casamento prematuro e o seu esposo não a deixava ir a escola. Vive na casa própria com sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Nunca saiu da cidade natal, conheceu o seu marido e construíram o lar juntos no mesmo bairro. Tem um negocio próprio há a mais de 3 anos, possui 2 empregados que lhe auxiliam no seu negocio. Para alem deste conta com um mini restaurante na cidade da Matola que está a alugar, consegue um rendimento de cerca de 10.000.00mt a 12.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que já são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cervejas, refrescos, vinhos e outros) para reforçar a mercadoria do seu estabelecimento.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para poder aplicar na construção de um bar.
texts.en:
Fátima Maria da Gloria M. was born in Matola, Maputo province, south of Mozambique. She is 33 years old, married and the mother of three children ages 14, 7 and 3, the two older ones go to school. She finished 9th grade but had to drop school when she got married and her husband didn't let her study. She lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else. She never left her hometown and met her husband there. She has had her own business for the past 3 years and has two employees that help her out. In the top of that she has a mini-restaurant in Matola that is rented, and she makes between U$360 and U$450 per month, which she uses in household expenses and is able to save some. She's never had loans in other institutions and heard of Hluvuku through friends that are already clients. This is her first loan and she's asking for U$800 so she can buy food products and beverages to resell. She is committed to pay it back on time so she can take other loans and hopes to open her own bar in the future.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food and beverages for reselling

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is married. She sells clothing at one of the small markets in Zaporozhye city. Elena has been in this business for 10 years. She enjoys selling women's clothing very much. Her clients see that and come back. Elena would like to borrow 6,000 UAH to increase her assortment of clothing. Her goal is to develop her business further and open a second location.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Geraldo Francisco

texts.pt:
Geraldo Francisco C. nasceu no Distrito de Zavala, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique tem 39 anos de idade casado e pai de 4 filhos de 16, 12, 9 e 2 anos de idade, os três mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 6ą classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta um sobrinho que vive com ele.
Saiu de Zavala para Maputo em Boane no ano de 1988, devido a guerra de destabilização. Fixou sua residência neste Distrito e trabalha numa estação de reparação de Pneus há mais de 18 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário mensal de 2.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa, e por vezes poupa algo em sua casa.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo no valor de 20.800.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, varões de ferro, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 7.500.00mt, 15.000.00mt, 25.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para terminar com a sua obra e compra de uma viatura a leasing.
texts.en:
Geraldo Francisco C. was born in the Zavala district, Inhambane province, south of Mozambique. He is 39 years old, married and the father of four children ages 16, 12, 9 and 2, the three older ones go to school. He only studied until the 6th grade and couldn't go on due to financial difficulties. He lives in his own house with his family and also supports a nephew that lives with him. Geraldo left Zavala for Maputo in 1988 during the civil war. He fixed residency in the District and works at a tire shop for the past 18 years. He has no employees and makes around U$55 per month, which he uses in household expenses and sometimes saves some. He's never taken loans in other banks and this is his 5th loan with Hluvuku in the amount of U$675, which he will use to buy construction supplies (cement, iron, sand and others) to finish building his house. His previous loans were all for the same purpose. In the future he would like to ask for other loans in order to finish building his house and buy a car.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel has his business in two phases. He drives for commercial purposes in the morning, and in the evening he does his restaurant business with his wife. These businesses have enabled him to meet the basic needs of his family. Gabriel is 41 years old and married with four children. His children are in a primary school and they are doing well. 

Gabriel hopes to overhaul his car. He believes this will make his car more attractive to customers. He also wants to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. He needs the loan of NGN150,000 to achieve this purpose. He thanks all his lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and overhaul his car

loans.name: Mujeres En Progreso Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Santo Domingo  surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona . Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser :  kiosko, peluquería, copetín, venta de mercaderías comestibles en forma ambulante, venta de ropas, venta de trabajos artesanales y manuales, cada una se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que vienen realizando y se sienten muy comprometidas con el comité que todas integran.
Las señoras comentan que mediante esta actividad que realizan con el comité ellas pueden salir de la rutina de cada día que las mismas llevan en sus casas, y eso les hace sentir muy bien, ademas todas aprenden cosas nuevas como hacer una planificación, presupuesto y ahorros. Ellas agradecen por las capacitaciones y los créditos que reciben.   
Una de la integrantes es la señora Fermina, ella es peluquera hace vaR. años, estudio esta profesión muy joven, y luego de unos años pudo abrir su propio salón, en un primer momento solo alquilaba, luego de casarse pudo abrir en su casa donde hasta ahora tiene atiende a sus clientas.
Los trabajos que ella realiza son muy admiradas por sus clientas, quienes constantemente solicitan su servicios.
Ella agradece el crédito ya que lo destinará en la mejora de las atenciones de sus clientes comprando secadoras, y otras herramientas de trabajo.
texts.en:
The Santo Domingo group emerged through promotions in the area. All of the women engage in productive activities like a kiosk, beauty salon, snack bar, selling food as a street vendor, selling clothes, and selling handicrafts. Each one is very satisfied with the work they do. They feel very committed to their communal bank. The women comment that through their work with the communal bank they are able to leave their daily routines in their houses. This makes them feel very good. Also, all of them are learning new things like how to make a plan, a budget, and savings. They are grateful for the trainings and the loans they receive. Fermina is one of the members. She has been a hairdresser for several years. She studied this profession when she was very young. After a few years she was able to open her own salon. At first she just rented. After getting married she was able to open in her house, where she still waits on her customers. Her customers really admire her work, and they constantly request her services. She is grateful for the loan. She will use it to improve customer service by purchasing dryers and other work tools.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dryers and creams for her hair salon

loans.name: Xavier Rodrigues

texts.pt:
Xavier Rodrigues G. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, Sul de Moçambique tem 49 anos de idade casado e pai de 8 filhos de 27, 24, 20, 18, 14, 11, 7, 5 anos de idade, destes 4 vão a escola. Fez somente 7ą classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu da cidade de Maputo para Boane, a procura de emprego, mais tarde fixou sua residência e casou se. Tem um negócio próprio por mais de 2 anos, possui uma empregada e conta também com ajuda dos filhos. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum no Banco BARCLAYS.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus companheiros que também são clientes da instituição já a longo tempo. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, refrescos, hamburgueses e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para expandir ainda mais o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Xavier Rodrigues G. was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name, in the south of Mozambique. He is 49 years old, and is a married father of 8 children, who are ages 27, 24, 20, 18, 14, 11, 7, and 5. Four of his children attend school. Xavier only finished 7th grade himself and was unable to continue due to lack of finances. He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone else.

He left Maputo for Boane to look for a job, and later secured his housing and married. He has had his own business for more than 2 years. He has one employee and also counts on the help of two of his children. He earns a monthly income of about 5,000MT, which he uses to pay for his household expenses and he is also able to save some in his Barclays account.

He's never had a loan through another bank. He came to know Hluvuku through his colleagues who are also long-time clients of the institution. This is his 2nd loan, for the amount of 20,000MT, and he plans to use this loan to purchase products (beer, soft drinks, hamburgers, and others) to increase the quantity of merchandise he offers. He promises to make his loan repayments dutifully so that he may access future loans to expand his business even further.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of products like beer, soft drinks, hamburgers, and others

loans.name: Ilda

texts.es:
La señora Ilda tiene 34 años está casada con el señor Néstor Quiroz y tienen 3 hijos, son una familia de escasos recursos económicos ya que actualmente no tienen casa propia y viven en una casa en la cual doña Ilda trabaja cuidando dicha casa por la cual recibe un pequeño pago mensualmente.

Doña Ilda y su familia viven en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la localidad de Viloma Grande, su principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda cuyo producto venden a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos, actualmente solo cuenta con 3 cabezas de ganado lechero y también tiene yuntas los cuales alquila para el arado de la tierra, doña Ilda es muy trabajadora que se dedica a varias actividades más entre las cuales también vende alfa alfa y el esposo se dedica al servicio de la construcción , trabaja como contratista en la misma zona.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero con lo cual incrementara el nivel de producción de la leche y mejorara el nivel de ingresos. Entre sus sueños y metas es ofrecer una casa a sus hijos y una educación hasta que tengan una carrera profesional.Doña Ilda ya cuenta con un terreno la cual le heredo su padre y su meta ahora es construir una hermosa casa la cual cuente con habitaciones para  sus tres hijos ya que en la casa donde viven solo tienen 2 habitaciones y se encuentran muy incómodos.
texts.en:
Ilda is 34, married to Néstor Quiroz, and has three children. Their family has scant economic resources. They currently do not have their own house. Ilda works taking care of the house in which they live. She receives a small monthly payment. Ilda and her family live in the city of Cochabamba in Viloma Grande. Her main activity is the production of raw milk. She sells her production to a business that makes dairy products. She currently only has three heads of dairy cows. She also has a team that she rents to plow the land. Ilda is a very hard-worker, and she does several other activities. One of those activities is selling alfalfa. Her husband works in construction. He works as a contractor in the same area. The loan is to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production and improve earnings. Among her dreams and goals is giving her children a home and an education until they have a professional career. Ilda has a piece of land that she inherited from her father. Her goal now is to build a beautiful house with rooms for her three children. The house they live in only has two rooms, and they are very uncomfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza S. is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal at wholesale and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Eliza is 47 years old and is married to a watchman. She has six children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent sells groceries, foodstuffs and drinks. He hopes to grow his business in the future. He is also a farmer. With this business, he hopes to meet the basic needs of his family. He is 48 years old and married with six children. 

He hopes for a loan of NGN 70,000 to buy groceries, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase groceries, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Jeremias Valentim

texts.pt:
Jeremias Valentim N. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo, sul de Moçambique tem 35 anos de idade casado e pai de 3 filhos de 16, 14, 10 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 9ą classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Nunca mudou de cidade, apenas saiu de um bairro para outro quando formou a sua família. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 8 anos, conta com 2 empregados que lhe ajudam no seu negocio. Consegue um rendimento de rendimento de cerca de 9.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Já teve empréstimo com o Banco Oportunidade e decidiu não continuar, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é seu 2º empréstimo no valor 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, refrescos e outros) para reforçar a sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 12.000.00mt para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na obra de construção da sua residência e aplicar outros no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Jeremias Valentim N. was born in the city and province of Maputo, which is in the south of Mozambique. He is 35 years old, and is married with 3 children who are 16, 14, and 10 years old. All of his children attend school. He attended through 9th grade himself, but did not continue due to a lack of finances. He lives in his own home with his family and does not support anyone else. He never moved from the city, but he did move from one neighborhood to another when he started his family.

He has had his own business for more than 8 years and he has two employees who help him. He earns a monthly income of about 9,000MT which he uses to pay for his household expenses and saves some to his bank account. He had a previous loan with the Banco Oportunidade, but decided not to continue with them. He came to know Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his second loan, for 20,000MT, and he plans to use it to purchase products (beer, soft drinks, and others) to reinforce his merchandise. The previous loan was for 12,000MT and was used for the same purpose. He promises to make his repayments dutifully so that he may take out other loans. In the future he would like to use additional loans for construction in his home and for his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of products like beer, soft drinks, and others

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Protector 4 Group

texts.en:
Marilourde is the coordinator of her group Jehova es mi Protector (God is my protector), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the slums surrounding Santiago, a large city known for its tobacco and beef industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children.

Marilourde is excited to be taking her second loan from Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business buying large packages of assorted used clothing that come from places like the Salvation Army in the United States and selling them in her community at a profit. She will use the profits to invest in her family by purchasing school supplies and in her business by saving towards the day when she can have her own shop, and not have to sell her wares in the street. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more packages of used clothing

loans.name: Nawuli

texts.en:
Nawuli M. is currently in the business of selling and brewing local alcohol and is requesting a loan to stock more brewing materials like yeast, pipes, etc to brew more alcohol.  Nawuli is 40 years old and is a widow. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a family house and pay the school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more brewing materials

loans.name: Octavio Joaquin

texts.es:
El señor Octavio V.  tiene 60 años de edad, esta casado  viven en  la ciudad de Encarnación.
Es propietario de un negocio de decoración y ventas de alfombras y es atendida por el mismo. Es una Persona muy   trabajadora y gracias a las actividades que realizan han podido salir adelante e ir creciendo en sus micro-empresa.
El negocio ofrece diferentes servicio ya que además de vender los artículos decorativos también hacer decoraciones de salones para fiestas de quinceaños, cumpleaños infantiles y casamientos.
Agradece a la Fundación y Kiva por crédito ya que mediante el pude completar algunos artículos que hacían falta en el negocio como las telas que utilizan en las decoraciones, así como jarrones, flores y otros.




.
texts.en:
Octavio V. is 60 years old, married, and lives in the city of Encarnación. He is the owner of a decoration and carpet store which he runs himself. He is a very hardworking person and thanks to the business that he has, they have been able to move forward and continue growing in their micro-business.

The business offers different services, since in addition to selling decorative items, he also makes room decorations for 15th birthday parties, children’s birthday parties, and weddings.

He thanks the Foundation and Kiva for the loan, since through this, he could purchase a few items that he was missing in the business such as the fabrics that they use for the decorations, such as vases, flowers, and others.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as colored fabrics, paintings, artificial flowers, vases, and others

loans.name: Ezelina

texts.pt:
Ezelina cochissano B. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 33 anos de idade divorciada e mãe de 4 filhos de 16, 10, 7 e 4 anos de idade, os 3 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 7ą classe, parou devido a gravidez precoce. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Nunca saiu de Boane, toda a sua vida foi neste Distrito. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 15 anos, conta com ajuda de uma empregada que lhe auxilia no seu trabalho. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 7.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu vizinho que já é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a obra da sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 15.300.00mt, 20.000.00mt e 20.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na ampliação do seu negócio e na vedação da sua residência.
texts.en:
Ezelina cochissano B. was born in the Boane district of the Maputo province, which is in the south of Mozambique. She is 33 years old and is a divorced mother of four children, ages 16, 10, 7, and 4. The three eldest children attend school. She only attended school through 7th grade herself and stopped because of a teen pregnancy. She lives in her own home with her children and she does not support anyone else. She has never left Boane - she has lived her whole life in this district.

She has had her own business for more than 15 years and she has one employee who helps her. She earns about 7,000MT per month which she uses to pay for household expenses and to save to her bank account. She has never taken a loan with another bank. She came to know Hluvuku through her neighbor who was already a client of the institution. This is her fourth loan and is for the amount of 20,000MT. She plans to use this to purchase construction materials (cement, iron, sand, stone, and others) to continue work on her home. The previous loans were for 15,300MT, 20,000MT, and 20,000MT and were all used for the same purpose. In the future she would like to take out more loans to grow her business and to protect her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Yulia

texts.en:
Yulia is married and has two small children. She sells women's clothing at Tsentralniy department store in Novaya Kahovka. Her working capital is 30,000 UAH and her monthly income is about 5,000 UAH.
Yulia started this business 6 years ago because her family was in need. She began selling clothing and really liked it. Eventually, she was able to rent some space at the department store.
