Since that time her business has been even better. Today it is a stable additional source of income for her growing family.
Yulia would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to increase the assortment of her inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and to receive additional income.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La señora Herminia M. es una señora con 42 años, apenas estudio hasta tercer curso de primaria, tiene 3 hijos, todos son pequeños, tienen 12, 7 y 2 años. Herminia y sus hijos  viven en Vilomilla zona de Sipe-Sipe. Su esposo los abandono hace un año.

La señora Herminia se dedica a la producción de leche pues tiene sus vacas, de las cuales ordeña leche y hace quesillo, para vender a sus vecinos, además se la producción eventual de haba, en su casita que le ayudan a sustentar su hogar y a sus pequeños hijitos. Las condiciones en las que viven son precarias, tienen una casita con dos habitaciones, su ganado en la misma propiedad. La señora Herminia se encarga de la alimentación, la educación y la salud de sus hijos, y realiza todas sus actividades con su pequeña de dos años. 

La señora Herminia solicita el crédito para poder mejorar la infraestructura para su ganado, y alimento balanceado de modo que sus vacas le produzcan más leche; la señora quiere cuidar su fuente de ingresos, por eso ha solicitado dicho crédito. La visión que tiene la señora Herminia es ver a sus hijos crecer sanos y fuertes, responsables trabajadores como ella lo es, poder tener mejores condiciones de vida, un casa con mejores comodidades, y siempre capaces de poder enfrentar cualquier dificultad que la vida les ponga en frente.
texts.en:
Herminia M. is a 42-year-old woman who only finished up to third grade of elementary school. She has 3 children, all of which are small. They are 12, 7, and 2 years old. Herminia and her children live in Vilomilla, a zone of Sipe-Sipe. Her husband left them a year ago.

Herminia works in the milk-producing businesses. She has cows which produce milk and she makes cheese to sell to her neighbors. She also temporarily grows beans in her home, which help her to maintain her home and her small children. The conditions in which they live are meager. They have a house with two bedrooms and she keeps her cattle on the same property. Herminia is responsible for the feeding, education and health of her children, and she does all of her tasks with her small 2-year-old girl.

Herminia is requesting this loan to be able to improve the infrastructure for her cattle, and provide a balanced diet to them so that they produce more milk. She wants to care for her source of income, which is why she has requested the loan. Herminia wants to see her children grow to be healthy, strong, responsible workers like she is, have better living conditions, a house with better commodities, and always be capable of facing any difficultly that life gives them.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a stable and purchase food for her dairy cattle

loans.name: Sonun's Group

texts.en:
Sometimes it seems that our fate is already written. Sonun T. proves every day that anyone can determine their own fate.  After a successful marriage at the age of twenty, she thought that she would never feel pain because her husband would protect her. However, she was wrong. Just after she had given birth, her husband died in an accident. Since then, she has not been able to believe in tales with happy endings. However, instead of lamenting over her destiny, she started her business of sewing national items. Now, she is a sixty-year-old widow. Her son is already married and lives separately. She has a grandson. He attends the local school. Her revenue is 3,000 KGS (69$) per month. In the future, she plans to provide an education for her grandson. Now, her son is going to redecorate her house. She is very proud of him because he always helps to solve her problems. Recently, she has decided to expand her business by buying other kind of materials. She needs a loan to realize her dreams.

Suyunduk J. is a forty-seven year old, married woman. She is a mother of two children. They are school aged. Her husband works as a driver in a company. When she married her husband, he was already a cattle breeder, so she continues this business. They have a cow, bull-caves and six sheep. By taking this loan, she wants to buy young cattle and goods for the pavilion where she sells daily-use products. 

Shaymbubu A. is a sixty-two year old, widowed woman. She deals with breeding cattle. Her children help her in business. Now she has a cow, and some young cattle. She wants to get a loan to buy two heifers. In the near future she wants to marry off her son.

Bolotbek J. is forty one year old man. He is married and has two children. His wife works in construction with him. In the future he wants to shift to breeding and selling cattle. He needs a loan to make his plans come true. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying other kinds of materials.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.pt:
Nelson Q. nasceu na cidade da Beira, Província de Sofala, centro de Moçambique tem 27 anos de idade solteiro e pai de 1 filho de 7 anos de idade, vai a escola. Fez 12ą classe, parou porque foi incorporado ao serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria e não sustenta ninguém, o filho vive em casa do avo.
Saiu de Beira para Boane cumprindo o serviço militar, é quadro do Ministério da Defesa Nacional afecto em Boane há 7 anos. Não possui empregado e tem um salário mensal de 5.698.00mt que aplica nas suas despesas caseiras e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku quando passava em frente da sucursal de Boane, tendo aproximado para se informar das modalidades de empréstimos. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo no valor de 18.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia, e outros) para dar continuidade com a obra da sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.000.00mt, 6.000.00mt, 12.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na conclusão da sua obra e ainda tem um sonho de poder construir um estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Nelson Q. was born in the city of Beira, Sofala Province, in central Mozambique. He is 27 years old, is single, and is the father of a 7-year-old son who attends school. Nelson went to twelfth grade but stopped his education because he was drafted into military service. He lives in his own house and does not support anyone; his son lives in his grandparents' house. Nelson left Beira for Boane after finishing his military service. He has worked in the National Defense Ministry in Boane for seven years. He has no employees and has a monthly salary of 5,698 meticais which he uses for household expenses. He also saves some of it in his bank account. He has never taken out loans with other banks. He learned about Hluvuku when he passed by the branch in Boane, having stopped by to learn about the types of loans available. This is his fifth loan. He is asking for 18,000 meticais, which he will use to buy construction materials (cement, iron, sand and other materials) to continue building his house. The previous loans were for 5,000 meticais, 6,000 meticais, 12,000 meticais and 15,000 meticais, all for the same purpose. In the future he would like to ask for more loans to finish building his house. He also dreams of building a business center.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material (cement, iron, sand and other materials)

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji V. is 25 years old, married to a farmer, and has two children who are both in school. Keji sells vegetables at market, and she is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes and onions to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family settlement.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more tomatoes and onions to sell at market.

loans.name: Familia Unida De Inversiones 4 Group

texts.en:
Rafael is the coordinator of his group called Familia Unida de Inversiones (United Family of Investments). Rafael's story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally. (In fact, many of Esperanza's Dominican clients are recent emigrates from Haiti.)

Rafael's group is located in the slums that surround Santiago, a large city which is known for its tobacco production and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Rafael makes his home here in a simple structure with his long-term partner and their four children.

Rafael is excited to be taking out his second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. 

Rafael runs a neighborhood food cart, and he plans to use this loan to stock his cart with staples such as Yuca, potatoes, bananas, and eggs to sell to his clientele. He will use the profits to provide the basic necessities for his children, such as food and clothing, as well as save toward the day when he hopes to open his own supermarket.  He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy Yuca, potatoes, bananas, and eggs to sell from his food cart.

loans.name: Bolanle

texts.en:
Bolanle B. is a 54-year old widow who has four children between the ages of 25 and 36 years old. Ever since Bolanle lost her husband years back, she has cared for her children all alone. She works hard to make sure there is food on the table for her family. 

Bolanle has been in the business of selling drinks for more than twenty years. She hopes to improve and expand her business in the future, since this will enable her to meet her customers’ high demand and increase her profit. 

Bolanle would like a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira (NGN) to purchase more drinks to sell in order to make more profit. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.pt:
Hortência Sautane M. nasceu na provincia de Inhambane, Sul de Moçambique tem 46 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 7 filhos de cujas idades já não se lembra, destes 5 vão a escola. Fez somente 6ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Sai de Inhambane para Maputo ao lar em 1977, onde fixou sua residência. Mais tarde devidas as dificuldades enfrentadas na sua vida, decidiu iniciar uma actividade comercial em Boane. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 6 anos, não possui nenhum empregado, as vezes tem ajuda dos filhos. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum com as amigas através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Já teve empréstimo para o seu negócio, na Associação de crédito TCHUMA mais tarde decidiu no continuar, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (açúcar, refrescos, bolos, bolachas e outros) para aumentar a mercadoria no seu estabelecimento.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este crédito para poder a ceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para melhorar a sua residência e aplicar ainda mais no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Hortência Sautane M. was born in the province of Inhambane in southern Mozambique. She is 46 years old, married, and is the mother of seven children whose ages she does not remember. Five of the children go to school. Hortência only completed sixth grade; she did not continue because of a lack of money. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else. In 1977 she left Inhambane for Maputo, where she took up residence. Later, owing to difficulties she faced in her life, she decided to start a business in Boane. She has had her own business for more than six years. She has no employees, but sometimes her children help her. She earns around 3,500 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses and for saving with friends through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings). She had a loan for her business through Tchuma Credit Association, but she later decided not to continue with them. She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution. This is her first loan here. She is asking for 15,000 meticais, with which she will buy products (sugar, soft drinks, cakes, crackers and other items) to increase the amount of merchandise in her shop. She promises to pay off this loan on time so she may take out other loans. In the future, she would like to ask for more loans to improve her house and invest more in her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of products (sugar, soft drinks, cakes, crackers and other items)

loans.name: Kumushay's Group

texts.ru:
Герои нашей истории – жители города Балыкчи. Они неустанно прикладывают огромные усилия, чтобы вести достойную жизнь. Некоторые из них являются единственными кормильцами своих семей. Алиева Кумушай – лидер группы. Кумушай – мать троих детей: двоих сыновей и одной дочери. Все дети учатся в ВУЗах и на плечах Кумушай и её мужа лежит огромное бремя платить контракт за обучение троих детей. Чтобы дать детям образование, в 2001-году Кумушай получила кредит в сумме пяти тысяч сомов ($100), и начала торговать штучными товарами (семечками, жевательными резинками, конфетами и т.д.) в магазинчике, который она вместе с мужем открыли возле своего дома. Кумушай очень повезло, так как магазинчик находился вблизи от школы. Торговля пошла довольно бойко, и вскоре им удалось увеличить товарооборот до двадцати тысяч сомов ($450). Сейчас чистая прибыль от продажи составляет от пяти до шести тысяч сомов ежемесячно. Сейчас торговлей занимаются в основном её муж и дочь. Сама же Кумушай устроилась реализатором в аптеку напротив поликлиники и получает зарплату в размере четырёх тысяч сомов ($90). Кумушай понадобились средства для увеличения товарооборота и ассортимента товара в их магазине. И с этой целью она и обратилась за этим кредитом.  
Партнёры по группе:

Байчороевой Элмиресорок пять лет. Муж Элмиры работает охранником. У Элмиры трое детей. Двое из них учатся в университетах. Сама Элмира работает поваром в кафе. Элмире нужен кредит, чтобы погасить задолженность за обучение сына. Сын учится в юридической академии на первом курсе.

Бектургановой Бурулуш пятьдесят четыре года. Она – мать двоих детей. Дети уже выросли и сами зарабатывают себе на жизнь. Сын занимается перепродажей скота, а сама Бурулуш изготавливает национальные изделия на заказ. У неё имеются постоянные клиенты.Бурулуш нужен кредит, чтобы помочь сыну купить несколько баранов для перепродажи.

Дюшенову Рахатбеку тридцать пять лет. Жена Рахатбека является домохозяйкой и поэтому поиском пропитания занимаетс я в основном муж. Рахатбек занимаетс я фермерским хозяйством. Покупает скот, откармливает и перепродаёт. Рахатбек обратился за кредитом, так как хочет приобрести бытовую технику. 

Жакыбалиеву Алмазу тридцать два года. У Алмаза один шестилетний сын. Алмаз, чтобы прокормить семью таксует по городу на своей машине и ему удаётся заработать около пяти – шести тысяч сомов в месяц. Сейчас Алмазу нужен кредит, чтобы отремонтировать машину. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
The heroes of our story are citizens of the town of Balykchi. They consistently put forth huge efforts in order to lead a decent life. Some of them are the only providers for their families. Kumushay A. is the leader of the group. She is a mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. All of the children attend universities, and the huge burden for paying their education contracts lies on the shoulders of Kumushay and her husband. In order to provide the children with education, Kumushay took out a loan in the sum of five thousand som ($100) in 2001 and started selling various goods (seeds, chewing gum, candy, etc.) at a store that she opened together with her husband near their home. She was fortunate to have the store near a school. The sales were very good, and soon Kumushay and her husband were able to increase the goods turnover to twenty thousand som ($450). Their current net monthly profit from the sales is from five to six thousand som. Her husband and daughter primarily work at the store now. Kumushay found a salesperson job at a pharmacy opposite a hospital and receives a salary in the sum of four thousand som ($90). She needed means to increase goods turnover and merchandise variety at their store. This is why she requested this loan. Her group partners are: Elmira B. is forty-five years old. Her husband works as a security guard. Elmira has three children, two of whom attend universities. Elmira works as a cook at a café. She needs a loan in order to repay a debt for son’s education. Her son is in his first year of a law academy. Burulush B. is fifty-four years old. She is a mother of two children. The children are already grown and earn their own living. The son is involved in livestock sales, and Burulush makes national goods to-order. She has consistent customers. Burulush needs a loan to help her son buy several sheep for resale. Rahatbek Dyushenov is thirty-five years old. His wife is a homemaker, and this is why he is mainly responsible for supporting the family. Rahatbek is involved in agriculture. He buys livestock, fattens it and resells it. He requested this loan because he wants to purchase household appliances. Almaz J. is thirty-two years old. He has one six-year-old son. In order to provide for his family, Almaz provides taxi services throughout the town using his own car. He is able to make around five-six thousand som per month. Almaz needs this loan in order to repair his car.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover and merchandise variety

loans.name: Armelle Roselyne

texts.fr: Née le 05 Janvier 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, B. Armelle Roselyne est mariée à EWASSADJA Florent, un revendeur. Le couple a trois enfants à leur charge, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. La famille s’est installée depuis 4 ans à Hêdomey dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. Armelle Roselyne vient en aide à son mari dans les différentes charges de la famille. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Armelle Roselyne vend depuis huit ans environs, divers produits (savons, œufs, lait, conserves de tomate et de sardine, sucre, pâtes alimentaires, biscuits, bombons, piles, huile végétale, petit pois, etc.) dans sa boutique à Hêdomey. De façon secondaire, Armelle Roselyne  exerce comme autre activité, la vente de charbon de bois. Armelle Roselyne s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi dans le Nord du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les trois crédits qu'elle avait obtenu de ALIDé. Dans l’optique d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Armelle Roselyne sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born 5 January 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Armelle Roselyne B. is married to Florent EWASSADJA, a retail merchant. They have three children under their care, of which two are their own. All of the children attend school. Four years ago the family settled in the Abomey Calavi area of Hedomey. Armelle Roselyne helps her husband deal with various household expenses. To meet her needs over the past eight years, Armelle Roselyne has sold various products from her shop in Hedomey (soap, eggs, milk, canned tomatoes and sardines, sugar, pasta, cookies, candy, batteries, vegetable oil, peas, etc.). She also retails charcoal as a secondary activity. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international market, and also from the North of Benin. She is a regular ALIDé client, having fully reimbursed three previous loans from the organisation. Wanting to increase her level of activity and better respond to increasing customer demands for her products, Armelle Roselyne is now requesting a fourth credit loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products (pasta, canned goods, milk, eggs, vegetable oil, cookies, etc.)

loans.name: Penina Zelia

texts.pt:
Penina Zélia T. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, tem 31 anos de idade casada com 2 filhos de 10 anos e outro de 6 meses de idade, o mais velho vai a escola. Fez 10ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras, mas ainda tenciona continuar com os seus estudos. Vive numa casa de aluguer com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para alem de seus filhos.
Nunca saiu da província de Maputo, apenas já esteve a residir num bairro arredores da cidade de Maputo e voltou para Matola. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 2 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e o seu rendimento varia de acordo com o movimento dos seus clientes, variando entre 2.000.00mt a 3.500.00mt por mês. Este valor aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a hluvuku através de amigas. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, refrescos, sumos e outros) para aumentar e diversificar o seu produto.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este crédito para poder aceder a outros, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar no desenvolvimento do seu negócio.
texts.en:
Penina Zélia T. was born in the city of Matola, Maputo Province. She is 31 years old and married with two children, ages 10 years and 6 months. The elder child goes to school. Penina finished tenth grade. She did not continue with school because of a lack of money, but she still plans to continue her studies. She lives in a rented house with her family and does not support anyone other than her children. Penina has never left Maputo Province. She has moved only to a neighborhood outside the city of Maputo and then returned to Matola. She has had her own business for more than two years. She has no employees, and her income changes with the movements of her customers, varying from 2,000 to 3,500 meticais per month. She uses this money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account. Penina has never had a loan with another bank. She learned about Hluvuku through friends. This is her first loan, and she is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy products (beer, soft drinks, juices and other products) to increase and diversify her inventory. She promises to pay off this loan promptly so she may take out other loans. In the future, she would like to ask for more loans to apply to the growth of her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of products (beer, soft drinks, juices and other products)

loans.name: Naceke

texts.en:
Naceke E. is currently in the business of selling tea by the street during the evening times. She is requesting a loan to stock more sugar and chairs for sitting. Naceke is 40 years old and married to a policeman. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more sugar and chairs for sitting

loans.name: Ayjan's Group

texts.ru:
Наша жизнь в общей своей сути заключается в том, что мы рождаемся, вырастаем, находим себя в жизни, постепенно стареем и умираем. Однако в то же самое время у нас появляются дети, которые впоследствии занимают наше место и продолжают род. Этот удивительный механизм постоянного обновления и возрождения нашей жизни даёт новый толчок, новый прилив сил, энергии и вдохновения и толкает нас на подвиги каждый день. 
Токтоболотова Айжан – лидер данной группы. Ей сорок два года. Айжан вместе с мужем воспитывает четверых детей. Старшая дочь Айпери учится в гуманитарном университете, а их сын Адилет – студент Академии туризма. Две другие дочери ходят в школу. Чтобы прокормить такую большую семью и оплачивать контракт за обучение детей, Айжан вместе с мужем, занимаются перевозкой пассажиров по г. Бишкек. Ранее Айжан вела торговлю продуктами питания на старом рынке. Затем на заработанные деньги купили машину и поменяли род деятельности. Сейчас их доход составляет около двадцати тысяч сомов ($450) в месяц. Айжан решила обратиться за кредитом, так  как им нужно приобрести автозапчасти для ремонта микроавтобуса. 

Партнёры Айжан по гурппе:

Жаркынбаевой Нарынгуль пятьдесят семь лет. Нарынгуль вместе с мужем вырастила пятерых детей. Старший сыновья работают на стройке. Адилет занимается ремонтом автомашин. Дочь Кундуз, замужем и живёт с мужем в селе. А самая младшая дочь Назгуль работает кассиром в микрокредитной компании. Нарынгуль обратилась за кредитом, так как её муж, пенсионер по инвалидности, нуждается в лечении. 

Жумадиловой Токтогуль сорок три года. Токтогул – мать четверых детей. Старший из детей, занимается перевозкой пассажиров. Один из сыновей инвалид с детства. Двое других детей учатся в школе. Токтогул торгует носками и другими изделиями на ярмарках. Токогул нужен кредит, чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара. 

Акишевой Саткынгуль сорок два года. Муж Саткынгуль предоставляет сварочные услуги. Он изготавливает павильоны, камки и отопительные котлы.  У Саткынгуль четверо детей. Старшего сына уже женили. Саткынгуль нужен кредит, чтобы приобрести золотые украшения. 

Адигинеевой Сонунбубу пятьдесят восемь лет. Сонунбубу – мать пятерых детей. Все дети уже женаты либо вышли замуж и ведут самостоятельную жизнь. Муж Сонунбубу занимается частным извозом. Его ежемесячный доход составляет около двадцати восьми тысяч сомов в месяц. Сонунбубу обратилась за кредитом, чтобы приобрести авто запчасти для машины мужа.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Our life generally consists in that we are born, grow up, find ourselves in life, gradually grow old and die. However, at the same time, we have children, who subsequently take our place and continue the family line. This wonderful mechanism of constant renewal and revival of our life gives us a new push, new strength, energy and inspiration and pushes us to heroic deeds every day. Ayjan T. is the leader of this group. She is forty-two years old. Ayjan and her husband are raising four children. The oldest daughter, Ayperi, attends a humanitarian university, and their son, Adilet, is a student of the tourist academy. Two other daughters go to school. In order to feed such a big family and pay their education contracts, Ayjan and her husband are involved in transporting passengers throughout the city of Bishkek. Previously, Ayjan sold food products at the old market. Then, they used the earned money to purchase a car and changed their business. Now, their income is about twenty thousand som ($450) per month. Ayjan decided to obtain a loan because they need to buy auto parts and repair the minibus. Ayjan’s group partners are: Naryngul J. is fifty-seven years old. She and her husband raised five children. The oldest sons work at a construction site. Adilet is involved in auto repair. Daughter Kunduz is married and lives with her husband in the village. And the youngest daughter, Nazgul, works as a cashier at a microloan company. Naryngul requested the loan because her husband, as a disabled retiree, requires medical attention. Toktogul J. is forty-three years old. She is a mother of four children. The oldest son is involved in passenger transportation. One of the sons is disabled since childhood. Two other children attend school. Toktogul sells socks and other goods at markets. She needs a loan in order to expand the merchandise variety. Satkyngul Akisheva is forty-two years old. Her husband provides welding services. He makes pavilions, decals and heating boilers. Satkyngul has four children. The oldest son is already married. She needs a loan in order to purchase gold jewelry. Sonunbubu Adigeneeva is fifty-eight years old. She is a mother of five children. All of the children are married and lead independent lives. Sonunbubu’s husband is involved in private transportation. His monthly income is around twenty-eight thousand som. Sonunbubu requested the loan in order to purchase auto parts for her husband’s car.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of auto parts to repair minibus

loans.name: Joao Antonio

texts.pt:
João António D. nasceu no Distrito de Inhassunge, Província de Zambézia, centro de Moçambique tem 42 anos de idade casado e pai de 4 filhos de 13, 8, 5 e 2 anos de idade. Os 3 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez 12ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais um sobrinho que vive com ele.
Saiu de Zambézia para Cuba quando teve bolsa de estudos em 1983, regressa a Moçambique 8 anos depois e veio directo para Maputo. Trabalha no Ministério do Interior há 18 anos, como técnico processador de dados, não possui empregado e tem um salário mensal de 6.800.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Já teve empréstimo no Banco Milenium Bim e não continuou, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus sogros. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, barrotes, chapas de Zinco e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra de construção da sua residência. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 10.000.00mt, para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo também para poder aceder a outros, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para iniciar um negócio próprio.
texts.en:
João António D. was born in the District of Inhassunge, Province of Zambezia, in the center of Mozambique. He is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children who are 13, 8, 5 and 2 years old. The older 3 are in school. João studied through 12th grade but didn't continue with his studies because of a lack of financial resources. He lives in his own house with his family, and also takes care of a nephew who lives with them. João left Zambezia for Cuba on a scholarship in 1983. He returned to Mozambique 8 years later and went to Maputo. He has worked at the Ministry of the Interior for 18 years, as a data technician. He doesn't employ any helpers and earns a monthly salary of 6800.00 Meticales, which he uses to cover household expenses. He also saves some in his bank account. João had taken out loans before with the Banco Milenium Bim, but he decided not to continue with them. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through his parents-in-law. This is his 2nd loan, for the amount of 15,000.00 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, sand, support beams, zinc plates and other items) in order to continue working on his home construction project. His earlier loan was for 10,000.00 Meticales and was used for the same purpose. He promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future he would like to apply for more loans to start his own business.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, support beams, zinc plates and other items)

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia M. is currently in the business of selling various foodstuffs at a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to stock more rice and beans in the restaurant. Nadia is 47 years old and widowed. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children and pay rent for her house.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more rice and beans in the restaurant

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio Arroyo Porá  surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación. Cada una de las señoras realiza una actividad diferente e independiente dependiendo de la facilidad con que cuentan.
El comité periódicamente recibe curso de capacitación de parte de las asesoras de la Fundación, con esto ellas aprenden muchas cosas de como manejar especialmente la economía familiar planificando todas las actividades.
La señora Maria T. es una de las integrantes y se dedica a la venta de ropa en un salón que abrió en su casa, ella cuenta con todo tipo de prendas de vestir y ofrece a muy buen precio a sus clientes, el salón es atendida por ella y por su hija quien le ayuda con las labores.
Ella nos comenta que el negocio ayuda mucho especialmente con los gastos escolares de sus hijos, y desea que el negocio se mantenga y crezca mas cada día.
El crédito que retiro lo utilizó para la compra de todo tipo de prendas de vestir, como camisas, pantalones, vestidos, remeras.
texts.en:
This group from Barrio Arroyo Porá got started when one of the members met someone from the foundation. Each one of the señoras has a different and independent business depending on what facilities they have. The committee receives periodic training from the Foundation's advisers. They learn how to manage and in particular how to manage the families' finances. Señora Maria T. is one of our members and she sells clothing from a salon she opened in her home. She has every type of clothing and offers her customers good prices. She takes of the store with her daughter who helps her. She tells us that her business helps a lot, especially with her kid's school expenses. She hopes the business keeps up and grows daily. She used the loan she took out to buy a variety of clothes like shirts, pants, dresses, and t-shirts.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise, food, clothing, fabric, thread, vegetablers, and otehr supplies to stock kiosks and stalls.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice sells plastic chairs, plates and tables to make a living in Lagos State, Nigeria. She manages the trade with the support of her children. She started this trade four years ago and has been doing fine. With the proceeds from the business, she assists her husband in taking care of the home and in feeding, clothing and buying school books for her children. 

Beatrice wants to expand her business by buying more plastic chairs, tables and more. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more plastic chairs and tables to sell. She appreciates all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic chairs and tables to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La Sra. Lourdes vive la zona de Alto Tejar de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Actualmente vive en casa de sus padres, junto a sus tres hijas.
 
Lourdes vende ropa de mujer en la calle Uyustus, donde tiene una pequeña tienda en alquiler.

El crédito lo destinará  para aumentar su mercadería  e incrementar sus ingresos. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro y primero vía kiva; la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Lourdes lives in the Alto Tejar zone of the city of La Paz.

She currently lives in her parents’ house, together with her three girls.

Lourdes sells women’s clothing on Uyustus Street, where she rents a small store.

The loan will be used to expand her merchandise and increase her earnings.

This is her first loan with IMPRO and Kiva. The evaluation completed qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more women's clothing for her retail clothing business.

loans.name: Pío Ramón

texts.es: El solicitante es el Sr. Pió Ramón M. el mismo es comerciante de es propietario de una negocio que vende todo tipo de artículos como para la canasta familiar, bazar, regalos, ropería, zapatería El negocio es denominado Los Amigos ubicado en la Zona  de Yatytay Km 16 cuenta de la ciudad de Encarnación con 6 años de antigüedad en el rubro, lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela he ingresos. No esta demás mencionar que el mismo también realiza  repartos a domicilio el negocio es atendido por el y conyugue tiene 1 hija pequeña. El cliente solicito el crédito para compras de mercaderías en gran cantidad ya que con esto el costo seria menor y le estaría dando mayor margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
The borrower is Pió Ramón M.. He is a merchant and owns a business that sells all types of items such as those for the family pantry, bazaar, gifts, clothing, and shoes. The business is called Los Amigos and is located in the Yatytay zone, 16km from the city of Encarnación. He has 6 years with the business, which allows him to have a very good clientele and earnings. In addition, he also does home deliveries and together with his spouse, they have a little girl. He has requested this loan to purchase wholesale merchandise, since the cost is less and he would have a greater profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of breads, dairy products, and clothing and shoe items, among others.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
El señor Jacinto vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja con la compra y venta de movilidades a medio uso y también como chofer de su propio auto.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar llantas y reparar una de sus movilidades.

Es cliente de Impro y su historial de pagos es bueno, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Jacinto owns his own home and lives with his wife and children in the city of La Paz. He buys and sells used vehicles and also works as a driver with his own car. The loan that he is requesting will be used toward buying tires and making repairs on one of his vehicles. Jacinto is a client with Impro, and he has a good repayment history, therefore he is eligible for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and make repairs on one of the vehicles he has for sale

loans.name: Jaime Alcides

texts.es:
El Sr. Jaime nacio el 27 de julio de 1979 en santa cruz, pero vive en la localidad del Torno ( El Torno es la cuarta sección municipal de la provincia Santi Ivañez, del Departamento de Santa Cruz. Está dividida en cuatro cantones con 65 comunidades campesinas. De acuerdo al último censo realizado el año 2002, la población de El Torno alcanza a 40.000 habitantes.
Es una población joven, constituida por emigrantes venidos del interior del país: del occidente, quechuas, aymaras y de los valles del oriente, así como de las personas autóctonas.
Como característica de Santa Cruz, existen grandes diferencias sociales que conviven en un mismo espacio. Junto a grandes "quintas", propiedad de terratenientes y personas de mayor poder adquisitivo en Santa Cruz, conviven los propios habitantes de la zona, con construcciones mayormente sencillas (adobe y techo de motacú). Existe una diferencia entre las poblaciones de Santa Rita y Santa Marta 1 y Santa Marta 2, que se encuentran al borde de la carretera antigua a Cochabamba, donde se encuentran viviendas de ladrillo y teja junto a las más sencillas, y las poblaciones campesinas que se encuentran hacia el interior de la montaña, que son puramente de adobe y motacú, con condiciones mucho más sencillas, donde no llegan el agua y la luz.
Estas poblaciones se encuentran a una distancia de entre 5 y 20 kilómetros hacia el interior (en la zona pastoral que deben atender los voluntarios). Dicha zona pastoral está compuesta de 9 comunidades, a las que se accede por caminos de tierra por los que a veces pasan vagonetas para poder acceder a ellas.
La economía de la población se basa en la producción agropecuaria y frutícola, así como el trabajo de extracción de piedra, ripio y arena del río Piraí que circunda a todo el municipio. También existe una gran actividad de comercio, especialmente en la población de El Torno, donde se instala el mercado en que se venden los productos del trabajo campesino).
El Sr. Jaime viene trabajando con EMPRENDER hase 2 años, el primer credito fue para comprar un terreno en la Localidad de  San Luis, en la cual el esta trabajando  y el esta en proseso de comprar 2 hectareas  mas, con el dinero del credito el comprara semillas para la siembra de Papa y despues comercializarlo en el mercado de la zona, el espera pagar este credito y sacar otro mas grande. Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgaciondle credito.
texts.en:
Jaime was born on July 27 of 1979 in Santa Cruz. He lives in a town called El Torno. El Torno is the fourth municipal section of the province of Santi Ivañez, of the Departament of Santa Cruz. It is divided into four cantons with 65 farming communities. According to the last census from 2002, the town of El Torno has 40,000 inhabitants. It is a young population, made up of migrants from the country's interior. From the west, Quechuas and Aymaras; from the east, and also people native to the area. In Santa Cruz there are large social differences that inhabit the same space. Next to the great "quintas", the properties of landholders and people with bigger purchasing power in Santa Cruz, live the residents of the area themselves. They live in houses that are mainly of simple construction (adobe and roofs thatched with palm). There is a difference between the towns of Santa Rita and Santa Marta 1 and Santa Marta 2. These are found next to the old highway to Cochabamba. There you will find homes made of brick and tile next to the simplest homes. The farming communities are towards the mountains' interior. These are all made of adobe and thatch and of much humbler conditions. Water and electricity services aren't available there. These towns are at a distance of between 5 and 20 kilometers from the interior (the pastoral area that volunteers must attend). This pastoral area is made up of 9 communities, accessed by dirt roads on which wagons sometimes pass to be able to access them. The town's economy is based on fish farming and fruit growing. It is also based on the extraction of stone, gravel and sand from the Piraí river that encircles the town. There is also a lot of commerce, especially in the town of El Torno, where there is a market where agricultural workers' products are sold. Jaime Has been working with EMPRENDER for 2 years. The first loan was to buy a lot of land in the town of San Luis. He has been working this land and is in the process of buying 2 more hectares. With the money from the loan, he will buy seed to plant potatoes and later sell them in the area market. He expects to pay off this loan and take out a larger one. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have in him in granting him this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed to plant potatoes

loans.name: Zenon

texts.es:
El señor Zenón vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo menor; maneja un auto con el cual trabajaba como asalariado percibiendo un ingreso de 50Bs por día; con sus ahorros pagó la mitad del costo de su movilidad y el crédito que solicita es para pagar el saldo y que el auto sea de su propiedad ya que como dueño puede generar mejores ingresos.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2002 y su historial de pagos es muy bueno, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Zenón lives in his own house with his wife and youngest son. He is a hired driver and earns a daily salary from his employer of 50Bs. He has paid half the cost of his car with his savings and will pay the balance with the loan he is requesting. Once he buys it, the car will be his, and as owner he will see better earnings. He has been a client of Impro since 2002 and has a history of good payments which allows him to enter into a new loan agreement.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay the balance owed on his car

loans.name: Cynthia Rumina

texts.es:
La Sra Cinthya R. V. Gonzalez tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su esposo el Sr Juan M. Ayala Maza quien tiene 36 años de edad tienen una hija de 8 años en edad escolar.


Doña Cinthya y su esposo iniciaron su negocio gracias a una herencia que recibieron de sus padres, son personas muy dedicada y trabajadoras.

Don Juan Ayala aparte del negocio de la ferreteria tiene un pequeño taller de herreria y bicicleteria con la cual ayuda en el ingreso familiar.

El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de mas mercaderías para la ferretería.
texts.en:
Señora Cinthya R. V. Gonzalez is 29 years old and lives with her husband, Señor Juan M. Ayala Maza who is 36 years old. They have one school-aged daughter who is 8 years old. Doña Cinthya and her husband started a business thanks to an inheritance they received from their parents. They are very dedicated, hard-working people. Apart from their hardware store, Don Juan Ayala has a small bicycle repair shop which adds to the family's income. The loan they are requesting is to buy more merchandise for their shop.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for their store including electrical parts

loans.name: Raimundo

texts.es:
El señor Raimundo vive en  anticretico con su esposa e hijo en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que el realiza es la de garzón en diferentes acontecimientos sociales como ser bautizos, matrimonios, etc.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar vajilla ya que le piden que prepare algunos bocaditos especiales extras los cuales los elabora en su domicilio.

Es cliente de impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Raimundo lives in an anticretico (under this system, one pays a sum to the landlord when moving into a house or apartment, lives there for whatever period of time, and at the end moves out and gets the entire sum back. The interest on the money is the rent). He lives with his wife and son in the Tembladerani zone of La Paz. He works as a waiter and caterer at different social events like baptisms, weddings etc. The loan he requests is to buy kitchen equipment since he has been asked to bring extra snacks which he prepares in his home. He has previously been a client of Impro and has a good payment history which is why he can request a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchenware for his catering business

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es el ensamblaje de computadoras, reparación de las mismas, instalacion de software y otras que tengan relación con  computadoras.

El crédito que solicita será utilizado para la compra de un par de computadoras, que le servirán para realizar su trabajo con mayor facilidad y mejor calidad de servicios.

Es cliente de impro desde el año 2007 y paga muy bien, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Juan lives in his parent's home in the Sopocachi neighborhood in the city La Paz. He assembles and repairs computers, installs software, and does anything related to computers for a living. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a couple of computers that he will use to carry out his business with greater ease and better quality of service. He has been a client of Impro since 2007 and pays on time so he can access new loans.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two computers for his business of fixing computer systems, software, etc.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El señor Victor vive en casa propia en la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la de carpintería, con esta actividad el cubre todas sus necesidades ya que vive solo.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar madera y poder terminar tres muebles que le fueron encargados y algunas otras herramientas de trabajo.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 1999 y tiene un historial de pagos muy bueno, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Victor lives in his own home in the Tembladerani neighborhood of the city of La Paz. He makes a living as a carpenter and with this business is able to cover his necessities since he lives alone. He is asking for a loan to buy wood to be able to finish three pieces of furniture he has been charged with making and for a few other work tools. He has been a client of Impro since 1999 and has a very good payment history so he can get new loans.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood and other supplies to finish three pending furniture contracts

loans.name: Amanda Cristina

texts.es:
Amanda tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo menor de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el sector Matriz Comunidad del distrito de Pacora, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la compra y venta de cerdos y aves de corral. Ella compra los animales para criarlos y engordarlos, luego los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona en donde vive. Este negocio le provee de ingresos económicos que utiliza en la educación y mantenimiento de su hijo, además de apoyar en los gastos familiares.

Amanda desea ampliar su negocio para captar mas ingresos y seguir sacando adelante a su menor hijo, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que planea utilizar en la compra de alimento balanceado para mejorar la calidad de los animales que comercializa.

Amanda es una mujer luchadora y que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de su condición de madre soltera. Sus familiares y conocidos la consideran una persona de confianza y muy entregada a las labores que realiza.
texts.en:
Amanda, age 34, is a single mother with a young son. She lives with her parents in the Matriz Comunidad sector of the Pacora district, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For two years, she has been engaged in the purchase and sale of pigs and poultry. She buys the animals in order to raise and fatten them, and then she offers them for sale to merchants who come into the area where she lives. This business has provided her with income which she uses for the education and care of her son. In addition, she helps with the family expenses.

Amanda wants to enlarge her business in order to obtain more income and continue moving forward for her young son. That’s why she is applying for the first time with Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 600 new soles that she plans to use to purchase balanced feed for improving the quality of the animals that she sells.

Amanda is a hardworking woman who has been able to get ahead in spite of her status as a single mother. Her family and friends consider her a trustworthy person who is very dedicated to her work.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of balanced feed  for imrpoving the condition of animals she sells.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pablo vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene un auto con el cual trabaja como transporte publico.

El crédito que solicita es para reparar su movilidad, comprar llantas , batería y otros repuestos, de esta manera mejorar las condiciones del auto y poder trabajar con normalidad 

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2007 y paga muy bien, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Pablo lives in his own house in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz. He has a car which he uses to provide public transport.

The loan he is applying for is for maintaining his vehicle by purchasing tires, a battery, and other spare parts. This will allow him to improve his car’s condition, and he will be able to work consistently. He has been a client of Impro since 2007 and makes all his payments, which is why Impro can provide a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tires and spare parts for maintaining his taxi.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Sr. Santos Nacio en Pasla-Nor Cinti-Chuquisaca el 21 de Marzo de 1977, Concuvino (que no se casaron pero viven juntos) con la señora Celia, ellos tienen dos hijos hace 15 años que el señor trabaja como albañil.Su señora se encuentra trabajando en el mercado central de El Torno en la venta de ropa . El señor actualmente esta trabajando en una construccion, en El Torno Bolivia ( El Torno es la cuarta sección municipal de la provincia Santi Ivañez, del Departamento de Santa Cruz. Está dividida en cuatro cantones con 65 comunidades campesinas. De acuerdo al último censo realizado el año 2002, la población de El Torno alcanza a 40.000 habitantes.
Es una población joven, constituida por emigrantes venidos del interior del país: del occidente, quechuas, aymaras y de los valles del oriente, así como de las personas autóctonas.
Como característica de Santa Cruz, existen grandes diferencias sociales que conviven en un mismo espacio. Junto a grandes "quintas", propiedad de terratenientes y personas de mayor poder adquisitivo en Santa Cruz, conviven los propios habitantes de la zona, con construcciones mayormente sencillas (adobe y techo de motacú). Existe una diferencia entre las poblaciones de Santa Rita y Santa Marta 1 y Santa Marta 2, que se encuentran al borde de la carretera antigua a Cochabamba, donde se encuentran viviendas de ladrillo y teja junto a las más sencillas, y las poblaciones campesinas que se encuentran hacia el interior de la montaña, que son puramente de adobe y motacú, con condiciones mucho más sencillas, donde no llegan el agua y la luz.
Estas poblaciones se encuentran a una distancia de entre 5 y 20 kilómetros hacia el interior (en la zona pastoral que deben atender los voluntarios). Dicha zona pastoral está compuesta de 9 comunidades, a las que se accede por caminos de tierra por los que a veces pasan vagonetas para poder acceder a ellas.
La economía de la población se basa en la producción agropecuaria y frutícola, así como el trabajo de extracción de piedra, ripio y arena del río Piraí que circunda a todo el municipio. También existe una gran actividad de comercio, especialmente en la población de El Torno, donde se instala el mercado en que se venden los productos del trabajo campesino).

El cliente esta agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo  que se le a brindado ya que podra comprar un poco de material de trabajo y herramientas como ser flotacho, pala y otras cosas mas.
texts.en:
Santos was born in Pasla-Nor Cinti-Chuquisaca on March 21st, 1977. He lives with Celia, and they have two children. He has worked as a bricklayer for 15 years. Celia works selling clothes in the central market in El Torno. Santos is currently working on construction in El Torno, Bolivia. (El Torno is the fourth municipal section in the Santi Ivañez province in the Santa Cruz department.) It is divided into four cantons with 65 rural communities. According to the 2002 census, the population is up to 40,000 inhabitants. It is a young population made up of emigrants coming from the interior of the country, from the west, Quechuas, Aymaras, and people from the eastern valleys like the Autóctonas. Santa Cruz can be characterized as having great social differences existing in the same area. Large “quintas”, property of landowners acquired in Santa Cruz, and people with greater power co-exist with the area’s own inhabitants who live in more modest houses (adobe with roofs made of palm fronds). A difference exists between the populations of Santa Rita, Santa Marta 1, and Santa Marta 2. These places can be found on the border of the old road to Cochabamba. You can find houses there that are made of brick and tile along with more modest houses. There are also rural populations, which can be found towards the interior of the mountain. The houses there are solely made of adobe and palm fronds under more modest conditions. They do not have water or electrical services. These populations can be found between 5 and 20 kilometers towards the interior (in the pastoral region the volunteers need to take care of). This pastoral zone is comprised of nine communities, which can be accessed by dirt roads. Sometimes trucks are used to be able to access the communities. The population’s economy is based on farming, fishing, and growing fruit. People also work at extracting rocks, debris, and sand from the Piraí River, which surrounds the entire municipality. There is also great commercial activity, especially in El Torno. A market is set up in El Torno, and farm products are sold there. He is grateful to the institution for the support they have given him. He will be able to buy a few more work materials and tools such as a trowel, a shovel, and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools and materials

loans.name: Villa Ingavi Group

texts.es:
El centro focal de German Busch se encuentra en una zona alejada del centro de la ciudad de El Alto. En centro focal se encuentra la asociación Villa Ingavi, la misma que está conformada por 9 mujeres.  Las socias más antiguas ya tienen 15 ciclos (ocho años y medio) formando parte de la asociación.  Los negocios que tienen son: venta de fruta, venta de carne de llama, artesanía de sombreros, venta de comida, Tejedora de Enaguas, Venta de Mantas y macramé, venta de jugos y comerciante de ropa.
La señora Virginia Q., con 29 años de edad ya tiene 6 años como socia, de carácter amable, algo tímida, refiere que está casada y que el bebé que tiene en brazos es el quinto hijo.  Su negocio es una tienda de Juegos en Red, está hubicado en la Zona de Villa Ingenio, cerca de su domicilio.  Ella indica que necesita el crédito para comprar más Tarjetas de Video que se utilizan en las máquinas. Su primer crédito fue de Bs. 800.- y para este crédito su solicitud es de Bs. 1500.-.

En la foto se observan a siete de las socias y a la señora Virginia Q. en el momento de hacer dormir  a su bebé, la señora Florencia Q. no salió en la foto por que se encontraba sentada lejos del lugar elejido para la foto y no podía moverse por que su pie le dolía.
texts.en:
The central office of German Busch is located in an area far from the city centre of El Alto. The Villa Ingavi Association works out of this office and is made up of nine women. The women who have belonged to the association the longest have already completed 15 loan cycles (eight and a half years). They have a variety of businesses: selling fruit, llama meat, hat making, food sales, skirt weaving, poncho and macrame sales, juice selling, and clothing sales. 29-year old señora Virginia Q. has been a member for six years. She is friendly, a little shy, and says that she is married and the baby she is holding is her fifth child. Virginia has an internet games store located in the Villa Ingenio neighbourhood near her house. She needs a loan to buy more video cards which are used in the computers. Her first loan was for Bs.800, and this time she is asking for Bs.1,500. In the photo seven of the women can be seen, and Virginia Q. is the one getting her baby to go to sleep. Señora Florencia Q. isn’t in the photo because when it was taken, she was a long way from the site chosen and couldn’t get there because of painful feet.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: video cards

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 36 years old. She is married and has four children. Her husband works in the public sector and they all live in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is hardworking and lends financial support to her husband from the profits she makes from her business.
 
She is a good businesswoman who every customer will want to buy from. She sells foodstuffs like peppers, beans, rice, dried fish, tomatoes and more. She started this trade some years ago. She likes the trade and hope to improve and expand on it. 

Patience is requesting a loan of 70,000 Nigerian naira to purchase foodstuffs in large quantities to sell. This will attract more customers to her shop and improve sales. She says thanks to Kiva lenders for their financial-empowerment program.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs in large quantities to sell

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
La señora Miriam vive en casa alquilada con su esposo en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la elaboración de maní endulzado el cual lo vende al por mayor y menor el la calle garita de lima, que es un lugar muy concurrido y con mucha clientela.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más maní y azúcar y poder elaborar su producto en cantidad.

Es cliente de impro desde el año 2007 y paga muy bien, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Miriam lives in a rented house in the neighbourhood of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz with her husband. Her job is making candied peanuts which she sells both wholesale and retail in Garita Street in Lima. The loan she is asking for will be used as capital to buy more peanuts and sugar so she can make larger quantities of the product. Miriam has been a client with Kiva partner Impro since 2007, and as she has always made her repayments on time, she is able to have another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy peanuts and sugar in large quantities

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia vive en casa de sus abuelos en la zona de Alto san Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz; su actividad principal es la venta de duraznos, ella trae de su pueblo y los comercializa al por mayor y menor en todos los tambos (se llaman tambos a los centros de acopio de fruta que llega del interior del país)de la zona Max Paredes de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito que solicita será utilizado en aumentar su capital de trabajo y comprar más producto (durazno) de su pueblo para traer a La Paz.

Es cliente de impro y paga muy bien, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Silvia lives in her grandparents’ house in the neighbourhood of Alto san Pedro in the city of La Paz. Her main work is selling peaches. She transports them from her village and sells them both wholesale and retail in all the 'tambos' (the fruit warehouses found in the interior of the country are called ‘tambos’) in the Max Paredes neighbourhood of the city of La Paz. The loan Silvia is asking for will be used to increase working capital and buy more peaches to take from her village to La Paz. She is a client with Kiva partner Impro, and as she has always made her repayments on time, she is able to have another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of peaches

loans.name: Apu Salkantay Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “APU SALKANTAY” actualmente se encuentra en el IX ciclo, el banco comunal esta conformado por 13 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en las ciudades del Cusco. Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país.

Las actividades económicas de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo: venta de habas, maní, golosinas, cosméticos,  madera, panes y biscochuelos y otros ofrecen servicios de turismo, especialista en acabados de madera, enfermera, guía de turismo y  profesor de idiomas. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos de funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto de valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad de capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Ruth forma parte del banco comunal “Apu Salkantay”, es divorciada y tiene dos hijos. Ruth es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que las ingenio para abrir su propio negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de madera es proveedora y trae la madera de la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado. Ruth hace varios años atrás se dedicaba al negocio de venta de artesanía pero le fue muy mal y por eso decidió dedicarse a la compra y venta de madera. Ella requiere el préstamo para los gastos de transporte de la madera como por ejemplo pagar el permiso del transporte de madera de una ciudad a otra.      

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Apu Salkantay" is currently in its 9th loan cycle. The group is made up of 13 enterprising and hardworking people who are always on the lookout for opportunities to get ahead, and with their daily efforts, provide a better future for their children. The members of this group live in the city of Cusco. Cusco is a city that is characterized by its archeological sites, its historic town center, its scenic countryside and its history as an enchanting city in the southern region of the country. The members are engaged in a number of economic activities, including: the sale of beans, peanuts, sweets, cosmetics, wood, bread and cakes. Other members provide services in areas such as tourism, nursing, tourist guides, wood finishing, and teaching languages. The communal bank has had a number of loan cycles; as the members attest, they are content and satisfied with the credit, saving and training services provided. An ongoing valuable aspect of the communal bank is the service offered of group savings, which allows for the possibility of building up capital. Ruth is a part of the communal bank "Apu Salkantay." She is divorced and has 2 children. Ruth is an industrious and enterprising woman who managed to open her own business selling wood that she brings from the city of Puerto Maldonado. A number of years ago Ruth had a business selling handicrafts, but it did very poorly, and for this reason she decided to specialize in the purchase and sale of wood. She needs a loan to pay for the expenses of transporting the wood, for example, to pay for the transport permit needed to bring wood from one city to another. The members in general appreciate the opportunity provided, and they are committed to making each of their payments in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for the transportation costs of wood, for example, to pay for the permit needed to transport wood from one city to another

loans.name: German

texts.es:
El señor German vive en alquiler con su esposa e hijos en la zona San Martín  de la ciudad de La Paz,; Germán trabaja como chofer asalariado con un micro de transporte publico.

El crédito que solicita es para generar una fuente de empleo para su esposa quien se dedica a la venta de CDs  en blanco y grabados en cantidad.El dinero se utilizará para comprar más Cds.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2007  y con un historial de pagos muy bueno, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
German lives in a rented house with his wife and children in La Paz's San Martín neighborhood; he works as a salaried driver of a public transportation minibus. He is asking for funds to launch a business for his wife, who sells blank and recorded CDs in bulk. He will use the funds to buy more CDs. He has been an Impro client since 2007 and has a very good credit history, which qualifies him for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy CDs, both blank and recorded, in bulk for his wife to sell,

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El sr. Reynaldo nacio el 6 de enero de 1983 en la forestal santa cruz, sus padres leonos y su finada madre doña pastora lo iniciaron en el trabajo de la agricultura, trabaja como agricultor en surutu a 40km de el torno ( El Torno es la cuarta sección municipal de la provincia Santi Ivañez, del Departamento de Santa Cruz. Está dividida en cuatro cantones con 65 comunidades campesinas. De acuerdo al último censo realizado el año 2002, la población de El Torno alcanza a 40.000 habitantes.
Es una población joven, constituida por emigrantes venidos del interior del país: del occidente, quechuas, aymaras y de los valles del oriente, así como de las personas autóctonas.
Como característica de Santa Cruz, existen grandes diferencias sociales que conviven en un mismo espacio. Junto a grandes "quintas", propiedad de terratenientes y personas de mayor poder adquisitivo en Santa Cruz, conviven los propios habitantes de la zona, con construcciones mayormente sencillas (adobe y techo de motacú). Existe una diferencia entre las poblaciones de Santa Rita y Santa Marta 1 y Santa Marta 2, que se encuentran al borde de la carretera antigua a Cochabamba, donde se encuentran viviendas de ladrillo y teja junto a las más sencillas, y las poblaciones campesinas que se encuentran hacia el interior de la montaña, que son puramente de adobe y motacú, con condiciones mucho más sencillas, donde no llegan el agua y la luz.
Estas poblaciones se encuentran a una distancia de entre 5 y 20 kilómetros hacia el interior (en la zona pastoral que deben atender los voluntarios). Dicha zona pastoral está compuesta de 9 comunidades, a las que se accede por caminos de tierra por los que a veces pasan vagonetas para poder acceder a ellas.
La economía de la población se basa en la producción agropecuaria y frutícola, así como el trabajo de extracción de piedra, ripio y arena del río Piraí que circunda a todo el municipio. También existe una gran actividad de comercio, especialmente en la población de El Torno, donde se instala el mercado en que se venden los productos del trabajo campesino).
tiene su casa propia, el es soltero todo lo que cosecha lo saca a vender al torno el sale los fines de semana por el problema de transporte ya que el transporte en la zona es escaso, con el dinero del credito comprara semillas para la siembra de Papa, es un joven trabajador y esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Reynaldo was born on January 6th, 1983, in the Santa Cruz forest. His father, Leonos, and his deceased mother, Pastora, started him working in agriculture. He works as a farmer in Surutu, which is 40 km from El Torno. El Torno is the fourth municipal section in the Santi Ivañez province in the Santa Cruz department. It is divided into four cantons with 65 rural communities. According to the 2002 census, the population is up to 40,000 inhabitants. It is a young population made up of emigrants coming from the interior of the country, from the west, Quechuas, Aymaras, and people from the eastern valleys like the Autóctonas. Santa Cruz can be characterized as having great social differences existing in the same area. Large “quintas”, property of landowners acquired in Santa Cruz, and people with greater power co-exist with the area’s own inhabitants who live in more modest houses (adobe with roofs made of palm fronds). A difference exists between the populations of Santa Rita, Santa Marta 1, and Santa Marta 2. These places can be found on the border of the old road to Cochabamba. You can find houses there that are made of brick and tile along with more modest houses. There are also rural populations, which can be found towards the interior of the mountain. The houses there are solely made of adobe and palm fronds under more modest conditions. They do not have water or electrical services. These populations can be found between 5 and 20 kilometers towards the interior (in the pastoral region the volunteers need to take care of). This pastoral zone is comprised of nine communities, which can be accessed by dirt roads. Sometimes trucks are used to be able to access the communities. The population’s economy is based on agriculture, fishing, and growing fruit. People also work at extracting rocks, debris, and sand from the Piraí River, which surrounds the entire municipality. There is also great commercial activity, especially in El Torno. A market is set up in El Torno, and farm products are sold there. He has his own house, and he is single. He takes everything he harvests to El Torno to sell. He goes on the week-ends due to the transportation problem. Transportation in the area is scarce. He will use the money from the loan to buy seeds to plant potatoes. He is a hard-working young man. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting him the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds to plant potatoes

loans.name: Petrona María

texts.es:
Petrona M. tiene 62 años y viven en la Urbanización La Playa de Barranquilla con su hija de 23 años; ella siempre ha sido una mujer negociante,  hace quince años inició su negocio de preparaciòn de alimentos con harina de trigo como empanaditas, deditos; un tipo de pasaboca frita, enrollados en diferentes formas; con los años agregó otros negocios como venta de mercancias  mediante guías especializadas  de productos empresariales; hace siete años adicionò la venta de calzado y el negocio de comidas rápidas hace tres. Últimamente Petrona ha decidido dejar su negocio de pasabocas porque el calor le empezó a afectar sus  manos. Ahora se dedica a los refuerzos académicos de niños y al hospedaje de personas que vienen de otras ciudades a estudiar en Barranquilla.
Su oficio de refuerzo  escolar  de niños, lo realiza de 2 a 6 de la tarde cuando salen de la  escuela, en esta actividad participa su hija. Como tiene una casa propia, la arrienda a estudiantes de otras partes, así que este pensionado es otra fuente de ingresos para ella y su hija. Ahora solicita un crédito con la Fundación por valor de $1.000.000 para hacer inversiones en este negocio especificamente adecuaciones locativas: va a rellenar el patio con el fin de adecuar el desague de lluvias, plantillar el piso, instalar el lavadero de ropas y comprar la canaleta.  
Petrona está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace cinco años y en esta temporada ha tenido siete préstamos, siente que con ellos pudo educar a su hija como ingeniera de sistemas  y que la posibilidad de estudiar esta carrera sucedió a través de la Fundación. A pesar de los desafíos que ha experimentado junto a su hija, como las temporadas de ventas bajas y las limitaciones de su capacidad física y de tiempo, porque viven solas, ha podido seguir adelante y ahora sueña con terminar su vivienda y con tener ingresos que le generen mucha estabilidad en todo sentido.
texts.en:
