Petrona M., 62, with her 23-year-old daughter, lives in Urbanización La Playa, Barranquilla. She has always been a merchant and 15 years ago she started a prepared meals business based on wheat-flour items like: empanaditas (little turnovers, deditos (a type of fried snack), and various types of rolls. As time went by, she added other commercial activities, like catalogue merchandise sales. Seven years ago she added shoe sales. With her fast-food business, she now has a total of three. Recently, Petrona decided to abandon her fast-food business because the heat started to affect her hands. Now she is involved in tutoring children and to provide room and board for persons who come from other cities to study in Barranquilla. Her school children tutoring services are from 2-6pm when they get out of school; her daughter participates in this activity. Since she owns her own home, she can rent space to students from other places and this room and board service is an additional source of income for her and her daughter. She is asking the foundation for a loan, valued at $1.000.000, to invest in this last commercial activity; specifically, to make home improvements. She will fill in the patio in order to redirect rainwater drainage, install flooring and a wash stand for laundry and will purchase gutters. Petrona has been associated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 5 years and has had 7 loans during this time frame. She feels that they have made it possible for her to pay for her daughter’s education as a Systems Engineer and that her being able to study this career was due to the foundation’s help. Despite the challenges she and her daughter have faced, like times of low sales and the physical and time limitations they have because they live alone, she has managed to get ahead and now dreams with finishing her house and having income that will provide her with much stability in every sense of the word.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fill in her patio, redirect rain gutters, install flooring, buy gutters and install a wash stand.

loans.name: Ginelba

texts.es:
La señora Ginelba vive en casa de su madre en la zona de San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz; el esposo trabaja como chofer asalariado y ella para ayudar en el hogar trabaja como vendedora ambulante vendiendo CDS grabados y en blanco.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y poder comprar más CDs y así mantener su fuente de trabajo.


Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2006  con calificación de pagos 1, lo cual significa excelente, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Ginelba lives in her mother's house in La Paz's San Martín neighborhood; her husband is a salaried driver. To help with household expenses, she peddles blank and recorded CDs. The loan will be used to buy more CDs so that her source of work can continue. She has been an Impro client since 2006 and has a repayment score of 1, which is excellent, so she qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy CDs, both blank and recorded, in bulk.

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es:
Marisela C. M. tiene 32 años y vive con sus 2 hijos de 10 y 6 años en el Barrio Abajo de Barranquilla, barrio que para todos barranquilleros tiene un vínculo muy fuerte con los Carnavales. Marisela tiene 2 negocios: un hogar geriátrico que apoya con su otro negocio de venta de mercancía en general. El crédito anterior lo invirtieron inicialmente en el mejoramiento de una habitación que actualmente ocupa una anciana, pero también le ha permitido  generar mayores ingresos tanto para adquirir varios electrodomésticos como una nevera y una estufa, como para comprar algunos elementos para el cuidado de los ancianos entre elementos como un tensiómetro, una silla de rueda de segunda y un baño portátil. El financiamiento de $1.500.000 que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de leche en polvo por proveniente de Maicao, ciudad fronteriza cerca de Venezuela y que vende por kilo a sus vecinos y familiares.  
En el año 2001 su madre, a su lado en la fotografía, trabajaba de enfermera en un hogar geriátrico y se independizó con ella aprovechando su experiencia. Es así como  han pasado por el hogar, cinco  personas en 5 años de los cuales se han muerto 2 y actualmente tienen 2.  En su negocio prestan el servicio de enfermería, asistencia alimentaria y atención en general  y tienen la particularidad de acoger a los ancianos y brindarles mucho cariño, hasta el punto de que a los que cuidan en sus hogares se quieren venir a vivir con ellas. Marisela tiene una tía en Venezuela adonde su madre viaja constantemente para comprar leche y ella se encarga de distribuirla y venderla a sus clientes. También desde hace un año compra según la tasa del bolívar, la moneda venezolana varios artículos como zapatos, bolsos y víveres para la venta. Las dos son muy unidas y colaboran mutuamente en el negocio.
Como el oficio en el hogar geriátrico requiere mucha dedicación ya que los ancianos demandan mucho cuidado, no les queda mucho tiempo libre y esto les impide recrearse e invertirlo en otras actividades. Sin embargo, con el desarrollo del negocio Marisela está pensando en cómo realizar su sueño de progresar al máximo para adquirir su propia vivienda, y esto es su gran desafío ya que donde viven actualmente es arrendado.
texts.en:
Marisela C. M., age 32, lives with her two children, ages 10 and 6, in the Barrio Abajo neighborhood of Barranquilla. All of the people in this neighborhood have a strong tie to the Carnivals. Marisela has two businesses. She has a geriatric home, which she supports with her other business of selling general merchandise. She initially used the previous loan to improve a room that is currently occupied by an elderly person. But, it also allowed her to generate greater income so much that she got several domestic appliances like a refrigerator and a stove. She also bought some items like a blood pressure cuff, a second hand wheelchair, and a portable toilet to take care of the elderly. She will use the $1,500,000 COP that she is now requesting to buy powdered milk from Maicao, a city on the border near Venezuela. She sells by the kilo to her neighbors and relatives. In 2001 her mother, by her side in the photograph, worked as a nurse in a geriatric home. She became independent with her, taking advantage of her experience. That is how they came to have the home. They have had five people in five years. Two of them have died, and they currently have two. In her business they provide nursing services, nutritional help, and general services. They have the ability to take in the elderly and give them a lot of affection. This gets to the point where the people they take care of in their homes want to come live with them. Marisela has an aunt in Venezuela, and her mother travels there constantly to buy milk. She takes charge of distributing it and selling it to her customers. Also, for a year she has been buying, according to the rate for the bolívar, Venezuelan money, things such as shoes, bags, and supplies to sell. The two of them are very united, and they collaborate in the business. As the work in the geriatric home requires much dedication because the elderly demand much care, there is not much free time. This keeps them from recreation and investing in other activities. Nevertheless, with the development of the business Marisela is thinking of how to make her dream come true. Her dream is to progress to the maximum in order to get her own house. This is her big challenge because they rent where they currently live.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy powdered milk by the kilo

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Cerrito Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Ciudad de Benjamín Aceval  Cerrito Chaco. Actualmente se encuentran en el sexto ciclo, en su mayoría las clientes se dedican a la  venta de ropas- Bazar  otras se dependiendo de la facilidad y herramienta de trabajo con que cuentan realizan trabajos variados, como venta de comestibles o venta de frutas o verduras, remedios naturales y otros.
Gracias al crédito concebido por la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva tienen el deseo de superarse cada vez más, y seguir avanzando más trabajando dignamente. 
Así la señora Nilda A. quien se dedica a la venta de alimento que ella misma prepara; como empanadas. Milanesas, sopa paraguaya(harina de maíz con grasa, leche y queso) y otros; también prepara jugos de frutas naturales como de piña, naranja.
Ella utilizó el crédito para la compra de los ingredientes que utiliza para elaborar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Ciudad de Benjamín Aceval Cerrito Chaco Communal Bank is in their sixth cycle. Most of the members sell clothes in bazaars. Others depend upon what they are good at doing and the work tools they have to do various jobs like selling food, selling fruit, vegetables, natural remedies, and others. Thanks to the loan from the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva they wish to improve themselves more each time. They want to keep advancing by working with dignity. That is how Nilda A. is. She sells food that she prepares herself. She makes things like empanadas, breaded meat cutlets, Paraguayan soup (corn flour with fat, milk, and cheese), and others. She also makes natural fruit juices like pineapple and orange. She used the loan to buy the ingredients she uses to make her food.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food ingredients like meat, pastas, baked goods, vegetables, condiments, and dairy products

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es:
La señora Julieta vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la zona Ernesto Torrez de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que ella realiza es la venta de ropa, con esta actividad ella mantiene a su familia y cubre todas sus necesidades.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más mercadería y poder mantener estable su negocio.

Es cliente de impro desde el año 2007 y tiene un historial de pagos muy bueno, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Julieta lives in her own house with her husband and children. They live in the Ernesto Terrez area of the city of La Paz. She sells clothes, and with this activity she supports her family and covers all of their necessities. The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital to buy more merchandise and be able to keep her business stable. She has been a client of Impro since 2007. She has a very good payment history, and she qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more clothes for her business of selling clothes

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Juana del Carmen R. López es profesora de secundaria, es el segundo crédito con nosotros excelente cliente el dinero lo solicita para ajustar la compra de un carro. Tiene dos hijos ya mayores están casados, tiene tres nietos, vive sola con su marido, tiene 15 años de ser profesora del Instituto San Rafael del Sur. Dice que se siente muy bien trabajar con nosotros que el crédito anterior lo invirtió en mejoras de su casa y ahora es otro lo invertirá en la compra de un vehículo para movilizarse de su casa al colegio.
texts.en:
Juana del Carmen R. López is a high school teacher. This is her second loan with us, and she is an excellent client. She is requesting the money to arrange to buy a car. She has two grown children who are married, and she has three grandchildren. She lives alone with her husband. She has been a teacher with the Instituto San Rafael del Sur for 15 years. She says that she feels really good working with us. She used the previous loan to make improvements on her house. She will now use this loan to buy a vehicle to go from her house to school.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a vehicle

loans.name: Adèle

texts.fr: E. Adèle est née en 1981 à Abomey, dans le département du Zou au Bénin. Mariée à AGBODJALOU Jean-Mari, un cuisinier, Adèle est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Adèle vit avec sa famille à Godomey, dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi, depuis trois ans. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Adèle a très peu fréquenté. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Adèle mène comme activité, la vente de tissus et de charbon de bois à son domicile, mais aussi par le système de distribution. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et auprès des distributeurs, que Adèle s’approvisionne. Adèle est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. En vue d'augmenter le stock de ses produits, pour de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire, Adèle sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Adèle E. was born in 1981 in Aborney, in the Zou region of Benin. She is married to Jean-Mari Agbodjalou, a chef, with whom she has two school-aged children. Adèle has lived with her family in Godomey, in the borough of Abomey Calavi for three years, and the couple work together to look after their family's needs. In order to help meet these demands, Adèle sells fabric and charcoal for a living, both through home sales and via a distribution network; she sources her goods from Benin's international market and through distributors. Adèle is an existing ALIDé client and has already received three loans from them, which have all been successfully repaid. She is seeking another loan in order to increase her inventory, thereby satisfying her customers' demands and increasing her profits.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing bags and charcoal

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es:
La señora Gisela vive en casa de su madre en la zona San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene un micro con el cual genera sus ingresos  el cual es manejado por un chofer asalariado; ella vive de los ingresos diarios generados por el micro y puede cubrir sus necesidades mínimas.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar algunos repuestos para reparar su movilidad y mantener estable su fuente de ingresos.

Es cliente de impro desde el año 2009 y tiene un historial de pagos muy bueno, lo cual le facilita el acceso a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Gisela lives in her mother's house in La Paz's San Martín neighborhood. She has a microbus that produces income; it's driven by a salaried driver. She supports herself with the daily profits from the microbus; they are sufficient to meet her basic needs. The loan will be used to buy some replacement parts for the vehicle so that her source of income will be maintained. She has been an Impro client since 2009 and has a very good credit history, which qualifies her for new loan approval.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy replacement parts for her microbus.

loans.name: Adelio

texts.es:
El señor Adelio M. de 52 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Basilia Leiva de 42 años de edad, ellos tienen la dicha de tener 2 hijas que están cursando sus estudios secundarios.
   Don Adelio se dedica en este negocio aproximadamente  desde el año 2.000; el es heredero de unas hectáreas de tierra, que el cultivaba cada año, y con el ingreso compró un local o puesto de trabajo ( comedor),  donde toda la familia se dedica a la venta de comida, en la actualidad tiene una buena concurrencia de clientela por sus buenos servicios ofrecidos.
   El utilizaría este crédito para comprar un local que se encuentra ubicada a lado mismo de su puesto de trabajo, con el objetivo de satisfacer la necesidad de otros clientes.
texts.en:
Adelio M., 52, is married to Basilia Leiva, 42, and they have two daughters who are in high school. Since 2000, Adelio has been cultivating a few hectares of land that he inherited. With his earnings, he has purchased a food stand where the whole family works. They now attract a good number of customers because of the good service they offer. Adelio will use this loan to buy a space next to his food stand. In this way, he will be able to serve more customers.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a new location for food stand

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.fr: Née le 10 Août 1968 dans le département du Zou, B. Suzanne vit depuis une vingtaine d’année à Godomey, dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. Suzanne est mariée à KPOHOUINSITO  Boniface, un retraité, Suzanne est mère de cinq enfants. Suzanne a deux autres enfants à charge. Certains de ses enfants sont scolarisés. Suzanne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants à Godomey. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges familiales. Suzanne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis près de 16 ans, Suzanne vend des condiments de sauce (tomates fraîches, oignons, piments, légumes, etc.) à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Suzanne achète ses produits. Suzanne a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit de ALIDé. Actuellement, Suzanne n’arrive plus à répondre à toutes les demandes de sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, Suzanne sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Suzanne B. was born on August 10, 1968 in the department of Zou. She has been living in Godomey, in the town of Abomey Calavi, for about 20 years. Suzanne is married to Boniface Kpohouinsito, retired. She is the mother of five children and supports two other children. Some of the children attend school. Suzanne lives with her husband and children in Godomey. Together, the couple provides for the family’s expenses. Suzanne did not attend school. For almost 16 years she has been selling, from her home, condiments for making sauces (fresh tomatoes, onions, hot peppers, vegetables, etc…). This allows her to provide for her needs. Suzanne buys her produces in Dantokpa, international market of Benin. She has already received a loan from ALIDé. Currently, she cannot meet all of her customers’ requests. Thus, she is requesting another loan from ALIDé in order to strengthen her activity and to meet the ever-increasing demand of her customers.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 5 baskets of fresh tomatoes, hot peppers and onions

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
El señor Oswaldo vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene un auto con el cual trabaja como chofer de transporte publico.

El crédito que solicita es para la compra de llantas y batería y de esta manera poner en marcha su movilidad ya que es su única fuente de ingresos

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2009. El análisis de ingreso y gastos indica que Oswaldo está en condiciones de obtener un préstamo.
texts.en:
Oswaldo lives in his own home in the Pasankeri neighborhood of La Paz; he has a car with which he provides taxi services to the public. The loan will be used to buy tires and a battery for his vehicle, which is his only source of income. He has been an Impro client since 2009. His income/expense analysis indicates that Oswaldo is qualified for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and a battery for his taxi.

loans.name: Danny

texts.es:
El señor Danny vive en casa de su madre en la zona de Munaypata de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es el servicio de Internet, venta de tarjetas de celular y venta de celulares.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar accesorios de computadora etc., de esta manera mantener estable su negocio y ofrecer mas productos a sus clientes.

Es cliente de impro desde el año 2009 y tiene un historial de pagos muy bueno por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Danny lives in his mother's house in the Munaypata neighborhood of La Paz. He has an Internet cafe and sells cell phone calling cards and cell phones. He will use the loan to increase his capital buying computer accessories, etc. in order to keep his business stable and offer more products to his customers. He has been an Impro client since 2009 and has a very good credit history; therefore, he qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy computer accessories for his Internet Cafe and other items to sell.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: La Sra. Estela E. Hernández es trabajadora activa de una financiera también vende ropa nueva ambulante en el municipio los fines de semana, el crédito lo solicita para compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, perlines y clavos para reparar la cocina de su casa ya que viene el invierno y necesita reparar el techo. Es madre soltera tiene dos niñas. Ya tiene siete años de trabajar con nosotros y todos sus créditos los ha invertido en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Estela E. Hernández works at a financial institution but she also works on the weekends as a street vendor selling new clothes in her municipality. She is requesting the loan to buy construction materials such as roofing materials, steel framing and nails to repair the kitchen in her house since the winter season is coming and the roof needs repairs. She is a single mother and has two girls. She has been working with our organization for 7 years and she has invested all the loans in home repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy roofing materials, steel framing and nails

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine sells telephone accessories and rechargeable phone cards retail to customers in Lagos State where she lives with her husband and two children. She also provides phone call services and with this business she sustains herself and other members of her family. She provides her children with some basic needs. She has been in this business for five years and looks forward to business expansion in the future.

Josephine is asking for loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards and accessories to sell. She hopes to support her husband who runs his private business to support their children’s education.

Josephine says thanks to Kiva and to LAPO micro-finance for this wonderful initiative.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards and accessories to sell

loans.name: Derlis

texts.es:
El Señor Derlis B. de 28 años de edad, esta casado  con la Señora Maria Bajeza de 27 años de edad, ellos aun no conocen la dicha de tener hijos.
   Don Derlis se dedica  al rubro de reparaciones de celulares  aproximadamente  desde el año 2.005; el empezó a trabajar con el capital que su papá le prestó, vendiendo aceites y filtros para camiones, años después descubrió que seria más rentable para el, la venta y reparación de celulares y decidió trabajar fuertemente es este rubro,  en la actualidad su negocio progreso bastante.
   El utilizaría este crédito para comprar de herramientas que el utiliza en su trabajo y además   para la compra materiales de construcción para la refacción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Derlis B., 28, is married to Maria Bajeza, 27; they have no children, yet. Derlis has had a cell phone repair shop since 2005. He began a business selling truck lubricants and filters with funds that his father lent him. However, years later he discovered that the sale and repair of cell phones was a more profitable line of work so he decided to invest heavily in it. Currently, his business has made much progress. He will use the funds to buy work tools he uses and will also buy building materials and suplies for some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work tools and building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Adjoua Pascaline

texts.fr: Z. Adjoua Pascaline est née le 17 Mai 1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ALOUKPE Alexis, un menuisier, Pascaline est mère de six enfants. Certains de ses enfants sont scolarisés. Il y a environs 10 ans que la famille vit à Godomey, dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. Le couple supporte ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Pascaline n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Depuis 8 ans, afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Pascaline vend divers produits (produits de beauté et de soins, des piles, etc.) à son domicile. Pascaline s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Pascaline a déjà obtenu un prêt de ALIDé et l’a bien remboursé. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Pascaline sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ainsi, Pascaline pourra se faire plus de revenus et s’impliquer davantage dans les différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Adjoua Pascaline Z. was born May 17, 1976, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Alexis Aloukpe, a carpenter, and is the mother of six. Some of her children attend school. For about 10 years, the family has lived in Godomey, in the village of Abomey Calavi. The couple supports the family together. Pascale only went to elementary school. In order to provide for her family, Pascaline has been selling diverse products (beauty products, batteries, etc.) for 8 years at her home. Pascaline stocks up at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Pascaline has already gotten a loan from Alidé and has paid it off. In order to grow her business and to better meet the needs of her customers, Pascaline is seeking a second loan from Alidé. Pascaline will thus be able to have more income and to contribute more to taking care of her family.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products (toothpaste, lotion, perfume, hair pommade, soaps)

loans.name: Roger Enrique

texts.es: El Sr. Roger G. trabaja para una cooperativa de ahorro y crédito de electrodomésticos es gestor de cobro, es casado tiene un niño, el dinero lo solicita para compra de materiales de construcción como piedra, cemento y mano de obra para la  reparación de un cuarto. Es el segundo crédito con nosotros y si le han servido de mucho los crédito que se le han otorgado ya que ha podido ir reparando su casa poco a poco y espera que siempre ceprodel le este financiando para seguir mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Roger Gomez works for a savings and loan cooperative for household appliances. He works in collections. He is married and has one child. The money he is asking for is for purchasing construction materials such as stone and cement as well as the labor costs for reparining a room. This is the second loan that he has had with us. The loans he has had with us have been very useful for him. He has been able to repair his home little by little and he hopes that Ceprodel will always finance him so that he can continue improving his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stone and cement and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.es:
Gudelia trabaja como vendedora en un puesto; tambien comparte la mercadería ya que ha invertido en ese puesto donde vende carteras, maletines, billeteras y cinturones en una galería de la zona central. Su esposo trabaja en una tienda como vendedor.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Bajo Llojeta de la ciudad de la Paz; vive en casa de su cuñada como cuidadora.
El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión (comprará cuero, para que puedan elaborar carteras, maletines y los venda en el puesto que atiende).
Es cliente antiguo Impro. Su historial la califica como cliente bueno en  el pago de sus cuotas, demostrando responsabilidad ya que  con este crédito podrá mejorar sus ingresos y condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Gudelia works as a salesperson in a market stall. She also shares the merchandise, as she has invested in wallets, briefcases, billfolds, and belts to sell. The stall is located in a gallery in the downtown district. Her husband works in a store as a salesman. Gudelia lives in the Bajo Llojeta zone of La Paz. She lives in the house belonging to her sister-in-law as a caretaker. This loan will be invested in leather to be made into wallets and briefcases to sell in the market stall. She has been a client of Impro for a long time. Her loan history qualifies her as a good client, always responsible with her payments. This loan will help her increase her earnings and better her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Leather to be made into wallets and briefcases for sale

loans.name: Andréa

texts.fr: H. Andréa est née le 30 Novembre 1965 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est depuis quinze ans que Andréa s’est installée à Godomey, dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. Andréa est mariée à AKPAOCA Blaise et est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Andréa vient en aide à son mari dans les différentes charges de la famille. Andréa a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au secondaire. Mais depuis cinq ans, Andréa fait de l’élevage de lapins. Parallèlement à cette activité, Andréa vend des fournitures scolaires et de l'huile à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Andréa s’approvisionne. Andréa a obtenu antérieurement, un prêt de ALIDé, et l’a bien remboursé. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle, Andréa sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Andréa H. was born November 30, 1965 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Andréa has lived in Godomey, in the village of Abomey Calavi, for 15 years. Andréa is married to Blaise Akpaoca and is the mother of two children, who go to school. Andréa helps her husband to support their family. Andréa is high school- educated. Andréa has been raising rabbits for five years. In addition to this, Andréa sells school supplies and oil from her home. Andréa stocks up at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Andréa has had a loan with Alidé before and has paid it back. In order to stock more products and to better meet the needs of her customers, Andréa is seeking another loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies and drums of peanut and palm oil

loans.name: Edmi

texts.es:
Edmi trabaja como comerciante y su esposo tiene un vehiculo que trabaja como minibús.
La señora le ayuda a su esposo con su trabajo en los recorridos de minibús.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de la Paz, donde tienen su casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión (mantenimiento completo de su minibús).
Es cliente antiguo de Impro. Su historial la califica como cliente bueno en  el pago se sus cuotas, demostrando responsabilidad ya que  con este crédito podrá mejorar sus ingresos y condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Edmi works as a trader and her husband works as a minibus driver with a vehicle that he owns. She helps her husband with his work on the shuttle routes. She lives the Tembladerani neighborhood in the city of La Paz, where she owns her own home. This loan will be used for capital investment (to do a complete maintenance on the minibus.) She is an old client of IMPRO. Her record as a client qualifies her for this loan, based on the responsibility she has demonstrated with her payments. This loan will improve her income and quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to cover the cost of doing maintenance on her minibus

loans.name: Benicio

texts.es: El Sr. Benicio E. es trabajador de la alcaldía municipal su profesión es contador de mercado técnica, en la alcaldía se desempeña como oficial de licitación, es el cuarto crédito con nosotros, el dinero lo solicita para compra de materiales de construcción como piedra piedrín, cemento y mano de obra para hacer un muro del frente de su casa, es casado y tiene un hijo menor a su cargo que está en edad escolar y si los crédito le han ayudado ya que así ha podido sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Mr. Benicio E. is worker at the city hall. His profession is that of technical market accountant. At city hall he works as a bids officer. This is the fourth loan he has had with us. The money he is asking for is to purchase construction materials such as stone, pea stone, cement and to pay labor costs to build a wall in front of his house. He is married and has one minor schoolage child under his care. The loans have helped him since with them he has been able to get his family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stone, pea stone and cement

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos en el sector la Hollería, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de agenciarse de un ingreso adicional con el cual ayudar a sostener los ingresos familiares hizo que empezara a dedicarse a la crianza y venta de animales menores y a la venta de chicha de jora (bebida típica de la región). Estas actividades son de mucha ayuda a la economía de su familia ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero agrícola y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para sostener la economía del hogar.

Nancy cría aves de corral y cerdos para luego comercializarlos con los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Eventualmente también vende los animales a sus vecinos. Por otro lado también prepara chicha de jora y la vende a sus vecinos, especialmente en festividades y compromisos.

Ella desea mejorar la calidad de los animales que está criando para que estos tengan mejor calidad y que sean adquiridos a buen precio. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado para lograr su objetivo.

Nancy es una mujer responsable y emprendedora, su mayor anhelo es ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una educación que les asegure un porvenir exitoso.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 30 year-old mother who lives with her husband and three children in the Hollería area, a rural neighborhood in the Mórrope district of the Lambayeque province, located 45 minutes from Chiclayo. The need to help support her family led her to start raising and selling small farm animals, and selling chicha de jora (a typical Peruvian beverage.) These activities contribute to the economic resources of her family, since her husband works as a farmhand and the income he earns is not sufficient to cover all of the household expenses. Nancy raises barnyard fowl and pigs and later sells them to the traders who always visit the area where she lives. Occasionally she also sells the animals to her neighbors. She also prepares the chicha de jora and sells it to her neighbors, especially during festivals and other occasions. She wants to improve the quality of the animals that she is raising so that they will become more valuable in the market. To do this she has seen the necessity of requesting a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa for 600 Peruvian soles that she will use to buy nutritious animal feed to achieve her objective. Nancy is a very hardworking and responsible woman. Her main desire is to offer her children a better quality of life and an education that will assure them a successful future.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy nutritious feed to improve her business of raising and selling animals

location.town: Caserío La Holleria - C. P. M. El Romero - Morrope

loans.name: Gilberto David

texts.es: El Sr. Gilberto G. es casado tiene una familia numerosa son 8 hijas ya tres de ellas casada ya tienen 2 bebe cada una de él solo depende su esposa y dos hijas menores, la actividad de él es venta de productos de limpieza para el hogar como desinfectante para el piso bayclin, pinesol, petróleo, creolina. y productos químicos como acido muriático, el dinero lo solicita para compra de un terreno. Ya es el noveno crédito con nosotros y si le han servido ya que ha crecido su negocio por que cuando empezó a vender producto empezó con dos productos y ahora tiene 8 prductos y vende ambulante en la zona de san Rafael, masachapa, el salto son comunidades cercanas al municipio y ha podido mejorar su casa y espera seguir trabajando con ceprodel.
texts.en:
Mr Gilberto G. is married and has a large family. he has 8 daughters and three of them are already married, with two babies each. His wife and his two youngest daughters are the only ones who depend on him. His activity is selling cleaning products for the home, such as floor disinfectant. Some of these are Bayclin, Pinesol, petroleum, creolin, and chemical products such as muriatic acid. The money he is asking for is to buy a land lot. This is the ninth loan he has had with us and they have helped him. He has grown his business because when he started to sell products he started with 2 and now he has 8. He sells as a street vendor in the San Rafael, Masachapa, and El Salto area. These are communities close to town. He has been able to to improve his house and he hopes to keep working with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a land lot

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: La Sra. Emiliana esta casada y tiene hijas pequeñas que se encuentran en edad escolar, vive y trabaja en la zona  primero de mayo a 25km de la localidad de limonsito tiene su parcela en la escuela del mismo nombre ella esta trabajando con personas que contrato porque su esposo esta en españa se fue a trabajar hace 1 año, es su primer credito que esta sacando de EMPRENDER,  y todo lo que ella cosecha y los productos que siembra lo saca a  comecializar al torno para venderlo en el mercado.Con el dinero del credito la Sra. comprara semillas para la siembra de Papa, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Emiliana is married and has small daughters who are schoolaged. She lives and works in the Primero de Mayo area 25K from the town of Limonsito. She has a land lot in the school of the same name. She is working with people on contract because her husband is in Spain where he went to work a year ago. This is the first loan that she has taken out with EMPRENDER. She takes everything that she harvests and all of the products that she plants to sell in the market. With the money from the loan Emiliana will buy seed to plant potatoes. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence that the have shown in her by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potato seed

loans.name: Ema Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Ema A. N. es profesora de secundaria tiene doce año de ser maestra, es el séptimo crédito con nosotros es excelente cliente los otros crédito los ha solicitado para mejora de su hogar y este crédito lo solicita para cambio de techo de su casa compra de materiales como zinc, perlines, pernos y pago de mano de obra, la Sra. N. es casada tiene tres hijo dos menores en edad escolar, su esposo es conductor de camión trabaja en Managua vendiendo cemento y piedra.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ema A. N. is a high school teacher and has been teaching for 12 years. This is her seventh loan from us and she is an excellent customer. She used the previous loans for home improvements; she will use this loan to replace the roof; she will buy roofing material, steel framing, bolts and she will also pay for labor. Mrs. N. is married and has three children (two of them are minors); her husband is a truck driver and works in Managua selling cement and rocks.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy roofing material, steel framing, and nails

loans.name: Pumamarca Group

texts.es:
La ciudad de Pumamarca es una comunidad que forma parte del distrito de San Jerónimo de la ciudad del Cusco, Pumamarca se caracteriza por tener zonas agrícolas y ganaderas, Un grupo de vecinas y amigas formaron hace varios años el banco comunal “Pumamarca”, actualmente se encuentra en el VII ciclo, el banco comunal esta conformado por 14 mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en las comunidad de Pumamarca. Las actividades económicas de las socias a las que se dedican son por ejemplo a la venta de: cuyes, F., comida, verduras, animales menores, hortalizas y muebles de madera. Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país.

Dionicia forma parte del banco comunal “Pumamarca”, es casada y tiene seis hijos. Dionicia nos cuenta con mucho orgullo que sus hijos mayores están estudiando en la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco; Oscar de 26 años, Cesar tiene 24 años, Norma tiene 21 años, Rene tiene 15 años, Jessica tiene 8 años y Darci tiene 6 años, todos ellos estudian. Los hijos mayores estudian las carreras profesionales de Ingeniería de Minas, Ingeniería Mecánica, Ingeniería Eléctrica respectivamente y los menores estudian en el colegio. 

Dionicia se dedica a la venta de verduras, los días lunes a viernes vende sus productos de forma ambulatoria en los alrededores del mercado de “Cascaparo” que esta cerca al mercado central del Cusco “San Pedro”, los sábados vende sus productos en el mercado de “Huancaro” y los domingos en el mercado de San Sebastián. Dionicia también se dedica a la venta de animales menores como cuyes. La socia requiere el préstamo para construir un galpón, va comprar calaminas, madera, malla de alambre y también va comprar 100 cuyes. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The city of Pumamarca is a community that forms part of the district of San Jerónimo in the larger city of Cusco. Pumamarca is characterized by having agricultural and livestock zones. Several years ago a group of neighbors and friends formed a communal bank called Pumamarca, currently in its 7th loan cycle. The communal bank consists of 14 hardworking, entrepreneurial women who look at every moment for opportunities to move ahead and with daily effort deliver a better future to their children. This is a communal bank formed by members who live in the community of Pumamarca. The economic activities of the members are for example, the sale of guinea pigs, flowers, food, vegetables, small animals, plants, and wood furniture. Cusco is a city that is characterized by its archeological areas, the historic center, the countryside, and its history, being one of the most enchanting cities of the southern region of the country. Dionicia is part of the communal bank Pumamarca. She is married and has 6 children. Dionicia tells us with great pride that her older children are studying in the National University San Antonio Abbot of Cusco. Oscar is 26, Cesar 24, and Norma 21. Rene is 15 years old, Jessica 8, and Darci 6. All of them are students. The older sons study professional careers of Mining Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, and Electrical Engineering respectively. The younger children study in high school. Dionicia works selling vegetables. From Monday to Friday she sells her products by walking around the areas of he Cascaparo market which is near San Pedro, the central market of Cusco. On Saturday she sells her products in the market of Huancaro and on Sunday in the market of San Sebastian. Dionicia also works selling small animals like guinea pigs. The member requests a loan to build a shed, buy sheets of zinc, wood, wire mesh, and 100 guinea pigs. The members in general are grateful for the opportunity offered and commit to complying with the payment of their different amounts in the established time periods.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The members request the loan to construct a shed, buy corregated zinc sheets, wood, wire mesh, and 100 guinea pigs.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia es una joven luchadora y muy entusiasta de 25 años, está casada con Carlos de 30 años, con quien tiene dos hijos; toda la familia vive en su casa propia. 

Maíz, café, yuca, plátanos, pituca y palta son los productos que cultiva junto a su esposo, quien eventualmente realiza trabajos de carpintería y fabrica hermosos muebles que los sacan de algún apuro económico. A ella le gusta recolectar los granos de maíz, los cuales le sirven para alimentar a sus aves de corral y también para la venta. Estas actividades le ayudan a brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos, quienes son su motivación diaria para luchar y salir adelante.
Alicia está planeando plantar más café en los terrenos que acaba de comprar, para ello tiene que preparar la tierra; así también desea terminar de construir su casa para una mejor comodidad.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y manifiesta que se siente orgullosa de pertenecer a un banco comunal muy reconocido por su zona, el cual se caracteriza por ser un grupo responsable, puntual y solidario. El dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de dos mil plantas de café y materiales de construcción (clavos, calaminas y cemento) para su casa.
texts.en:
Alicia is a young, enthusiastic go-getter who is 25, and is married to Carlos, who is 30. They have 2 children, and the whole family lives in their own home. Corn, coffee, cassava, plantains, and avocado are the main products that she cultivates along with her husband, who sometimes also works as a carpenter making beautiful furniture so that they can avoid economic hardship. She likes to collect the grains of corn, which serve to feed her poultry and which she also sells. These activities help them provide the best for their children, who motivate them daily to fight and push forward. Alicia is planning to plant more coffee on the land that they just bought, and to do this she must prepare the land. In addition she would like to finish the construction on her house to make it more comfortable. This is her first loan with MFP and she states that she feels proud to belong to a communal bank that is well-known in her area, and which is made up of a group of people who are responsible, punctual and supportive. The money she requests will be used to buy 2,000 coffee plants and construction materials (nails, sheets of corrugated metal roofing material, and cement) for her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy coffee plants

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer que no se intimida ante nada, más aún si se trata de brindarle una adecuada calidad de vida a su familia. Tiene 45 años, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos adolescentes y su esposo Pedro de 46 años.

Desde hace 10 años, junto a su esposo, se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero lamentablemente hace 2 años él sufrió un accidente en la pierna izquierda que no le permite caminar; esta situación hizo que ella trabaje con más ahínco junto a su hijo mayor porque no quiere que le falte nada a su familia y mucho menos pasar necesidades. “Mi hijo prácticamente, por el bien de sus hermanos y padre, es el hombre de la casa, por eso quizá no me afecto mucho que mi pareja deje de trabajar, pues Heber (su hijo) es más responsable y estoy muy orgullosa” refiere Ana. 
Por ello, madre e hijo, todos los días salen a las cuatro de la mañana rumbo a sus tierras llevando los operarios que contrataron, ya que les gusta ver siempre limpios sus tierras porque así aseguran una buena cosecha. 
Como les va bien en la agricultura Ana piensa sembrar en mayor cantidad para obtener una mejor productividad, asimismo planea reinstalar su tienda de comestibles, la que cerró porque tuvo que pagar a los empleados que le ayudaron a fumigar sus plantas.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y se muestra feliz de trabajar en su banco comunal, ya que asegura que en cada reunión aprende cómo enfrentar situaciones difíciles que se le presenta en su vida diaria, gracias a las charlas educativas que recibe. Con el dinero que solicita, más lo que tiene ahorrado, comprará los productos necesarios para reinstalar su tienda de comestibles, especialmente bebidas gasificadas que son más rentables.
texts.en:
Ana is a woman who is not intimidated by anything, especially when it comes to providing an adequate quality of life for her family. She is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her three teenage children and her husband Pedro (age 46).

For ten years, Ana and her husband have been dedicated to farming. Unfortunately, her husband was in an accident two years ago in which he injured his left leg to the point that he is no longer able to walk. This situation made her work harder along with her oldest son because she did not want her family to lack anything, much less give up basic necessities. “My son is essentially, for the sake of his siblings and his father, the man of the house. This has not affected me so much as it does my husband, since he is not able to work. Heber (her son) is very responsible and I am very proud of him,” says Ana. Every day, mother and child leave at 4am to head toward their farmland. They have hired workers since they always like to see their land cleared because it ensures a good harvest. Ana believes they have done well in their farming activities because they always plant in large numbers to obtain a more productive harvest. She also plans to reopen her grocery store, which she had to close because she had to pay workers to help with fumigating their crops.

This is her second loan with MFP. Ana is happy to be working with her Communal Bank because at each meeting she learns how to confront different situations that are encountered as a part of daily life, thanks to the educational seminars that have been provided. With the money she requested, Ana will be able to save enough money to purchase products that are needed to reopen her grocery store, especially sodas since they are the most profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise so that she can reopen her grocery store

loans.name: Gomna

texts.en:
Gomna B. is 35 years old and is married. He lives and works in the Hédzranawoé district of Lomé, Togo.

He runs a liquor store called “Maquis Bon ça va” where he sells a variety of alcoholic drinks including a local beverage called sodabi (a traditional liqueur, distilled from palm wine). He started this business in 2008 and is now asking for his first loan from WAGES. He will use this loan to restock his beverages. This loan will help Mr. B.’s business to grow and will keep his customers' thirsts quenched.

loans.use: to buy stock of liquors for resale

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es: El Sr. Gustavo B. Martínez es trabajador de enacal tiene once años de trabajar para esta institución, el dinero los solicita para hacer un cuarto compra de materiales de construcción como arena, piedra, cemento, bloque y pago de mano de obra. El Sr. Gustavo Martínez es casado tiene 5 personas a su cargo  tiene 2 menores en edad escolar, su esposa no trabaja es ama de casa. Los créditos que ha tenido con ceprodel le han ayudado mucho ya que ha logrado terminar de hacer su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Gustavo B. Martínez has been working at ENACAL (a public institution in Nicaragua) for eleven years. He is requesting the loan to build a room; he will buy construction materials such as sand, stones, cement, bricks, and will also pay for labor. Mr. Gustavo Martínez is married and has 5 dependants, including 2 minors. His wife does not have a job and takes care of the household. The loans from CEPRODEL have helped him a lot since he was able to finish building his house.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement, bricks, and stones

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 38 años, es una madre de familia muy laboriosa, está casada con Rómulo de 29 años, con quien tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales vive sólo con tres. La casa que habitan es propia y la construyeron a base de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. 

Cuando su última hija nació (hace 3 años) con una enfermedad que le impide valerse por sí sola, Antonia empezó a ver el mundo desde otra perspectiva, pues los anhelos de brindarle una adecuada calidad de vida, han logrado que trabaje con mayor ahínco, sin descuidarla ni un segundo. 
Junto a su esposo, llevan 22 años cultivando café y refiere que todo de la agricultura le agrada, sobre todo seleccionar la calidad de los frutos, ya que le permite obtener buenas ganancias con  las que cubre la educación de sus hijos, los alimentos y le permite ahorrar para más adelante comprar una casa en la ciudad; donde instalará una tienda de comestibles, además de acopiar los granos de café. Dejar por temporadas su vivienda no le será fácil, pero valdrá la pena porque su hija menor podrá recibir un tratamiento adecuado.

Este es el primer crédito tiene con MFP y manifiesta estar muy agradecida con la oportunidad que le brinda la entidad y los integrantes de su banco comunal. Los mil soles que solicita los invertirá en contratar operarios que le ayuden a cosechar su café.
texts.en:
Antonia is 38 years old and a hardworking mother. She is married to Rómulo (age 29) and has five children, but only three live with them. She lives in her own house, which was built after much effort and sacrifice.

Her youngest daughter was born three years ago with a disease in which her body cannot fend for itself. Antonia began to see the world from a different perspective. She was overcome with desires to provide her daughter with an adequate quality of life, so she managed to work with greater devotion without having to neglect her for one second.

Antonia and her husband have been growing coffee for 22 years and enjoy all aspects of farming, especially selecting the quality of their harvest so that they can generate the best earnings to help cover the education of their children, their food, and some savings so that later they can buy a house in the city. There they can open a grocery store in addition to harvesting coffee beans. Leaving their home during the harvest season would not be easy, but it would be worth it so that their young daughter could receive the proper treatment.

This is her first loan with MFP. Antonia says she is grateful for this opportunity given to her by the Institution and the members of her Communal Bank. With the loan of 1000 PEN that she requested, she will hire workers to help with harvesting her coffee.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire workers to help with harvesting coffee

loans.name: Hugo Rene

texts.es: El señor Hugo M., labora para Inversiones Mendoza Castillo, tiene siete años de estar trabajando en dicha empresa, se desempeña como Ejecutivo de Ventas, vive con sus padres y una hermana, usara el prestamo para realizarle mejoras a la vivienda como ser la reparacion de gradas y pintar dos habitaciones,  su mayor interes es seguir ayudando a sus padres a seguir mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Sr. Hugo M. works for Mendoza Castillo Investments. He has been working seven years for this company as a sales executive. Hugo lives with his parents and a sister. He will use this loan to make home improvements such as repairing steps and painting two rooms. His main interest is to continue helping his parents with making improvements to their home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to repair steps & paint two rooms

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
César tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el anexo Monte Verde del caserío Tranca Sasape, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de tres años a labores de crianza y venta de animales, el usualmente cría cerdos y los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona regularmente. Con las ganancias de esta actividad y con unos ahorros que había juntado de su trabajo anterior como peón agrícola logró adquirir una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros).

Actualmente se vale de este vehículo para generarse ingresos extras. El ofrece el servicio de transporte en sus caserío y con los centros poblados aledaños. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades las utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia.

César se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de allimento balanceado para mejorar la calidad de sus cerdos y también para brindarle mantenimiento a su unidad móvil.

El es un joven bastante responsable y trabajador. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario. César ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
César is 27 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the Monte Verde annex of the village of Tranca Sasape. This community lies in a rural area within the District of Mórrope, Lambayeque Province, which is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

César has been raising and selling animals for more than three years. He usually raises pigs and sells them to merchants who visit the area on a regular basis. Using the earnings from this activity and some savings he accumulated from a previous job as a farm laborer, César was able to acquire a motorcycle taxi for transporting freight and passengers.

He currently uses this vehicle to generate extra income. He offers transportation services within his village and the surrounding areas. The income he earns from these activities help with covering his personal expenses and supporting his family. César is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1200 PEN so that he can buy nutritional feed to improve the quality of his pigs and also pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

César is a responsible and hardworking young man. His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman. He has worked previously with our Institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility when making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi & purchase feed for his pigs

location.town: Anexo Monte Verde - Tranca Sasape - Morrope - Lamb

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara tiene 40 años, está casada con Juan de 48 años, con quien tuvo 7 hijos, pero actualmente sólo vive con los 4 menores. La casa que habita es propia y está construida a base de madera y hojas de Humiro (árbol de hojas largas y fuertes).

En las temporadas de cosecha es normal caminar más de una hora para llegar a sus chacras, por eso cuando se avecina la fecha de recolección ya está preparada, inclusive para quedarse a dormir en la choza que tienen entre sus terrenos, así acelera los trabajos. Lo que más le gusta es hacer secar y escoger los granos de café, aunque le resulta muy pesado trasladarlos frescos.
Esta actividad le permite sacar adelante a sus hijos, cubrir sus primeras necesidades y sobretodo ahorrar para evitar algunos imprevistos. 
Clara y su esposo se dedican al cultivo de café, palta y plátanos desde hace 20 años y para el futuro tienen la esperanza de plantar más café y obtener mejores ganancias para poder mejorar la construcción de su casa.

Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y se muestra feliz de trabajar con las integrantes de su banco comunal porque son personas unidas, solidarias y sobre todo responsables. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en sus tierras de café, también comprará materiales de construcción (calaminas, cemento y fierros) para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Clara is 40 years old and married to Juan, who is 48. They have seven children, but only four are dependents who still live with them. They have their own home, which is made of wood and the leaves of the Humiro tree (known for having large and sturdy leaves).

During the harvest season, it is normal to walk more than an hour to arrive at their farm. When the time to harvest approaches, they prepare themselves by spending the night in a hut situated on their property in order to speed up the work. The part that Clara enjoys most is picking and drying the coffee beans, even though carrying the fresh beans can get very heavy. This activity enables her children to get ahead, since she is able to cover their basic needs and save money for unexpected emergencies. Clara and her husband have been growing coffee, avocados, and bananas for twenty years. In the future, they hope to plant more coffee so that they can generate additional revenue to improve the structure of their house.

This is her second loan with MFP. Clara is happy to be working with the members of her Communal Bank because they are united, supportive, and above all, responsible individuals. With the money she requested, she will invest in her farmland for growing coffee. She will also purchase construction materials (corrugated roofing, cement, and iron) so that she can replace the roof of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her coffee crop & purchase materials needed to replace her roof

loans.name: Mayquelin

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	La Sra. Mayquelin H. es profesora de secundaria de unos de los colegio del municipio ubicado en la zona de san pablo, el dinero lo solicita para compra de un electrodoméstico una refrigeradora para el hogar, es casada tiene dos niños menores uno de ellos en edad escolar. El crédito que obtuvo anteriormente lo invirtió en la terminación de su casa y este va a comprar un electrodoméstico la Sra. H. se siente agradecido con ceprodel ya que estos créditos le han ayudado mucho a salir adelante y tener su casa terminada.
texts.en:
Mayquelin H. is a secondary school teacher in one of the city's schools, located in the San Pablo neighborhood. She needs funds to buy a refrigerator for her home. She is married and has two, minor children, one of whom is still school-aged. She used her previous loan to finish her house and will use this one to buy an electrical appliance. Mrs. H. is grateful to Ceprodel because the loans have helped her a lot to get ahead and finish her house .

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina, de 29 años, es una joven perseverante y sincera que vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, quienes son su razón de ser y su empuje diario.

Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de comestibles y bebidas, especialmente cerveza y gaseosas, productos que le proporcionan mayores ganancias, principalmente los fines de semana cuando su localidad acoge a personas de pueblos vecinos para compartir actividades sociales. A Cristina le gusta atender a sus clientes, aunque a veces es difícil cobrar cuando ha dado algo al crédito, pero igual se siente contenta de aportar para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Por otro lado, desde hace 8 años su esposo cultiva café, ya que su localidad es reconocida como una de las mejores zonas cafetaleras del país y el café que producen es de gran demanda por su exquisito sabor y aroma. 

Este el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, ella es una de las primeras en llegar a las reuniones que convoca la junta directiva de su banco comunal, porque le agrada compartir con sus compañeros. Con los mil quinientos soles que ahora solicita comprará los granos de café de sus vecinos, para luego venderlos al por mayor a una acopiadora de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Cristina is 29 years old and a persistent, sincere young woman. She lives in her own home with her husband and two children, who are her reason for living and the drive that motivates her every day.

For the past two years, Cristina has been selling food and beverages, especially beer and sodas. These products yield the highest returns, especially on the weekends when people from the neighboring towns gather to share in social activities. Cristina enjoys attending to her customers, even though it is difficult at times to collect payment whenever she issues credit, but nonetheless she is happy to be helping with the household expenses. Meanwhile, her husband has been growing coffee for eight years. Their community has been recognized for being one of the best coffee growing areas of the country. The coffee he produces is in great demand for its exquisite taste and aroma.

This is Cristina’s second loan with MFP. She is one of the first people to arrive at the meetings held by the Communal Bank directors because she enjoys sharing with the other members. With her loan of 1000 soles that she requested, Cristina will buy coffee beans from her neighbors so that she can sell them later wholesale to a buyer in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coffee beans to sell

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina, de 32 años, es una persona muy solidaria y está casada con Jacinto de 37 años. Ambos viven en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos, por quienes se esmeran en el desempeño de sus actividades. 

Todos los días, a partir de las 5 de la mañana, abre las puertas de su tienda de comestibles y disfruta mucho de atender a las personas que llegan a su establecimiento porque comparte amenas conversaciones; sin embargo le incomoda el cansancio corporal, pues atiende hasta las 10 de la noche, pero según sus propias palabras “es más fuerte pensar que su sacrificio será recompensado al ver a sus hijos con una profesión”. 
Dina se dedica al comercio desde hace 5 años para ayudar a su esposo a cubrir los gastos domiciliarios, ya que su pareja lleva 12 años cultivando café, plátanos y frutas cítricas en sus terrenos propios ubicados lejos de la ciudad,.
Su deseo es brindarle a su familia una vida cómoda, por lo que ampliará su local y surtirá su tienda de más productos y bebidas gasificadas, las que son muy solicitadas.         

Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ya conoce la metodología de trabajo de su banco comunal, la cual le parece transparente por lo que siente que sus ahorros están en manos seguras. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más mercadería para su bodega, así como granos de café (acopiará), para luego venderlos al por mayor en la ciudad.
texts.en:
Dina is 32 years old and a supportive person who is married to Jacinto, who is 37. They both live in their own home with their three children, for whom they are careful in the handling of their activities.

Every day at 5am, Dina opens the doors of her grocery store and enjoys meeting people who come to her establishment because of the pleasant conversation. However, she gets physically fatigued because she works until 10pm. In her own words, she says, “I am stronger because the sacrifice will be rewarded when I can see my children pursue a profession.” Dina has been in this business for five years as a way of helping her husband cover the household expenses. Her husband has been growing coffee, bananas, and citrus fruits for twelve years on their own land located far from the city. Dina’s wish is to provide her family with a comfortable life by expanding her store. She plans to restock with more products and soft drinks because these item are frequently requested.

This is her second loan with MFP. Dina is already familiar with the Communal Bank methodology, so she is aware that her savings are in safe hands. With the money she requested, she will buy merchandise for her grocery store, as well as coffee beans for her to take later into the city where she can sell them wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store & coffee beans to sell in the city

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin, de 25 años, es un joven carismático y con grandes aspiraciones, es soltero y vive con su hermano mayor en la bonita casa que construyó con sus propias manos. Sus padres viven en la chacra, lo que les facilita atender sus cultivos.

La curiosidad hizo que Edwin sea un experto en el oficio de la construcción a base de madera, actividad que le enseñó su tío y para perfeccionarse estudió en una institución técnica  especializada. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a construir casas, escuelas y elabora muebles de todo tipo. Paralelamente cultiva café y plátanos en sus terrenos propios, estas actividades son bastante rentables por lo que vive cómodamente, esperando encontrar una pareja para conformar su propia familia.
Lo que más le gusta es barnizar sus obras, pues es la fase final donde puede apreciar su labor lo cuál le llena de orgullo, con el transcurrir del tiempo piensa terminar de construir su casa, comprar más terrenos de cultivo y un camión con el que pueda trasladar sus productos hacia la capital (Lima), para percibir mejores utilidades e incluso ayudar a sus vecinos y llevar progreso a su localidad.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, es conciente de que debe ser responsable y pagar puntualmente sus cuotas para no hacer quedar mal a su banco comunal, donde es muy apreciado. Con los mil quinientos soles que solicita comprará materiales de construcción como laca, bisagras, chapas, multiplacas y pintura para su trabajo.
texts.en:
Edwin is 25 years old and a charismatic young man with great aspirations. He is single and lives with his older brother in a beautiful house that he built with own hands. His parents live on a farm where they tend to their crops.

Edwin’s curiosity motivated him to become an expert in building things made of wood. His uncle taught him this trade and he later perfected his skills at a specialized technical institution. For the past five years, he has constructed houses, schools, and has built all types of furniture. At the same time, he grows coffee and bananas on his own land. These activities are profitable enough to allow him to live comfortably. He hopes to find a wife so that he can start his own family.

The part he enjoys most is varnishing his creations because it is the final stage when he can appreciate the work that fills him with pride. Over time he expects to finish the construction of his house, buy more land for farming, and acquire a truck so that he can transport his products to the capital of Lima. This will generate better profits as well as help his neighbors and bring progress to his community.

This is his second loan with MFP. Edwin is aware that he must be responsible and punctual with his payments so that his Communal Bank won’t look bad. The other members greatly appreciate him. With this loan of 1500 PEN, Edwin will purchase building materials such as lacquer, hinges, boards, multi-layered wood panels, and paint for his work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials for his work

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
A Elmer lo caracteriza la sencillez, tiene 29 años y vive en su cómoda casa de material noble junto a su esposa Graciela y sus dos hijos, por quienes trabaja con esmero para facilitarle comodidades que el careció. 

Recoger sus granos de café es de gran satisfacción, pues ve que su trabajo valió la pena y se llena de entusiasmo para continuar. Lleva cultivando café y maíz hace 6 años, con el apoyo de operarios, mientras que su esposa también colabora con los gastos domiciliarios al administrar una tienda de comestibles. 
El progreso de esta joven pareja es evidente porque sus padres les heredaron terrenos donde actualmente construyeron su casa y plantaron frutos. Y como le gusta tener productos de calidad, Elmer recibe asesoramiento técnico de instituciones gubernamentales, quienes apuestan por el trabajo esmerado que realiza, ya que con el tiempo desea tener lo necesario para procesar sus granos y lograr un café de mejor calidad.
Junto a su esposa se han puesto de acuerdo que para los gastos domésticos se usan las ganancias de la tienda, mientras que los de la agricultura se ahorran para comprar una casa en la ciudad donde instalarán otra bodega y comprarán un carro para transportar personas y los productos de las chacras a los mercados.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, pero como conoce a los integrantes de su banco comunal, está feliz de pertenecer a un grupo tan integrado y responsable. Con los mil soles que solicita contratará operarios para que le ayuden a cosechar su café, además comprará costales y canastas que le faciliten la recolección de sus productos.
texts.en:
Elmer is characterized by his modesty. He is 29 years old and lives in a comfortable home made of solid materials with his wife Graciela and their two children. Elmer works diligently to provide his family with the amenities that they lack.

He grows coffee with great satisfaction because he sees that his work is of value and is thrilled to continue with it. Elmer has been growing coffee and corn for six years with the help of workers. Meanwhile, his wife manages the household expenses and operates a grocery store. The progress made by this young couple is evident because they have already constructed a house and planted fruit on the land they inherited from his parents. Since he enjoys producing a quality product, Elmer receives technical assistance from government institutions who invest in his hard work so that he will be equipped to process the coffee beans and achieve a better quality product.

Elmer and his wife have reached an agreement to use the earnings from their grocery store to cover the household expenses. This will allow them to save their income from farming to purchase a house in the city where they will open another store. They will also buy a car for transporting passengers and hauling their produce to the markets.

This is his first loan with MFP. As he gets to know the members of his Communal Bank, Elmer is happy to be part of an integrated and responsible group. With this loan of 1000 PEN, he will hire workers to help with harvesting his coffee. He will also buy bags and baskets to help with gathering of the coffee.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire workers to harvest coffee & purchase bags and baskets for collecting coffee beans

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Señorita Maria de 23 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su madre Doña Aquilina. 
 Maria  es vendedora ambulante de ropas de marcas, calzados, endredones y otros.
 En el negocio cuenta con la ayuda de su madre que sale a vender las mercaderias con ella. Ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada, ya que les ofrece sus productos a bajo precio y a cuotas.
 Maria como un sueño personal, desea abrir una boutique para exibir sus mercaderias para formar mas clientes.
La clienta solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderias como zapatos y ropas de todo tipo.
texts.en:
Srta. Maria is 23 years old, single, and lives with her mother Doña Aquilina. Maria is a street vendor who sells different brands of clothing, shoes, bedspreads, and other items. Her mother helps with the business by going out with her to sell the merchandise. She already has a well-established clientele and offers her products at low prices and with payment options.

Maria has a personal dream of opening a boutique so that she can display her merchandise in order to attract more customers. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as shoes and clothing of all types.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & shoes

loans.name: Ta-Kiliesu Group

texts.en: These are members of the 'Ta-Kiliesu' group. They are small-scale businesswomen who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person in order to expand their businesses. The leader of the group is Kadiatu K.. The 26-year-old Kadiatu is married to a professional worker and they have two children attending primary school. For many years now, Kadiatu has been selling slippers/flip-flops. She is requesting a SLL 500,000 loan in order to buy dozens of flip-flops to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy dozens of flip-flops to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Strikers Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are small-scale businesswomen from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs named their group ‘Strikers’ and chose Magret J. as their leader. Magret is age thirty-three, married to a teacher, and they have three children – one in secondary school and two in primary school. Magret has been selling biscuits and cakes for over a year now. She is requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 in order to expand her business. She will use the loan to buy biscuits, flour, and oil in wholesale.

(This group was originally made up of four members that were pictured above, but quite unfortunately, one of the members (pictured second from right) could not take out the loan because of some unavoidable circumstances).

loans.use: Buy biscuits, flour, and oil wholesale

loans.name: Msf Group

texts.en: Pictured here are members of the 'MSF' group from the township of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. These gentlemen are petty businessmen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each person in order to further expand their businesses. Mustapha S. on the left is the leader of this group. Thirty-eight–year-old Mustapha is married and he and his wife have four children. For six years now, Mustapha has been selling motor spare parts. With this SLL 800,000 loan, he will expand his business by buying more spare parts to add to his business inventory.

loans.use: Buy a large quantity of spare parts to add to his business inventory

loans.name: Cyborg Group

texts.en:
This group of entrepreneurs are residents of Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesswomen who want a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group in order to improve their businesses. They call their group 'Cyborg' and made Adamsay Baby K. their leader. The 40-year-old Adamsay was born in Matam village. She is married to a miner and they have three children.

Adamsay sells market food – rice, onions, palm oil, etc. She also sells fried cakes. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in large quantity.

loans.use: Buy rice, palm oil, onions, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Hope Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Hope' group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 2,400,000 from Kiva lenders for the second time. With the help of their previous Kiva loan, these entrepreneurs were able to expand their businesses. They made more profit and consequently improved their living conditions.

Fannyann D. in the middle is the leader of this group. Fannyann is 49 years old. She is single with 4 children; one is in primary school, one in secondary school, and one in a tertiary institution.
