Fannyann has been raising poultry for over eight years now. She also supplies provisions – milk, cocoa, butter, Ovaltine, sugar, etc. to customers and receives repayments on a weekly basis. With her share of this loan, she will buy milk, cocoa, butter, Ovaltine, and sugar wholesale. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Buy milk, cocoa, butter, Ovaltine, sugar wholesale

loans.name: Two-In-One-United Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the ‘Two-In-One-United’ group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-scale businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to seek a loan of SLL 1,500,000 in order to boost their businesses. Fatmata K. is the leader of this group. Thirty-two-year-old Fatmata is married to a professional worker and they have two children – one in primary school and the other in secondary school. 

Fatmata sells rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), gari (a quick-to-prepare food made out of cassava roots), and 'gara lappers' (locally dyed clothes). She has been doing this business for many years now. With her share of the loan (SLL 500,000), she will expand her business by buying rice, palm oil, 'gari' and 'gara lapper'-making materials in large quantity.

loans.use: Buy rice, palm oil, 'gari' and 'gara lapper'-making materials in large quantity

loans.name: Tamaraneh Ii Group

texts.en:
Saffie J. is the leader of this group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Saffie and her colleague are seeking a loan of SLL 2,600,000 from Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they can expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their standard of living. The 41-year-old Saffie sells market-food – Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, sugar, etc. She has been in this business for many years now. 

Saffie is married with five children. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy Maggi cubes, salt, sugar, etc. to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Ngoyila Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the ‘Ngoyila’ group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. The have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to borrow the sum of SLL 2,300,000 in order to expand their businesses. In this way, they can make more profit and consequently improve their living conditions.

Sento S. is the leader of this group. The 40-year-old was born in Makeni. She is married to a businessman and they have four children – one is attending primary school and three are attending secondary school. Sento sells groundnuts (peanuts). She has been in this business for many years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy bags of groundnuts to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy bags of groundnuts to add to her current stock

loans.name: Concern Group

texts.en:
These are members of the ‘Concern’ group from the township of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-scale businesspeople who are applying for their second SMT/Kiva loan. Previously, each in the group received SLL 500,000 and that loan made a very significant impact on their lives. 

Having repaid that loan successfully, they are asking for a new loan of SLL 800,000 for each. Sahid M. I., pictured on the right is the leader of this group. The 33-year-old is married and has two children. For six years now, Sahid has been running a bar. With his share of this loan, he will expand his business by buying more cartons/crates of both soft and hard drinks.

loans.use: Buy cartons/crates of both soft and hard drinks

loans.name: Tamtemneh Group

texts.en:
Here members of the Tamtemneh group from the city of Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesspeople who have applied for a loan of SLL 4,800,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they can expand their businesses both in size and quality. Consequently, sales and profit will improve for these entrepreneurs so that they can better look after themselves and their children.

The leader of this group is John T., pictured on the left. John was born in Makump village; he is 40 years old and married, with five children. His children are attending school – three in primary school and two in secondary school. John sells a wide variety of items, which include: slippers/flip-flops, soaps, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, sugar and many more. He has been doing this business for many years. With his share of this loan (SLL 1,200,000), he will expand his business by buying the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.use: Buy Maggi cubes, salt, sugar, soaps, slippers/flip-flops and many more items

loans.name: Blanca Milagros

texts.es:
Blanca es una madre de familia de 25 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos menores de edad en sector El Gañan del caserío Punto Nueve, una zona rural dedicada a la agricultura que pertenece al distrito de Mochumí, de la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de agenciarse de un ingreso adicional que ayude al sostenimiento de su familia hizo que hace dos años empezara a dedicarse a la preparación y venta de chicha de jora (bebida tipica de la zona norte del país), ella prepara la chicha en su vivienda y la ofrece a sus vecinos y conocidos. Esta bebida es muy consumida por la zona, ya que los trabajadores agrícolas de la zona piensan que esta bebida les da fuerzas para continuar con sus actividades.

La chicha de jora se prepara con un tipo especal de maíz denominado jora, este maíz se muele y se hierve en grandes ollas hasta que esté completamente cocido, luego se le agrega azúcar y se deja fermentar en vasijas de barro. Esta es una tradición que existe desde tiempos remotos y que es continuada por los pobladores de la zona norte de la región Lambayeque.

Adicionalmente Blanca también se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, ella cría ovejas en la parte posterior de su domicilio y las vende a los negociantes que visitan la zona esporádicamente. 

Blanca se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a ampliar su negocio de venta de chicha. Ella planea comprar mas insumos (azucar, jora y leña) con el dinero del préstamo.	

Ella es una mujer alegre y que siempre busca modos de sentirse activa y de ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir sacando a su familia adelante y brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de continuar estudios superiores. Blanca ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Blanca is a 25 year-old mother who lives with her husband and their 3 minor children in the El Gañan neighborhood of the rural settlement of Punto Nueve in an agricultural area that is part of the Mochumí district of Lambayeque province, located a half hour from the city of Chiclayo. Due to the need to generate additional income to support her family, 2 years ago Blanca started to make and sell chicha de jora (a beverage that is typical of the northern part of Peru). She makes the chicha in her home and offers it to her neighbors and acquaintances. This drink is commonly consumed in this area, since the agricultural workers here think that the drink gives them strength to continue with their activities. The chicha de jora is made with a special type of corn called "jora" that is ground, and boiled in large pots until it is completely cooked. Later sugar is added and it is left to ferment in terra cotta containers. This is a tradition that dates back to remote times and is continued by the people who live in the northern part of the Lambayeque region. In addition, Blanca raises and sells animals; she raises sheep in the back of her home and sells them to the traders who visit the area every so often. Blanca is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles which will help her to expand her chicha business. She plans to buy more supplies (sugar, corn and firewood) with the money from the loan. She is a cheerful woman who is always looking for ways to keep active and help support her family. Her main desire is to continue to advance her family economically and to provide her children with the opportunity to continue their studies at the college level. Blanca has worked with our institution before, and has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies to expand her business making and selling chicha de jora  (Peruvian corn beverage)

location.town: El Gañán - Punto Nueve - Mochumi - Lambayeque

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria V. de 55 años es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 23 años de edad. 
   Doña Maria tiene este negocio  desde aproximadamente  1.974; ella comenzó con un pequeño capital que su familia le regalo, para poder trabajar como vendedora ambulante, tiempos después ya que tenia suficiente mercaderías, se compró una casilla en el mercado, que le dio resultado positivo, y en la actualidad ella ya compro mas de tres salones para la exibision de sus mercaderías.
   Ella utilizaría este crédito para comprar más mercaderías atendiendo que se acerca la temporada de la venta de uniformes para escuelas y colegios.
texts.en:
Senora Maria V., 55, is a single mother with one daughter of 23. Doña Maria has had this business since approximately 1974; she started with a little capital that her family gave her, to be able to work as a street vendor. Some time afterwards, when she had sufficient merchandise, she bought a booth in the market, which brought positive results, and currently she has bought more than three rooms to exhibit her merchandise. She will use this loan to buy additional merchandise, keeping in view that the season to sell uniforms for schools and colleges is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Ameyo Clotilde

texts.fr: Née le 04 Juin 1983 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, H. Ameyo Clotilde est mariée à YESSOUFOU Moussiliou, un soudeur. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, dont seulement deux sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. La famille s’est installée depuis 13 ans à Cocotomey, dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. Le couple assure ensemble  les  différentes charges familiales. Ayant abandonné très tôt l’école, Clotilde a appris la coiffure. C’est ce métier qu’elle exerce depuis une dizaine d’année et qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Clotilde vend également des mèches et des produits de coiffure dans son atelier. Clotilde s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Lomé au Togo. Clotilde a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé, et a bien effectué les remboursements. Clotilde voudrait augmenter le stock de ses produits et mieux répondre aux différents besoins de sa clientèle. C’est pour ce faire que Clotilde sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born June 4, 1983, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Ameyo Clotilde H. is married to Moussiliou Yessoufou, a welder. The couple takes care of four children, only two of which are their own. All of the children go to school. The couple moved to Cocotomey, in the village of Abomey Calavi, 13 years ago. The couple provides for their family together. Having quit school very early, Clotilde learned hairstyling. It has been her profession for about ten years and how she has supported herself. Clotilde also sells hair extensions and hair products in her workshop. Clotilde stocks up at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and also in Lomé in Togo. Clotilde has already benefitted from a loan from Alidé and has properly paid it back. Clotilde would like to increase the stock of her products and better meet the needs of her customers. This is why she is seeking a second loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and beauty products

loans.name: Brisas Del Rio Group

texts.es:
el grupo Brisas del Rio esta ubicado en la colonia Brisas del Rio, esta formado por tres mujeres las cuales son muy trabajadoras. a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la sra. Exdulia C. es una persona emprendedora y muy dedicada a sus estudios y a su trabajo.
Exdulia se dedica a la produccion y venta de torillas, todos los dias se levanta a las 4 de la mañana  para fabricar sus ricas tortillas y luego se va a estudiar, a pesar que no tiene padres a salido adelante,  quedo guerfana a los 6 años de edad y poco a poco a estudiado. Usara el credito para incrementar sus ventas y asi tener mejores ganancias.

la sra. Emerita M. es madre de 2 hijos, Emerita se dedica a la venta de Baleadas a domicilio, todos los dias se levanta  a las 4 de la mañana para poder hacer sus ricas  baleadas.
tiene la ayuda de su esposo para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos. utilizara el credito para comprar materia prima para la fabricacion de las baleadas.

la sra. Felix M. es muy dedicada a su familia, es madre de 2 hijos y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, todos los dias se levanta a la 4 de la mañana para hacer sus ricas tortillas y luego salir venderlas a los alrededores de su casa de habitacion, utilizara el credito para comprar harina de maiz, cal, leña para tener una mayor produccion y por ende muchas ventas y mas ganancias las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
The Brisas del Rio group is located in the Brisas del Rio neighborhood. It is composed of three hard-working women. Following are detailed the different activities that they do: Senora Exdulia C. is an enterprising woman, very dedicated to her studies and to her work. Exdulia produces and sells tortillas, getting up every day at 4 am to cook her rich tortillas, then going to study. She has no parents, they have passed on, and she has been an orphan since the age of 6, studying little by little. She will use the loan to increase her sales, earning a better income. Senora Emerita M. is the mother of 2 children. Emerita sells baleadas (tortillas filled with beans) house to house, getting up every day at 4 am to make her rich baleadas. She has the help of her husband to care for the expenses of the household and of the children. She will use the loan to buy raw materials to make the baleadas. Senora Felix M. is very dedicated to her family, she is the mother of 2 children, she cooks and sells tortillas. Every day she gets up at 4 am to make her rich tortillas, then she goes out to sell them near her home. She will use the loan to buy corn flour, lime, firewood so she can have increased production, more sales, and greater earnings needed to take care of household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sylvie Dansivi

texts.fr: Née en 1954 à Grand-Popo au Bénin, L. Sylvie Dansivi  est mariée à DOSSA Benjamin, un menuisier. Le couple à cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. La famille vit à Godomey dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi, depuis quinze ans. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Sylvie Dansivi   n’a pas été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Sylvie Dansivi prépare et vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs, accompagnée de différentes sauces) de façon ambulante. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Sylvie Dansivi  fait ses provisions. Sylvie Dansivi  a obtenu une fois déjà, de crédit auprès de ALIDé, et a bien remboursé. La clientèle de Sylvie Dansivi  s’accroît un peu plus chaque jour et Sylvie Dansivi  n’arrive plus à tous les satisfaire. Sylvie Dansivi  sollicite donc un deuxième prêt afin de reconstituer son stock de produits et de pouvoir mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1954 in Grand-Popo, Bénin, Sylvie Dansivi L. is married to Benjamin Dossa, a carpenter. The couple has five children, some of which are in school. For 15 years the family has lived in the Godomey area of the city of Abomey Calavi. Together, they take care of the various family expenses. Sylvie Dansivi has never been to school. To meet their needs and the needs of their children, she prepares and itinerantly sells food (corn dough accompanied by various sauces). Sylvie Dansivi does her shopping at Dantokpa, an international market of Bénin. Sylvie Dansivi has already had one loan besides the one from Alidé, and has repaid. Her customers increase a little more each day and she can no longer satisfy all of them. Sylvie requests a second loan to build up her stock and to better respond to the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of corn and fresh tomatoes.

loans.name: Maria Marlene

texts.es:
La señora María Marlene P. Z. , tiene 36 años, tiene una  hija de  un año, se dedica a la producción de tubérculos ( papa, oca, papa lisa) y leguminosa (haba, arveja) la Señora tiene experiencia  más 6 años,  los productos son vendidos en la fría de colomi. Los insumos agrícolas que utiliza son;  abono orgánico (gallinaza), semilla certificadas  son adquiridos de las tiendas agropecuarias  de colomi, actualmente está con la preparación de terreno para la siembra.

La señora María Marlene vive en la comunidad de liriuni a 1 km de colomi hacia norte del  pueblo,  la Sra actualmente vive en la casa de su padre, El padre no vidente perdió la vista hace 20 años, la Sra. Trabaja para mantener a su padre y a su hija, ella es muy trabajadora contrata personas eventuales para la siembra y la cosecha de productos.

Para ellos es difícil acudir a los bancos en busca de préstamo a la cuidad,  el CIDRE está en la zona de colomi que  para ellos es más fácil  acceder a un crédito  para comprar insumos agrícolas que necesitan para la siembra de próxima campaña agrícola así va ampliar la producción de papa.
Ella nos cuenta que se va a casar con el padre de su hija, el mayor sueño que tiene es tener una casa propia con la comodidades propias, y ahorras dinero para hacer estudiar a su hija,
texts.en:
María Marlene P. Z. is 36 years old, and as a 1 year old daughter. She grows tubers (potatoes, oca, ulluco) and legumes (broad beans, peas). María has been doing this for over 6 years and her products are sold in the cold of Colomi. The agricultural inputs that she uses are: organic fertiliser (from chickens), certified seeds that are acquired in the agricultural shops in Colomi, plus preparing the land for sowing time. María Marlene lives in the community of Liriuni, 1 kilometre from Colomi to the north of the village. She lives in her father's house. He doesn't have sight, as he lost it 20 years ago. María Marlene works to look after her father and daughter. She is a very hard-working and contracts casual labour for sowing and harvesting. It is difficult for them to go to banks in the city in search of a loan. CIDRE is in the Colomi zone and so it is easier for them to get a loan from CIDRE to puchase the agricultural inputs that they need for sowing the next season of crops. In this way they will increase their production of potatoes. María Marlene tells us that she is going to marry her daughter's father. Her biggest dream is that she has her own house with good comforts, and savings so that her daughter can study.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de Insumos Agricolas

loans.name: Dine

texts.fr: Née en 1973 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, A. Dine est mariée et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Dine s’est installée depuis une dizaine d’année à Hêdomey dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. Dine vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule leurs différentes charges. Pour y arriver, Dine mène comme activité principale, la vente de savons (de lessive et de toilette) à son domicile et aussi de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Dine vend également des tissus et des fournitures scolaires. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Dine s’approvisionne. Dine exerce cette activité depuis 8 ans et à déjà obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé. Dine a bien remboursé ledit crédit. Dine envisage augmenter le stock de ses produits, afin d’augmenter la clientèle et de se faire plus de revenu. C’est pourquoi Dine sollicite un deuxième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Dine A. was born in 1973 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She's married and the mother of three children, who all attend school. For about ten years, Dine has been living in Hêdomey, in the city of Abomey Calavi. She lives alone with her children, and has to support their various expenses on her own. To manage it, her main business consists in selling clothing detergent and toilet soaps at her home, as well as an ambulant saleswoman. As a secondary business, she also sells fabrics and school supplies. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin. Dine has been running this business for eight years, and already benefited from one loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. This loan was repaid without problems. Dine would like to bolster her stock, in order to increase her clientele and her income. This is why she's seeking a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy several boxes of soaps, and three boxes of notebooks

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
1.El comité se formó en el Barrio Constitution de la Ciudad de Caaguazú, a través de las promociones que se realizó en la zona, un grupo de señoras con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando se unierón con el propósito de relizar un pequeño préstamo con la Fundación Paraguaya, a las mismas les encantó la idea  formar un grupo solidario donde la responsabilidad era conjunta, porque todas necesitaban una pequeña ayuda para continuar en sus trabajos diarios, ellas tienen un solo pensamiento que unidas, y trabajando en equipo nada es imposible.
Una de las señoras que trabaja dentro del grupo es Doña Alicia quien vende joyas de plata y oro, también vende premfumes y lencerias. Ella recorre las casas de sus clientes para ofrecer sus mercaderias.
Tambien ofreces en negocios comerciales y joyerias, su trabajo es sacrificado ya que tiene que caminar mucho para vender sus producto pero ella esta muy satisfecha con la ganancia que obtiene por que mediante ella puede ayudar económicamente a su familia.
El crédito que ella retiró lo utilizó en la compra de joyas de plata y perfumes para vender.
texts.en:
The group was formed in the Constitution neighborhood of the city of Caaguazú, because the loan program was promoted throughout the area. A group of women with a great desire to continue working joined together with the goal of obtaining a small loan with Fundación Paraguaya. They loved the idea of forming an independent group where responsibility was a joint burden, since they all needed a little assistance in order to continue with their daily work. They are of one thought: that together, and working as a team, nothing is impossible. One of the women in the group is Ms. Alicia, who sells gold and silver jewelry, as well as perfumes and undergarments. She visits her customers’ homes to offer her merchandise. She also markets her products to commercial businesses and jewelry stores. Her work is difficult, as she has to walk long distances in order to sell her jewelry. However, she is glad for the income she can generate because it allows her to help support her family financially. The loan she paid off was used to buy jewelry and perfumes to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy silver jewelry (necklaces, earrings, chains, rings) and perfumes.

loans.name: María Hermelinda

texts.es:
María Hermelinda es una madre de familia de 33 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el sector Punto Nueve, un sector agrícola que se encuentra situado dentro del distrito de Mochumí, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la venta de cerveza y chicha de jora en su domicilio, adicionalmente también las distribuye en los domicilios de sus clientes, previo pedido. Este negocio le provee de ingresos extras para solventar los gastos familares ya que su esposo, como la mayoría de hombres de la zona, se dedica a trabajar como obrero agrícola y los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares. Este es el motivo principal por el que María Hermelida se esfuerza al máximo para mantener su negocio.

El negocio ya esta gozando de muy buena acogida, por lo que María Hermelinda siente que ha llegado el momento de ampliarlo, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200  nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de insumos para elaboración de chicha y de mas cerveza para lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer emprenderora y bastante responsable. Su mayor anhelo es podr brindarle a sus menores hijos la oportunidad de llevar algun tipo de estudio superior.
texts.en:
María Hermelinda is a 33-year old mother who lives with her husband and three children in the Punto Nueve area, an agricultural sector found within the Mochumí district, in Lambayeque province, about a half hour from the city of Chiclayo. For the last three years she has worked selling beer and chica de jora (Andean fermented drink -like corn beer) in her home. Currently she also sells them to customers by order. This business has provided extra income to help with family expenses. Her husband, like most of the men in this area, works as a farm laborer and the money that he receives isn’t enough to cover the household expenses. This is why María Hermelida does her utmost to keep the business going. The business is doing well now and so María Hermelida feels that it’s the time to expand. She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1200 new soles that she plans on using to buy ingredients to make chicha and more beer to reach her goal. She is a hard-working businesswoman and very responsible. Her greatest dream is to be able to offer her children the opportunity of having some type of higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make chicha and beer so that she can expand her business.

loans.name: Patuju Group

texts.es:
El banco D. emprendimiento denominado  "Patuju", esta conformado D. 9 integrantes, los cuales se encuentran su primer ciclo,  en la mayoria D. los casos son pequeños comerciantes y productores.                                                                 
La Sra. Antonia es la presidenta del banco cumunal, vive en el municipo D. Cotoca Barrio San Juan D. Dios al rededor D. 12 años, vive en casa familiar con su esposo el Sr. Asis y con sus tres hijos. Tiene la Actividad D. elaboracion D. jalea el mismo que es comersializado en el mercado central D. Cotoca, esto con la ayuda D. sus hijos. Su esposo trabaja D. guardia D. seguridad en el centro D. la cuidad, el prestamo solicitado es para aumentar su capital ya que se encuentra con bastante pedido, el mismo que les ayudara a mejorar su calidad D. vida.                          
La Sra. Robertina es una D. las integrantes D. banco D. emprendimiento la cual vive por el municipo D. Cotoca Barrio Lindo, en casa familiar (D. la Madre), se dedica a la elaboracion D. masitas para venderlos en el mercado, y el prestamo solicitado es para aumentar la produccion del mismo, su objetivo es seguir en el negocio para que con este pueda seguir estudiando.                                                                                                                                             La Sra. Claudia vive en el barrio San Pablo del municipio D. Cotoca en la casa D. sus padres y su pequeño hijo D. 2 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. ropa, sabanas y edredones ambulando por las calles, el prestamo solicitado sera para compra D. mas mercaderia, su anhelo es llegar a contar con un negocio estable o puesto fijo para estar  un poco mas tranquila y atendiendo a su hijito, ya que es madre soltera y no cuenta con la ayuda del padre D. su hijo. 

Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras, estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada enla otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The "Patuju" communal bank is comprised of 9 members, who are in their first loan cycle; most are small merchants and producers. Antonia is the group president; she has lived in the San Juan D. Dios neighborhood in Cotoca for about 12 years. She lives in the family home with her husband, Asis, and their three children. She makes jelly that, with her children’s help, she then sells in Cotoca’s central market. Her husband is employed as a security guard downtown. She will use the funds to increase her capital because she has quite a few pending orders and this will help improve their quality of life. Robertina is one of the members of the communal bank; she lives in Cotoca’s Barrio Lindo neighborhood. She lives in her mother’s house and makes masitas (a type of pastry) to sell in the market. She will use the funds to increase production; her goal is to continue working in her business so that she can continue with her studies. Claudia lives in Cotoca’s San Pablo neighborhood in her parents’ house; she has a two-year-old son. She sells clothing, sheets and bedspreads as a street peddler. She will use the funds to buy merchandise. Her goal is to have a fixed, stable sales location so that she can be a little calmer and able to care for her son; she is a single mother and gets no help from her son’s father. All of the members are responsible and hard-working people; they are grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in them by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr: A. Odette est mariée à ATINDOGBE Jean, un électricien. Odette est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis 14 ans environs, à Godomey dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Odette  a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour assurer ses multiples besoins, Odette vend du charbon de bois à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Odette vend également de l'eau glacée "Pur Water" et des cartes de recharge téléphonique. C'est à Abomey, dans le département du Zou au Bénin, que Odette s'approvisionne en charbon. Mais Odette achète ses cartes de recharges à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Odette exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année et est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé. Odette a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurs qu'elle avait obtenu de ALIDé. Mais Odette a connu une mévente lors de son crédit antérieur. En vue de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et par conséquent son revenu, Odette sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Odette A. is married to Jean ATINDOGBE, an electrician. She's the mother of two school-attending children. The family has been living for 14 years in Godomey, in the city of Abomey Calavi. The couple supports the various family expenses together. Odette stopped attending school at the secondary level. To support herself, Odette sells charcoal at her home. In parallel, she also sells iced water, "Pur Water", and phone recharge cards. Odette gets her charcoal supplies in Abomey, in Zou Department in Benin. But she purchases the recharge cards in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She's been running this business for approximately ten years, and she's an existing client of Kiva's partner, ALIDé. Odette repaid her previous loans without problems. But she experienced low sales during her previous loan. In order to bolster her business and increase her revenue, and therefore her income, Odette is seeking another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal, "Pur Water" water and phone recharge cards

loans.name: Vladimir Enrique

texts.es:
Vladimir Enrique F. Vásquez tiene 33 años, vive en el barrio 7 de Abril de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su esposa y sus 2 hijos de  6 y 3 años de edad;  tiene una Tienda –panadería que comenzó hace algo más de un año de manera muy informal, cuando  trabajaba como empleado de una panadería. Inició  vendiendo un  bulto de arroz a sus vecinos, actividad que realizaba su cónyuge desde su casa, mientras el trabajaba de panadero; este negocio fue creciendo y le agregó nuevos productos como aceite, granos y víveres  de acuerdo a la demanda de su mercado domestico inicial; hoy tiene una tienda panadería  surtida, a la  que dedica gran parte de su tiempo, pues también enseña música, lo cual le genera   ingresos adicionales. Con sus 6 años de experiencia como panadero elabora deliciosos productos derivados de la harina de trigo, los cuales tambien  vende en su negocio. En la actualidad solicita un crédito por valor de $1.300.000  para comprar mercancía y una estera metalica para darle elegancia y mayor seguridad a su negocio.
 
Vladimir es un hombre polifacético, Su sueño mas adelante es que sus hijos lleguen a ser  profesionales. Su meta principal es ampliar  su negocio, remodelarlo y diversificarlo pues quiere adicionarle productos de heladería.

Vladimir ha tenido  dificultades ya resueltas,   como en épocas en que  la recuperación de sus créditos es lenta, pero también tiene muchos clientes rentables  que pagan la mercancía de contado,  con ellos siempre cuenta pues vive en un barrio de gente honesta, alegre  y muy popular donde hay un movimiento comercial muy importante que favorece su actividad comercial.
texts.en:
Vladimir Enrique F. Vásquez is 33 years old. He lives in the neighborhood called '7th of April' of the city of Barranquilla, with his wife and 2 children ages 6 and 3. He has a Store and bakery that he began a little over a year ago in a very informal way, when he worked as an employee of a bakery. He started by selling ricecakes to his neighbors, an activity that his wife carried out of their house while he worked as a baker. This business was growing and he added new products such as oil, grains and provisions according to the demand of his initial domestic market. Today he has a well stocked store and bakery, to which he dedicates a great part of his time. He also teaches music, which generates additional income. With his 6 years of experience as a baker, he makes delicious tidbits from the left-over wheat flour, which he also sells in his business. Currently he requests a credit by value of 1,300,000 Columbian pesos (about $700 US) to buy merchandise and a metal mat to add elegance and greater security to his business. Vladimir is a versatile man, His dream for the future is that his children become professionals. His main goal is to expand his business, to remodel it and to diversify. He wants to add products like an ice cream parlor. Vladimir has already resolved many difficulties, such as in times in which collecting credit accounts is slow, but he also has many profitable clients that pay cash. He always relies on them and lives in a neighborhood of very popular, happy, and honest people where there is a very important commercial movement that favors his commercial activity.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and a metal mat to add elegance and security to his business.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Née en 1972 à Calavi au Bénin, Y. Antoinette est mariée à MASSENON Patrice, un agent de transit. Il y a environs 38 ans que Antoinette vit à Enagnon Est, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Antoinette est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Antoinette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Antoinette vend de la nourriture (riz, "atassi" : mélange de riz et du haricot) dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Antoinette vend des produits vivriers. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Antoinette s'approvisionne. Antoinette exerce cette activité depuis son jeune âge, et a déjà bénéficié de six crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Antoinette souhaite augmenter son stock de produits et mieux répondre à la demande des clients ; ce qui lui permettra de se faire plus de profit. C'est ce qui amène Antoinette à solliciter un autre prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Calavi in Benin, Y. Antoinette is married to Massenon Patrice, who is an import/ export professional. For about 38 years Antoinette has lived in Enagnon Est, a neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Antoinette is the mother of 3 children, all of whom are attending school. Antoinette lives with her children and her husband. Together the couple takes care of the family's needs. Antoinette sells food (rice and "atassi" (a mixture of rice and beans) in her neighborhood. As a secondary business, Antoinette also sells a variety of food products. She supplies herself in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Antoinette has been in this business since a young age and she has received 6 loans, all of which were properly repaid. In order to handle the requests of her increasingly growing clientele, Antoinette would like to increase her stock of products and better respond to client's requests; this will enable her to increase her profits. It is for this reason that Antoinette is requesting another loan.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For food products (e.g. beans, rice, etc.)

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es:
El señor Osvaldo E. de 38 años está casado hace 18 años con la señora Maria Ortega de 34 años de edad, el matrimonio cuenta con tres hijos de 17, 14 y 8 años , el primero está cursando el 2do de la media, la segunda está en el 9vo. Grado y la ultima está en el 2do. grado.

El Sr. Osvaldo está en este negocio como vendedor ambulante hace 5 años, cubre la zona San Agustín, Caazapá, 3 de Febrero, para cual cuenta con una motocicleta, hace un año su señora montó su propio negocio de almacén que tiene funcionando en su casa, con eso aumentará el ingreso de la unidad familiar y  tener la posibilidad de hacerle estudiar a sus hijos. 

Solicita este préstamos para compra de mercaderías como camisas, pantaloncito, ropa interior, buzo para chico y grande,  agogo,  evillas, blusa, media,  bijouteri, remeras y otros artículos. Asi aumentará su stock de mercaderías y ofrecer de esta forma variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Osvaldo E. is 38 years of age. He has been married for 18 years to Señora Maria Ortega age 34. They have three children ages 17, 14 and 8. The oldest is attending the second year of secondary school, the second is in the 9th grade and the youngest is in the second grade. Señor Osvaldo has worked as a traveling salesman for 5 years. He covers the zone that includes San Augustine, Caazapá, and 3rd of February, for which he relies on a motorcycle. A year ago his wife began her own business: a store that she runs in their house, with which they will enlarge the income of the household and have the possibility of supporting their children in their studies. He requests this loan to purchase merchandise such as shirts, shorts, underwear, bathing suits for boys, men and women, buckles, blouses, shorts, jewelry, t-shirts and other articles. In this way he will enlarge his stock of merchandise and offer more variety to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shirts,  blouses, bathing suits, thread, buckles, jewelry and other merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La Señora Guillermina de 32 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Antonio de 36  años de edad. El Matrimonio tiene dos hijos todos  que estan estudiando en la primaria. 
Doña Guillermina es modista, confecciona todo tipo de ropas con la ayuda de su hermana. Ella se inició en el año 1990 con su madre, y luego se independiso. Ella ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada gracias a la buena atención  que les ofrece a sus clientes.  
 Doña Guillermina en este momento esta ampliano su negocio, por el cual solicita la ayuda de nuestra institución para asi poder ofrecer mejor calidad  y mas variedades de productos a sus clientes.
La clienta solicita el préstamo para la compra de telas varios.
texts.en:
Señora Guillermina, 32 years old, is married to Sr. Antonio, who is 36 years old. The couple has two children, both of whom are in grade school. Doña Guillermina is a designer; she makes all kinds of clothing with the help of her sister. She started this business in 1990 with her mother, and later went out on her own. She now has a well formed clientele, thanks to the good service she provides to her customers. Doña Guillermina is expanding her business, which is why she is requesting help from our institution. She wants to offer better quality and more varied products to her customers. This client is requesting the loan in order to purchase several different fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: Née en 1951 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, K. Elise est mariée à TCHOUTCHOU Félix, un gendarme à la retraite. Le couple a trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille réside depuis huit ans à Xwlacodji à Cotonou. Elise vient en aide à son mari dans les différentes charges familiales. Elise n'a pas été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Elise mène comme activité, la vente de poissons et de crevettes frais, de façon ambuulante. Elise s'approvisionne au Port de pêche à Cotonou. C'est depuis 17 ans que Elise exerce cette activité. Elise est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui rembourse bien ses crédits. En effet, Elise a déjà obtenu 12 crédits de ALIDé. Elise sollicite un autre crédit, en vue d'élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle. Elise ambitionne plus tard construire des chambres à louer et se faire encore plus de revenu.
texts.en:
Born in 1951 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, K. Elise is married to Tchoutchou Felix, a retired policeman. The couple has 3 children, all of whom are attending school. For the past 8 years, the family has lived in Xwlacodji in Cotonou. Elise helps her husband pay for the family's expenses. Elise did not attend school. In order to pay for the family's needs, Elise started a business selling fish and fresh shrimp; she sells these products walking throughout the town. Elise supplies herself in the fisherman's port of Cotonou. She has been doing this business for the past 17 years. Elise is an old client of ALIDé, and she has properly repaid her previous loans. In total, Elise has obtained 12 loans from ALIDé. Elise is requesting another loan, with the aim of growing her business and to better satisfy the numerous requests of her clientele. Elise's ultimate ambition is to build rooms to rent, in order to further increase her income.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fish and fresh shrimp

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen  soltera  de 35 años de edad, es comerciante y  tiene una hija de 14 años  llamada Patricia quien se encuentra cursando   el octavo grado de la  Educación Básica.
 La Sra. Carmen comenta que empezó trabajando como empleada en un salón comercial y que hace más de 3 años pudo conseguir el capital de trabajo para poner su propio negocio. 
Actualmente cuenta con un surtido salón comercial en el que trabaja  día a día  para sacar adelante a toda su familia.  En dicho lugar vende prendas usadas de todo tipo, afirma que tiene clientela bien formada y que le compran en forma periódica. 
Ha decidido confiar en la Fundación Paraguaya y solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías, ya que actualmente sus ventas han aumentado.
texts.en:
Señora Carmen is single, 35 years old, a store keeper and has a 14 year old daughter, Patricia. Patricia is currently in the 8th grade of her primary education. Sra. Carmen tells us that she started working as an employee in a retail space, and that more than 3 years ago she was able to put together the capital to open her own business. Currently she has a stocked retail space in which she works day after day to give her whole family a better life. In this retail space, she sells all types of second-hand garments. She states that she has a steady clientele who buy from her periodically. She has decided to put her trust in Fundación Paraguaya and is requesting the loan in order to purchase merchandise, since sales have recently gone up.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise, (pants, t-shirts, skirts, jeans and shoes, among other items)

loans.name: Josefina Amanda

texts.es:
Josefina tiene 37 años de edad, es separada y tiene un hijo menor de edad, vive en el sector El Sausal, una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en su domicilio. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta para mantener a su pequeño hijo y sacarlo adelante, por lo que mantenerlo es de suma importancia para ella, este es el motivo por el que Josefina siempre da lo mejor de si para mantener su negocio ofreciendo productos de calidad y dando buen trato a los clientes.

El negocio esta teniendo buena acogida y su clientela se esta aumentando, por ello Josefina ha pensado en comprar mas abarrotes para ampliarlo, para lograr su objetivo ella se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante conocida y estimada por los vecinos de la zona, ellos la consideran una persona luchadora, reponsable y de confianza. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria.
texts.en:
Josefina is 37 years old, separated from her spouse, and has a dependent child. She lives in the sector of El Sausal, a marginally urban area of the city of Lambayeque, located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past two years, Josefina has been selling basic necessity products and groceries from her home. This business is the only source of income by which she is able to support her young son and get ahead. Providing for her son is of great importance to her. For this reason, Josefina always gives her best to maintain her business by offering quality products and giving her customers good service.

Josefina’s business has been well-received and her clientele is growing. She is thinking about buying more groceries to expand her inventory, but in order to achieve this objective, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 1000 PEN. Josefina is well-known and respected by the neighbors in her area. They consider her to be a determined, responsible, and trustworthy person. Her greatest wish is to continue developing as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to expand her inventory

loans.name: Martin Santos

texts.es: Martin Santos H. C. de 37 años de edad, reside en el pueblo de San Martín, departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa, la señora Brígida Pineda, la cual se dedica a trabajar como comerciante, y junto s sus tres hijos todos menores de edad. El señor Martín, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, el cual es un molino que está ubicado en la colonia El Castillo del departamento de San Salvador,  en el cual ya posee 12 años de tenerlo. Es un negocio muy rentable ya que su ubicación es muy buena debido a que en su alrededor existen muchos comedores, razón por la que cuenta con varios clientes, los cuales a diario llegan a moler el maíz u otros alimentos, lo cual le permite a Martín percibir ganancias diarias. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar nuevos motores los cuales trabajen a base de gasolina, de manera que mejore su servicio, agilizándolo para poder atender mayor cantidad de clientes, ya que en muchas ocasiones sobre todo en las horas pico le es muy  necesario a Martín reducir el tiempo que invierte en cada cliente para dar abasto con todos. Martín es un señor que goza de muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos como también de sus clientes, ya que es una persona muy amable y trabajadora, quien desea seguir adelante y mejorar su negocio para brindarle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Martin Santos H. C. is 37 years old and resides in the town of San Martín, located in the Department of San Salvador. He lives with his wife Sra. Brígida Pineda, who works as a merchant, and their three dependent children. Sr. Martin works in his own business, a mill located in the El Castillo subdivision of the Department of San Salvador, and has been in operation for twelve years. His business is very profitable because it is in a good location surrounded by several eateries. This allows Martin to generate income each day.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy new motors that are powered by gasoline so that he can improve his service, making it faster so that he can attend to more customers. During peak hours, there have been instances when he has had to spend less time with each customer in order to keep up with everything. Martin has very good references from his neighbors, who are also is customers. He is a kind and hardworking person who desires to succeed and improve his business so that he can provide a better life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gas-powered motors for his grain mill

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana Silvia G. D. M. D. 43 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ana posee una tienda D. productos perecederos en los cuales comercializa alimentos y productos D. primera necesidad para el hogar. Por medio D. este negocio, es como Ana ha salido a delante, junto a su familia, ya que es la forma en la que pueD. invertir en los gastos del hogar junto a su esposo quien también trabaja muy arduamente por salir adelantes. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos, tales como: huevos, pan, verduras, detergentes y otros más. Todo lo mencionado anteriormente es con el deseo D. poder seguir adelante con su negocio y D. esta manera mejorar en gran manera la economía D. su familiar. Ana posee una D. las tiendas más fuertes del lugar, por lo cual debe esforzarse más y salir adelantes para lograr mayores ventas.
texts.en:
Ana Silvia G. D. M. is 43 years old and resides in the Department of La Libertad. There she lives with her husband and their two dependent children who are in school. Ana manages a store where she sells perishable food products and basic necessities. Through this business, she has been able to get ahead with her family. Ana is able to cover the household expenses together with her husband who also works very hard so that they can succeed.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy products in large quantities such as eggs, bread, vegetables, detergents, and other items. Above all, she has the desire to move forward in her business so that she can improve her family’s finances. Ana has one of the most successful stores in the area, so she must work harder in order to achieve better sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessity products

loans.name: José David

texts.es: José David O. de 56 años de edad, reside en Coatepeque , ubicado en la cabecera departamental de Santa Ana. Vive junto a su esposa quien es ama de casa, y sus tres hijos, dos de los cuales estudian y el mayor de 24 años se dedica a trabajar. José posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad como: leche, pan, huevos, detergentes, comida enlatada y otros más. Desde hace dos años que él inicio su propio negocio, todo con el fin de poder obtener una fuente de ingresos extra, esto debido a que José también se dedica a la agricultura, pero debido a hay un tiempo del año en el cual no hay trabajo para los agricultores, es por esta razón que él puso su propia tienda, con el deseo de poder sostenerse durante este periodo. José solicita un préstamo a Integral, con el fin de poder comprar mayor cantidad de productos alimenticios, sobre todo más pan, huevos, especias y otros más los cuales son muy utilizados en los hogares. Él desea poder aumentar sus ventas, y surtir lo más posible la tienda para poder atraer a la mayoría de clientes del lugar, con la esperanza de poder mejorar su estabilidad familiar.
texts.en:
José David O. is 56 years old and resides in Coatepeque, the capital of the Department of Santa Ana. He lives with his wife, who is a homemaker, and their three children. Two of them are in school and the oldest child is 24 years old and working. José has a store where he sells basic necessity products such as milk, bread, eggs, detergents, canned goods, and other items. He started his own business two years ago in order to have another source of income. José is also a farmer. He established his own store because there are times during the year when there is no work for farmers and he wanted to support himself during those periods.

José is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to buy a large quantity of food products, especially bread, eggs, spices, and other items that are widely used in the home. He wants to increase his sales and restock his store as much as possible so that he can attract more customers to his place. José hopes this will improve his family’s stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perishable products

loans.name: Mineros San Juan Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento Mineros San Juan  es uno D. los grupos màs antiguos D. nuestra agencia ya que se encuentra en su 8º ciclo. Esta compuesta por señoras D. una misma zona y las que componen la mesa directiva  son las siguientes personas: 

La Sra. Carmen quien es la Presidenta y le identifican como su lider ya que ella es una persona responsable, dinamica y trabajadora; ella tiene 5 hijos y tiene el negocio D. Venta D. cosmeticos ambulando casa por casa el dinero del credito lo invertira en la compra D. cosmeticos que se encuentran en promosion, para despues poder venderlos al precio original y asi poder tener un poco mas D. ganancia; 

Como secretaria esta la Sra. Celia   tiene 4  hijos es casada y tiene el negocio D. venta D. dulces, galletas y chocolates en una D. las calles centricas D. la ciudad y con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia al por mayor y asi poder incrementar su capital D. trabajo.

Como Tesorera esta la señorita Marìa quien es soltera  y no  tiene hijos y su negocio es la atencion D. un local D. venta D. comida en su zona Mineros San Juan ; todas sacaron el prestamo para aumentar su capital y hacer crecer su negocio.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y dinamicas, estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The “Mineros San Juan” (St. John Miners) communal bank is one of the oldest in our agency; it’s in its 8th loan cycle and composed of women from the same neighborhood. The governing board is maD. up thus: Carmen is group president and identified as their leader because she’s a responsible, hard-working and dynamic person; she has 5 children and sells cosmetics door-to-door. She will use the funds to buy cosmetics that are on sale to later resell at full price thereby earning a bit higher profit. Celia is secretary; she’s married and has 4 children. She sells candy, cookies and chocolates in on of the city’s main streets. She will use the funds to buy merchandise at wholesale thereby increasing her working capital. María is group treasurer; she’s single and has no children. She has a food stand in the Mineros San Juan area. All the members sought the loan to increase their capital to help their businesses grow. They are all responsible, dynamic people who are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in them by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: La Union De Joachin Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  LA UNION DE JOACHIN porque son personas muy unidas y viven  en la misma localidad,  Las cinco personas del grupo son    KARINA B. HERANDEZ, FIEL C. M., MARCELA B. P., ARTURO F. H., BERNARDO ARTURO F. A..  Todas de ella viven en el estado de Veracruz.  Marcela  se dedica a la venta de ropa y perfume, Karina a la venta de cerámica, Fidel  vende fierro viejo, Arturo se dedica a la  venta de agua potable, y Bernardo Arturo  tiene una funeraria  en sociedad con su papa.

Karina  es la representante del grupo.  Ella está casada.  Tiene una hija   de 2  años.  Karina se dedica a la venta de cerámica  y comida entre otras cosas.  Ella  asegura que este negocio le  rinde las ganancias suficientes  porque no hay muchos negocios como el de ella en donde  vive.  


Con este crédito, quiere comprar mas mercancía para tener surtido su negocio.  Su meta para el futuro es dar una mejor calidad de  vida a su hija.  Con sus ganancias, ella espera que algún día su hija pueda ir a la universidad, y que su negocio sea uno de los mejores en  joachin.  


Karina dice que ella se siente muy a gusto en el grupo de Unidos de joachin porque ella sabe que puede confiar en ellos ya que se conocen bien y son buenos amigos.  Karina piensa  que los prestatarios de KIVA hacen bien en aportar  a sus actividades  ya que  ellos necesitan para invertir en sus negocios.
texts.en:
This group is called “La Union de Joachin” because the members are very united and live in the same area. The five members of the group are Karina B. H., Fiel C. M., Marcela B. P., Arturo F. H., and Bernardo Arturo F. A.. They all live in the State of Veracruz. Marcela sells clothing and perfume, Karina sells ceramics, Fidel sells aged iron, Arturo sells drinking water, and Bernardo Arturo manages a funeral parlor with his father. Karina is the representative for the group. She is married and has a two year old daughter. Karina sells ceramics and food among other things. She says that her business generates sufficient earnings because there are are not many businesses like hers where she lives. With this loan, Karina wants to buy more merchandise to restock her business. Her goal for the future is to provide a better quality of life for her daughter. With her earnings, she hopes to one day send her daughter to university and have her business become one of the best in Joachin. Karina says she feels very comfortable with the group “La Union de Joachin” because she knows she can trust the other members since she knows them well and are good friends. Karina believes the Kiva lenders have been a great help to their activities because the members need to invest in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ceramics to sell

loans.name: Señoras Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
La señora Leonor es presidenta de un grupo de 11 personas cada una de ellas con diferentes actividades productivas que se juntaron para solicitar crédito a Fundación Realidad. El grupo lleva por nombre Señoras Trabajadoras, le pusieron ese nombre ya que se identifican por ser muy trabajadoras. Se conocen por que ya han tenido experiencias en conjunto con los créditos, con otra institución, pero decidieron cambiar buscando un mejor servicio y una menor tasa de interés.
La Señora Leonor O. N. es originaria y vecina de una comunidad llamada San Marcos, Dentro de la Costa Chica del Estado de Guerrero, en México. La Comunidad cuenta con 13,000 habitantes, siendo Cabecera Municipal, sus habitantes se dedican principalmente a actividades agropecuarias y al comercio.
La señor Leonor tiene 43 años de edad, esta casada, y cuenta con 3 hijos todos en edad escolar, de primaria, secundaria y bachillerato.
Su actividad económica de donde proviene el sustento familiar es el comercio, cuenta con una pequeña tienda de comestibles y artículos de primera necesidad, negocio con el cual lleva 20 años de experiencia.
Ha venido trabajando con créditos desde hace unos 4 años que le han servido para agrandar su negocio, con lo que se han incrementado sus ventas.
El crédito actual lo quiere para diversificar su actividad incursionando a la venta de calzado, con lo cual tendría una segunda actividad productiva para aumentar sus ingresos ya que necesita recursos para la educación de sus hijos que conforme aumenta su nivel de estudios demandan mas gastos.
Sus expectativas con el crédito es salir adelante entre las 2 actividades la tienda de comestibles y la venta de calzado para ir ampliando cada vez mas sus negocios.
Los nombres de las socias del grupo y sus actividades productivas son los siguientes:

Nombre	Préstamo	Actividad económica
Leonor O. N.	5,000.00	Tienda de comestibles
Rosalinda H. V.	5,000.00	Cocina económica para venta de comidas
Honoria S. B.	5,000.00	Cocina económica para venta de comidas
Laura D. A.	5,000.00	Venta de calzado
Nataly P. Pobrete	5,000.00	Venta de cosméticos y perfumes
Abel B. R.	5,000.00	Venta de pescado
Rosa Maria R. A.	5,000.00	Venta de cosméticos y perfumes
Saul B. V.	5,000.00	Venta de ropa para vestir
Berenice C. M.	5,000.00	Venta de calzado
Alfa I. B.	5,000.00	Venta de pescado
Maribel Moran H.	5,000.00	Venta de pescado
texts.en:
Sra. Leonor is the president of a group of eleven individuals who are involved in different business activities. Together they are requesting a loan from Fundación Realidad. The group is named “Señoras Trabajadoras” (Working Women), which identifies them as extremely hard workers. It is known that they have experience working with loans from another institution, but they decided to change and look for better service and lower interest rates.

Sra. Leonor is 43 years old, married, and has three children in school – one in elementary school, one in high school, and another in college. She supports her family by managing a retail business, a small store where she sells groceries and basic necessities. Leonor has twenty years of experience. She has been working with loans for four years and used them to expand her business, which has increased her sales.

With this current loan, Leonor wants to diversify her business activity by selling footwear. She believes having a second business will increase her income and provide the necessary resources to educate her children. Providing her children with an additional level of education will result in more expenses. Her expectations from this loan are to move forward in her two businesses selling groceries and shoes, and to expand each of them.

The names of the group members and their business activities are listed below:

Leonor O. N., Loan Amount = 5000 MXN, Grocery Sales Rosalinda H. V., Loan Amount = 5000 MXN, Prepared Food Sales Honoria S. B., Loan Amount = 5000 MXN, Prepared Food Sales Laura D. A., Loan Amount = 5000 MXN, Shoe Sales Nataly P. Pobrete, Loan Amount = 5000 MXN, Cosmetics and Perfume Sales Abel B. R., Loan Amount = 5000 MXN, Fish Sales Rosa Maria R. A., Loan Amount = 5000 MXN, Cosmetics and Perfume Sales Saul B. V., Loan Amount = 5000 MXN, Clothing Sales Berenice C. M., Loan Amount = 5000 MXN, Shoe Sales Alfa I. B., Loan Amount = 5000 MXN, Fish Sales Maribel Moran H., Loan Amount = 5000 MXN, Fish Sales

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory for selling groceries & shoes

location.town: Localidad de San Marcos, Municipio de San Marcos,

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lucia del Carmen C. D. P. D. 55 años D. edad, resiD. en Ciudad Arce, la cual está ubicada en el departamento D. La Libertad, lugar en el cual comparte su hogar con su hija Zulma P. D. 21 años D. edad. La señora Lucia posee una venta D. productos varios como ganchos, colas y otros accesorios más para el cabello, así mismo venD. juguetes como automóviles plásticos, alcancías, esponjas para lavar platos y otros productos más. Ella tiene ubicado su negocio en las afueras del mercado D. Ciudad Arce, lugar en el cual hay gran afluencia D. personas durante todo el día, situación la cual beneficia en gran manera a Lucia, ya que pueD. mostrar sus productos a mayor cantidad D. personas y su posibilidad D. vender es mayor. DesD. hace muchos años atrás que ella ha logrado salir adelante y criar a su hija gracias a este negocio, ahora Lucia desea poder seguir creciendo en el y D. esta forma contar con un mejor futuro para ella. Lucia solicita un préstamo a Integral a través del cual pueda incrementar sus productos, D. manera que cuente con más variedad para brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lucia del Carmen C. D. P. is 55 years old and resides in Ciudad Arce, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. There she shares a home with her daughter Zulma P., age 21. Sra. Lucia sells a number of different products such as clips, extensions, and other hair accessories. She also sells toys such as plastic cars and piggy banks, as well as dishwashing sponges and other items. Her business is located outsiD. of the market in Ciudad Arce, a place that experiences a large influx of people throughout the day. This situation greatly benefits Lucia because she is able to display her products in front of more people, thus creating possibilities to increase her sales. For many years, she has managed this business in order to move forward and raise her daughter. Lucia now desires to keep growing her business in order to have a better future.

She is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can increase her inventory of products in order to offer more variety and proviD. better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase her inventory

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ana Berta

texts.es: Ana Berta G. G. de 35 años reside en el departamento de Usulután, lugar en el cual vive junto a sus tres hijos de 15, 13 y 9 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ana posee una venta de tortillas en su propia casa, las cuales elabora de lunes a domingo al mediodía. Así mismo elabora tamales los viernes y sábado, los cuales comercializa muy bien. Ana es una mujer muy responsable quien trabaja muy duro por sacar adelante a sus tres hijas, las cuales dependen por completo de su madre, ya que Ana es madre soltera y gracias a su trabajo es como ha logrado brindarles lo más necesario a sus hijos. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz para la elaboración de las tortillas y de los tamales, así mismo pollo, papas y hojas para rellenar los tamales y envolverlos. Ana desea poder aumentar su producción, ya que es esta la única manera que cuenta  para ganarse la vida, es por ello que es de mucha importancia el poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que ella cuenta con muchos clientes pero cuenta con la desventaja de no poseer mucha materia prima, lo cual la incentivó a solicitar dicho préstamo a Integral, lo cual le da la esperanza de poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Berta G. G. is 35 years old and resides in the Department of Usulután. There she lives with her three children (ages 15, 13, and 9) who attend school. Ana sells tortillas from her home and prepares them Monday through Sunday at noon. On Fridays and Saturdays she also sells tamales, which sell very well. Ana is a very responsible woman who works extremely hard to succeed for her three daughters, who are completely dependent on their mother. Ana is a single mother and, thanks to her work, is able to provide all the necessities for her children.

She is requesting a loan so that she can purchase large quantities of corn for preparing tortillas and tamales. Ana will also buy chicken, potatoes, and leaves for filling and wrapping the tamales. She hopes to increase her production, since this is the only way for her to make a living. For this reason, it is very important for her to improve her sales. She has many customers, but she is at a disadvantage because she does not have enough materials on hand. Ana was encouraged to apply for this loan from Apoyo Integral and hopes that it will improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, chicken, and vegetables

loans.name: Julia Del Rosario

texts.es: Julia del Rosario P. de 56 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Vive junto a su hijo de 26 años de edad, el cual trabaja en una empresa privada, y junto a su nieto de 9 años de edad. Julia posee un comedor en cual está ubicado en el mercado municipal de Jiquilisco, lugar en el cual vende sus productos desde hace más de 10 años. En este lugar ella se encarga de elaborar desayunos y almuerzos, los cuales comercializa con los mismos trabajadores del mercado, así mismo con las personas que llegan a comprar ahí, y con otras personas que residen en Jiquilisco. Julia posee mucha experiencia en cuanto a la preparación de alimentos, razón por la que cuenta con muy buenas referencias, ya que brinda un excelente servicio, lo que mantiene a sus clientes muy contentos y con muchos deseos de querer regresar. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder equipar mejor su negocio, comprando verduras, frutas, bebidas, platos desechables, gas propano y otros elementos los cuales son primordiales para el negocio.
texts.en:
Julia del Rosario P. is 56 years old and resides in Jiquilisco, located in the Department of Usulután. She lives with her 26 year old son, who works at a private company, and her 9 year old grandson. Julia manages a diner that is located at the municipal market in Jiquilisco, where she has been selling her products for more than ten years. Here she is in charge of preparing breakfasts and lunches to sell to other workers at the market, people who come to shop, and to residents who live in Jiquilisco. Julia has extensive experience in food preparation, which explains why she has very good references who can attest to her excellent service that keeps her customers happy and wanting to come back.

She is requesting a loan so that she can better equip her business by purchasing vegetables, fruit, beverages, disposable plates, propane, and other supplies that are essential to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, fruit, beverages, disposable plates, propane, and other supplies

loans.name: Cusisiña Group

texts.es:
El centro focal D. Panamericana se caracteriza por acoger a socias que se encuentran en Zonas nuevas D. L. ciudad D. El Alto, generalmente migrantes D. primera generación.
Es el caso D. L. asociación “Cusisiña” vocablo en aymara que quiere decir “Feliz / Alegre”, cuenta con 9 integrantes y están ingresando a su segundo ciclo.
Los negocios D. las socias son: venta D. quinua, tejido D. mantas, venta D. verduras, tienda D. abarrotes, venta D. pescados, tejido D. ropa D. bebé, material D. construcción.

L. señora Juana A., D. 25 años D. edad, casada con un hijito D. 7 años, tiene el negocio D. tejido D. mantillas y ropa D. bebé.   Aprendió D. una vecina, quien L. contrató durane un tiempo, luego elL.  hizo un esfuerzo con el esposo y compró una máquina D. tejer para realizar su propio trabajo y tener sus propios clientes. Cuando se le consulta que le llevó a tejer ropa D. bebé y no otra, elL. responD. que para tejer para adultos requiere D. mayor capital y por eso teje para bebes.  Actualmente su crédito es por Bs. 1000.- que invertirá en lana y para el siguiente crédito elL. espera comprar otra máquina e incursionar en L. elaboración D. chompas para adultos.
texts.en:
The Pan American Community Center is known for the hospitality of its members who live in the newer areas of the city of El Alto, generally populated by first-generation migrants. Such is the case with the association named “Cusisiña” (the Aymara word that means “happy” or “joyful”), which has nine members who are starting their second loan cycle. The businesses of these members incluD. selling quinoa, weaving blankets, selling vegetables, selling groceries, selling fish, weaving baby clothes, and selling construction materials.

Sra. Juana A. is 25 years old, married, and has a seven year old son. She has a business in which she weaves blankets and baby clothes. Juana learned this traD. from a neighbor for whom she worked for some time. Later she maD. an effort to convince her husband to buy a weaving machine so that she could produce her own items and have her own customers. Upon receiving requests, Juana started making baby clothes and nothing else. She says that she does not produce adult clothing because it requires more capital, so she sticks to weaving clothes for babies. Juana’s current loan is for 1000 BOB, which she will invest in wool. For her next loan, she hopes to buy another machine for the possibility of making sweaters for adults.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Fredis Antonio

texts.es: Fredis Antonio F.
texts.en: Fredis Antonio F.

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: María Elena C. O., reside en el departamento de Usulután, a sus 45 años ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos en el mercado regional de Usulután, lugar en el cual trabaja junto a su única hija la cual también comparte el hogar con María. Ambas trabajan muy duro para poder ofrecer todos los productos a las personas que visitan en mercado las cuales son muchas debido a que incluso llegan muchos turistas tanto nacionales como del exterior de país.  María es muy conocida por las personas que residen en el lugar lo cual le trae muchas ventajas, ya que le comprar periódicamente. María solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de pescado, el cual debe comprarse diariamente para que sea fresco, así mismo ella desea poder aprovechar la temporada de Semana Santa, ya que este tiempo las persona consumen el tradicional pescado seco el cual las personas católicas consumen con fines religiosos, razón por la que ella espera contar con el dinero necesario para comprar  mayor cantidad de pescado seco, lo que espera le brinde mayores ganancias, lo cual beneficie en gran manera su económica.
texts.en:
María Elena C. O. lives in the Department of Usulután. At 45 years old, she makes her living selling seafood in the regional market of Usulután. She works there with her only daughter, who also lives with her. Both women work very hard to offer all their products to the people who visit the market, and there are a lot of them due to the fact that as many national as international tourists come to the market. María is well known by the people who live in the area, which has many advantages because they purchase from her periodically. María is requesting a loan from Integral through which she will be able to purchase a larger quantity of fish. She needs to purchase the fish daily so that it is fresh. Likewise, she wants to be able to take advantage of the season of Holy Week, since this is a time when people eat a traditional dried fish; Catholic people eat it for religious purposes. That is the reason she hopes to have the money she'll need to purchase additional dried fish, which she hopes will bring her greater profits and greatly improve her finances.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dried fish and other seafood.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia T. D. G. D. 49 años D. edad, resiD. en Jiquilisco, ubicado en el departamento D. Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como agricultor, y junto a tres hijos uno mayor D. edad, y tres nietos, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ana se dedica a la elaboración D. queso, el cual lo elabora en su propia casa, lo que posteriormente sale a vender a las calles D. jiquilisco, debido a que cuenta con muchos años D. dedicarse a la misma actividad, ella cuanta con muchos clientes los cuales se sienten satisfechos con el trabajo D. Ana. Así mismo ella comercializa parte del queso que elabora, en su casa, negocio en el cual sus hijos se encargan D. ayudarle mientras ella se encuentra vendiendo en las calles. Ana solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar todos los materiales que son necesario para hacer el queso como leche y otros más, así mismo para comprar las herramientas que utiliza para realizar este proceso. El tipo D. queso que Ana elabora es muy demandado en este país razón por la que es muy rentable, ya que obtiene ganancias diarias que son muy aceptables pero que no son suficiente para que pueda invertir más en el negocio, es por esto que ella ha solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar en mayor cantidad todos los productos necesario y así aumentar su producción diaria.
texts.en:
Ana Julia T. D. G. is 49 years old. She lives in Jiquilisco, which is located in the Usulután department. She lives with her husband, who works as a farmer; her three grown children, and three grandchildren. The grandchildren go to school. Ana makes cheese in her own house and later sells it on the streets of Jiquilisco. Because she has been doing this for many years, she has a lot of customers who are happy with Ana’s work. While she leaves for the streets to sell part of the cheese she makes, her children take charge of the business to help her. Ana is asking for a loan to be able to buy all of the necessary materials like milk and other things to make cheese. She will also buy the tools she uses for this process. The type of cheese that Ana makes is in great demand in this country. Therefore, it is very profitable. She gets daily earnings that are quite acceptable, but it is not enough to be able to invest more in the business. That is why she has requested a loan to be able to buy a greater quantity of all of the products that are necessary to increase her daily production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material for making cheese

loans.name: Rosa Elvia

texts.es: Rosa Elvia M. M. de 51 años de edad, reside en Puerto el Triunfo, el cual está ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Vive únicamente junto a sus dos hijas, las cuales le ayudan en el negocio. Rosa posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborarlas y posteriormente venderlas entre los vecinos del lugar, los cuales son clientes fijos, ya que desde hace muchos años atrás que ella se dedica a este tipo de trabajo.
