La tortillería está ubicada en su casa de habitación en la cual cada mediodía se dedica a lavar el maíz, luego llevarlo al molino y posteriormente elaborar las tortillas, que son uno de productos con más demanda en este país, ya que son parte de la comida diaria de los salvadoreños. Es por esta razón que este negocio es muy rentable para maría quien vive de las ganancias obtenidas por este. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor de manera que pueda obtenerlo a menor precio, así mismo comprar algunos cilindros de gas propano para poder contar con una provisión extra de estos. A pesar que Rosa es madre soltera, ha sabido enfrentarse a dicha situación trabajando muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijas y brindarles todo lo necesario a ambas.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvia M. M. is 51 years old, and lives in Puerto el Triunfo, located in the Department of Usulután. She is single, and lives with her two daughters who help with her business. Rosa works selling tortillas, which she makes and then sells throughout the neighborhood. She counts on a good customer base, as she has been in this type of business for many years. Her tortilla business is located in her home where, midday, she dedicates herself to washing the corn, then milling and making the tortillas. These are in great demand in this country, as they are an integral part of the Salvadoran diet. For this reason, the business is profitable, and she lives off of the income it generates. She is requesting a loan to buy corn at lower wholesale prices. She would also like to buy some tanks of propane gas in order to have an extra supply of these. Despite being a single mother, she has known how to face her difficult situation by working hard to help her daughters get ahead and to provide for them.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and propane gas.

location.town: Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es: Maritza Elizabeth M. M. de 31 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután. Lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como contador de una finca, y junto a sus tres hijos de 15, 13 y 8 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar en la escuela del lugar. Maritza es una mujer muy trabajadora, quien al observar que muchas cosas hacían falta en su hogar pero sobre todo para sus  hijos, decidió elaborar tamales para comercializar, estos son una comida muy típica del país, los cuales son elaborados de maíz y se rellenan de pollo y algunas verduras, este tipo de comida se vende sobre todo para las cenas del fin de semana y es un negocio muy rentable. Maritza solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, verduras y pollo, de manera que pueda elaborar más cantidad de productos, lo cual le permita obtener mayores ganancias, lo que la incentiva en gran manera a Maritza para seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Maritza Elizabeth M. M. is 31 years old. She lives in Jiquilisco, department of Usulután. She lives there with her husband, who works as an accountant on a farm, and their three children, ages 15, 13 and 8. The children attend the local school. Maritza is a very hardworking woman. She began to make tamales to sell when she saw the many things lacking in her home, but especially for her children's education. Tamales are made from corn and filled with chicken and vegetables. This food is sold for weekend dinners and it is a very profitable business. Maritza is asking for a loan with which she can buy a greater quantity of corn, vegetables and chicken so she can make a greater quantity of product. This will allow her to earn more, which greatly incentivizes Maritza to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Gladis Esperanza

texts.es: Gladis Esperanza V. D. Q. D. 42 años D. edad, resiD. en Jiquilisco, ubicado en el departamento D. Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijas, las cuales se dedican a estudiar y junto a su padre. Gladis posee una tienda D. alquiler D. sillas y mesas, las cuales son rentadas para elaboración D. eventos especiales. DesD. hace 4 años que ella posee este negocio, a través del cual ha logrado obtener muy buenas ganancias lo cual beneficia en gran manera la estabilidad económica D. su familia, principal razón por la que Gladis decidió iniciar su negocio. Ella solicita un préstamo a integran con el deseo D. poder comprar mayor cantidad D. sillas y mesas, D. manera que puedan atender a más clientes, sobre todo en los fines D. semana en donD. su demanda se ve incrementada en gran manera. El deseo D. Gladis es salir adelante y poder crecer en su negocio para poder brindarle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Gladis Esperanza V. D. Q. is 42 years old and lives in Jiquilisco, located in the department of Usulután. She lives with her husband and two daughters, who are in school and with their father. Gladis has a table and chair rental store, they are rented for special events preparation. She has had this business for four years, from which she has been able to obtain very good profits that greatly benefit the economic stability of her family, the main reason that Gladis decided to start her business. She is asking for a loan from Integral, hoping to purchase more chairs and tables so they can attend to more clients, especially on weekends when she sees demand increasing greatly. Gladis wishes to come out ahead and to be able to grow her business in order to offer a better life to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tables and chairs for rental store.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita R. D. B. D. 48 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su hijo D. 18 años D. edad, quien se dedica a estudiar. Margarita, posee una pupusería, en la cual se encarga D. elaborar pupusas D. queso, D. chicharrón y queso, D. frijol con queso y otras variedades más. Ella se encarga D. elaborarlas y posteriormente comercializarlas en su propia casa, lugar en el cual cuenta con muchos clientes, ya que las pupusas son el platillo típico más famoso del país y que cuenta con mucha demanda por parte D. las personas. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más materia prima para la elaboración D. las pupusas, tales como: queso, frijoles, arroz, maíz y otros más. Margarita desea poder aumentar sus ventas, atendiendo mayor cantidad D. clientes, es por esta razón que ella cuenta con la esperanza D. seguir adelante y D. ir creciendo cada vez más en su negocio, el cual le ha permitido contar con todo lo necesario durante 6 años.
texts.en:
Margarita R. D. B. is 48 years old and lives in the department of San Salvador with her 18 year old son, who is a student. Margarita has a pupusería, where she makes cheese pupusas, fried pork and cheese pupusas, bean and cheese pupusas, and other varieties. She makes and sells them in her own home where she gets many customers because pupusas are the most famous traditional dish in the country and are in great demand from people. She asks for a loan so that she can have the necessary money to purchase more primary ingredients to make pupusas, like cheese, beans, rice, corn and more. Margarita would like to increase sales by attending to more customers. This is why she has hope of succeeding and continuing to grow her business bit by bit. This has allowed her to have everything she needs for the last six years.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cheese, beans, corn, rice, and more.

loans.name: Mikaela Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento Mikaela  es uno D. los grupos màs antiguos D. nuestra agencia ya que se encuentra en su 8º ciclo. Esta compuesta por la siguientes personas:

La Sra. Barbara es la Presidenta ya que la identifican como a su lider por ser una persona responsable y trabajadora que siempre llega temprano y paga sus cuotas a tiempo; ella tiene 2 hijos y tiene el negocio D. Venta D. comida ambulando por la cancha (La Cancha es un centro comercial al aire libre que se encuentra en Cochabamba, dicho centro es el más granD. D. Bolivia; ya que no contiene ningún tipo D. desconcentración en cuanto a las ventas D. diversos productos se refiere, que pueden ser desD. alimentos básicos hasta automóviles D. todo tipo), el dinero del credito lo utilizara para la compra D. insumos e ingredientes para la preparacion D. sus riquisimos platos.

Como secretaria esta la Sra. Adelaida no tiene hijos es joven y tambien venD. comida ambulando por la cancha y el dinero del credito lo utilizara para la compra D. insumos e ingredientes para la preparacion D. sus platos.

Como Tesorera esta la Sra. Susana  quien es casada y tiene 2 hijos pequeños, y su negocio es la venta D. cosmeticos  ambulando ella es una D. las fundadoras del grupo, todas sacaron el prestamo para aumentar su capital y hacer crecer su negocio.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que en mucho D. los casos tiene que sacar a su familia adelante solas,estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianz abrindada en la otorgacion del credito.						
Si quieres ver un video D. la cancha visita esta pagina						
http://videos.lugarlatino.com/video/rGLmg40fBCc/la-cancha-cochabamba-bolivia.htmlnte
texts.en:
The Mikaela communal bank is one of the oldest groups in our agency; it’s in its 8th loan cycle. It’s composed of the following members: Barbara is president and identified as the group leader because she’s a responsible, hard-working woman that always arrives early and pays her installments on time. She has two children and her business is selling food throughout La Cancha (La Cancha is an open-air shopping center in Cochabamba; it’s Bolivia’s largest and has no limits on the kinds of products available, which can be everything from basic food items to automobiles of all kinds). She will use the funds to buy ingredients and supplies to make her delicious meals. Adelaida is group secretary. She is young and has no children. She also sells food throughout La Cancha and will use the funds to buy ingredients and supplies to prepare her dishes. As treasurer we have Susana. She’s married and has two, small children. She sells cosmetics door-to-door and is one of the founding members of the group. All the members took out the loan in order to increase their capital to help their businesses grow. They are all responsible, hard-working people who, in many cases, are the sole providers for their families. They are grateful to Empreder and Kiva for the trust placed in them by granting the loan. If you’d like to see a video of La Cancha, visit this webpage: http://videos.lugarlatino.com/video/rGLmg40fBCc/la-cancha-cochabamba-bolivia.htmlnte

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es:
el grupo Jehova es mi pastor esta ubicado en la colonia Morazan de la ciudad de San Lorenzo,  esta integrado por 3 mujeres vecinas que se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:
la señora Leticia Yamileth H. tiene 34 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos, su esposo se dedica al trasporte. Leticia tiene un negocio de venta de cosmeticos y de accesorios para dama, utilizara el credito para invertirlo en su negocio.

la sra. Sonia Patrica M. Z. tiene 28 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene 2 hijos,  su compañero de hogar es conductor de maquinaria pesada. Sonia se dedica a la venta sopas, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. utilizara el credito para comprar verduras, gallinas, carne de res y cerdo y leña.

la sra. Sixta M. F. tiene 54 años de edad, esta casada con el señor  Eloadio H. que se dedica a la agricultura,  no tienen dependientes.
Sixta se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, compra/venta de tarjetas para celular y agua en botellas, el credito lo va a utilizar en la compra de un fardo de ropa usada.
texts.en:
The group “Jehova es mi Pastor” [the Lord is My Shepherd] is located in the Morazan neighborhood of San Lorenzo. It is made up of three neighbors that have known each other for a long time. Their different activities are detailed below: Leticia Yamileth H. is 34 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is a transporter. Leticia has a cosmetics and women’s accessory sales business. She will use the loan to invest in her business. Sonia Patricia M. Z. is 28 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has two children. Her domestic partner drives heavy machinery. Sonia sells soup, she has been doing this activity for many years. She will use the loan to purchase vegetables, chickens, beef, pork, and firewood. Sixta M. F. is 54 years old and married to Eloadio H., who works in agriculture. They do not have dependants. Sixta sells used clothes and purchases and sells cell phone cards and water bottles. She will use the loan to purchase a bale of used clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics, clothing, vegetables, and meat.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Barrio Alegre Group

texts.es:
Comité Barrio Alegre se denomina el grupo conformado en fecha 16 de julio del 2.008, gracias a que la actual Directora General Zulli González, se  contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para  informarse de como funciona el Comité de Mujeres   Emprendedoras, una vez enterada logró juntar  a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando con el Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras ya en el 5º ciclo. 
Todas las integrantes del grupo se encuentran muy contentas trabajando en forma conjunta y solidaria.
Cada una de las  señoras realiza diferentes actividades así como Doña Zulli quien elabora productos panificados para vender. Ella en su casa posee el horno a leña donde cocina sus productos como Galletas, Panes, tortas y otros.
La señora Zulli trabaja  con toda la familia para salir adelante, ella en su panadera y su marido quien se dedica a la albañilería en sus trabajo como jornalero, y de esta manera la pareja sale adelante dignamente.
El crédito solicitado fue para la compra de ingrediente para la elaboración de panificados como; harina de trigo de distintos tipos, levaduras, quesos, dulces, azúcar, leche y otros.
texts.en:
The Comité Barrio Alegre (Happy Neighborhood) group was formed on July 16, 2008 when the Managing Director, Zulli González, contacted the weekly meeting coordinator to get information about the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee for Enterprising Women). With the information at hand, she was able to find 17 women who are now working with the Committee for Enterprising Women program and they are now on their fifth loan cycle. The group members are very happy to work together in solidarity. Each of the ladies has a different type of business. Doña Zulli makes and sells baked goods, such as cookies, breads, cakes and other products. Doña Zulli and her husband, a mason, work together and aim to get ahead with dignity. The loan they are requesting is being used to buy ingredients to make baked goods such as flour, cheese, sweets, sugar, milk and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baking ingredients.

loans.name: Joyitas Group

texts.es:
La  Asociación Comunal “Joyitas” que trabaja en el centro focal de Panamericana cuenta con once integrantes, la asociación ya tiene 17 ciclos funcionando.  Los negocios que las señoras declaran son: diferentes artesanías, tejido de chompas y producción, comerciante y venta de dulces,  producción de calzados peinadoras, electrónica, serigrafía, tienda de abarrotes, costurera, venta de chamarras y producción de canastas artesanales.
Una de las socias más antiguas, Doña Julia L., indica que se encuentra desde la fundación de la asociación, eso significa que ya tiene 8 años y medio como socia de la A.C. Joyitas.  A sus 52 años, ella cuenta con una gran familia que esta conformada por, 3 hijos casados, 3 hijos que están a punto de casarse y 6 hijos que están bajo la tutela de ella y de su esposo.
Doña Julia refiere que antes tenía un negocio de venta de comida, pero que ahora gracias a que uno de sus hijos aprendió a coser chamarras ella ha cambiado de negocio y ahora le va mejor.
Durante estos años los créditos han sido variados, de acuerdo a las necesidades del negocio, la solicitud de ahora es por Bs.1500.-, monto que le alcanzará para comprar un rollo de tela y accesorios, como cierres, forros, puño e hilo.

El joven Yuri F. y Jacquelina L.  no salieron en la foto.
texts.en:
The Joyitas Communal Bank works in the Centro Focal Panamericana. The group has 11 members, and they have had 17 cycles. The women’s businesses are different handicrafts, knitting and producing sweaters, merchant, selling sweets, footwear production, hairdresser, electronics, silk screening, grocery store, seamstress, selling jackets, and production of handmade baskets. Julia L. is one of the oldest members, and she has been a member since the association began. This means that she has been a member of the A.C. Joyitas for eight and a half years. At 52 years of age, she has a large family, which is comprised of three married children, three children about to get married, and six children who are under the guardianship of Julia and her husband. Julia says that she used to have a business selling food. Now, thanks to the help of one of her children, she learned how to sew jackets. She changed businesses, and now it is going better. During these years the loans have been varied depending on the needs of the business. The request now is for Bs 1500, an amount that will cover the purchase of a roll of fabric and accessories like zippers, lining, cuffs, and thread. Yuri F. and Jacquelina L. do not appear in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
el señor Lorenzo L. G. tiene 58 años de edad,  esta casado con la señora Olga Marina Nuñez  quien es ama de casa. El señor Lorenzo se dedica a la venta de leña y granos basicos, ademas vende sandias cuando es la epoca de esta fruta. el credito lo utilizara para comprar leña.
el sr. Lorenzo es una persona muy humilde y respetuosa, tiene un gran espiritu de superacion.
Ahorita esta construyendo su casa de ladrillo ya que antes era de adobe.
texts.en:
Lorenzo L. G. is 58 years old and married to Olga Marina Nuñez, who is a homemaker. Lorenzo sells firewood and staple grains, as well as watermelons when they are in season. He will use the loan to buy firewood. Lorenzo is a very humble and respectful person with a strong spirit. At the moment he is building a brick house; his old home was made of adobe.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase firewood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marcial Juan

texts.es: El Sr. MARCIAL ESTA CASADO Y SE DEDICA A LA REPOSTERIA EN SU DOMICILIO, ACTUALMENTE ESTA ELABORANDO SALTEÑAS CON LA AYUDA DE LA ESPOSA QUIEN LAS VENDE EN PLENA ESQUINA DE LA CALLE 42, ACTIVIDAD CON LA QUE SOSTIENE A SU FAMILIA, QUE ESTA INTEGRADA POR LA PAREJA Y SUS 2 HIJOS PEQUEÑOS, LOS MISMOS QUE ESTAN ESTUDIANDO EN UNA ESCUELITA FISCAL DE LA ZONA , TAMBIEN PODEMOS INDICAR QUE EL CLIENTE ES MUY RESPONSABLE Y MUY CONOCIDO POR SUS VECINOS, SU DESEO ES DE TENER UNA PASTELERIA DONDE PUEDA OFRECER SUS PRODUCTOS Y TAMBIEN VER A SUS HIJOS PROFESIONALES, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Marcial is married and bakes from his home. Currently he makes salteñas (savory pastries) with the help of his wife, who sells them out on the corner of 42nd St. This activity supports their family, including the couple and their two young children, who study at the local public school. The client is very responsible and well known by his neighbors. He wants to open a bakery where he can sell his products as well as provide careers for his children. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence in him demonstrated by the loan offer.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne, 34, is married and has three children, two of whom go to school.  She has been running a restaurant for nine years and has four employees. Her husband is employed in a co-operative Sacco (Savings and Credit Cooperative Organization). 

She has previously taken out one loan from Faulu Kenya which she has successfully repaid.  She hopes to grow her business and to improve her standard of living. She has requested a loan of Kes 80,000 to renovate her business premises and to buy ingredients such as cooking fat, wheat flour, maize flour and rice. She describes herself as hardworking and social.

loans.use: To renovate the business premises and to buy stock

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 32 year old, single man. He runs a retail shop where he sells beads, marts, traditional African clothing such as `kitenge' and carvings to local people and tourists. He has been in this business for four years and has one employee. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has benefited by regularly saving money. He wants to take his first loan and plans to expand his business and start exporting his goods to other countries. He has requested a loan of Kes 50,000 to increase his stock of beads, marts and `kitenges’.  He describes himself as ambitious and hardworking.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Javier Pedro

texts.es: El Sr. Javier, es un cliente nuevo en el crédito. Aunque se considera antiguo, puesto que su esposa la Sra. Lidia trabajo con Emprender desde el año 2004 al 2007, con crédito en grupo y tambien individualmente, el es transportista de la linea de trufis (servicio de transporte urbano de pasajeros), que hace el recorrido desde el centro de la ciudad hacia la zona sur, razón por la cual él figura como titular, ya que tiene mayor accecibilidad a la oficina de Chasquipampa, la esposa tiene un puesto de venta de api y pasteles en la zona de Alto Obrajes, ellos tienen una familia compuesta por dos hijos que estudian en nivel secundario y una niña que tiene un año aproximadamente, y el cuidado de ella lo realiza la señora, es una pareja joven con muchos proyectos e superación, ademas de ser muy responsables. Con el dinero del credito comprara llantas nuevas para su movilidad, Uno de sus deseos es de comprarse una casita. Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Although Javier is new client of the loan program, he has been involved for a long time, since he wife Lidia worked with Emprender from 2004 to 2007, receiving group as well as individual loans. He is a minibus operator for the public transportation system, driving from the city center to the southern region, which is a steady job with good access to the Chasquipama office. His wife has a kiosk where she sells api (a corn drink) and cakes in the Alto Obrajes area. They have two children in high school and a one-year-old daughter, who Lidia cares for. They are a young couple with many projects and lots of motivation, in addition to being very responsible. With the money from the loan they will purchase new tires for their vehicle. One of their dreams is to buy a small house. Javier is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence demonstrated by the loan offer.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase tires

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 48, is married with four children, two of whom attend school. He has been running a timber workshop for thirteen years. He has three employees who assist him in the business. He also practices mixed farming for commercial purposes. Since he has been a member of Faulu Kenya, his business has expanded and his standard of living has improved. He plans to grow his farming and workshop business and to open outlets. 

He has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy timber. He describes himself as ambitious.

loans.use: To buy timber to make furniture and wood products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Perlas Group

texts.es:
Las Perlas se denomina el grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de ITA en fecha 09 de enero de 2.008 gracias a que la actual Directora General, la Sra. Acela Céspedes, contactó con la asesora en una de las reuniones semanales que la misma tenía en la zona para enterarse mejor de la forma de trabajo que tiene el comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Una vez asesorada logró juntar 22 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto y en forma solidaria dentro del programa.
Una de la integrantes es la señora Acela quien después de integrarse al comité de mujeres decidió abrir  su negocio ofreciendo todo tipo de artículos como útiles escolares, uniformes, artículos decorativos, y otros.
Con cada actividad que realiza el comité y con cada crédito que ella recibe compra todos las mercaderías requeridas por los clientes.
El negocio es muy importante para la familia ya que ayuda mucho con los gastos de la casa en cuanto a vestimenta de los hijos y otros gastos escolares.
El crédito solicitado fue para la compra de mercaderías en general como uniformes, artículos escolares y otros.
texts.en:
Las Perlas (The Pearls) is the name of a group of women in the city of Ita. They got together on January 9th, 2008, and their current executive director is Sra. Acela Céspedes. She contacted an advisor at one of the weekly meetings in the area to learn more about the work of the Mujeres Emprendedoras committee. After receiving that advice, Acela managed to get together a group of 22 women who work together well and provide each other with support within the program. Sra. Acela is one of the members. After joining the group of women, she decided to open a business selling a range of items such as school supplies, uniforms, decorations etc. With the loan that Acela receives, she plans to buy the products that her customers need. The business is very important to the family since the income helps greatly with household finances as well as clothes for the children and other school expenses. The loan is to buy general merchandise such as uniforms, school supplies etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy school supplies and uniforms etc

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, 42, is married with two children, one of whom is in school.  She has been selling medicine to the local residents of the Kibera slums for five years.  She also gets extra revenue from her husband’s earnings. 

She has previously taken out a loan of Kes 20,000 which she used to expand her business and which she has successfully repaid. She hopes to grow her business and to open other outlets in the future. She has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy medicine and clinic equipment.  She describes herself as hardworking, social and enthusiastic.

loans.use: To buy medicines and clinic equipment

loans.name: Wilfredo Rene

texts.es: El señor Wilfredo, es un cliente antiguo de Emprender, en el crédito anterior fue cliente Kiva, ahora repite el monto y el plazo, el Sr. Wilfredo tiene una familia compuesta por la esposa y sus dos hijas en edad escolar, él trabaja de mécanico y la esposa vende lubricantes, estas actividades le proporcionan un ingreso que les permite sustentar su hogar y los gastos que implica su actividad como el alquiler y compra de mercaderia, el cliente es bueno y responsable con sus pagos, además el tiene un ingreso adicional con la renta de su transporte, el que lo trabaja por las noches generalmente, ambos esposos con el trabajo que tienen lograron comprarse una casita por la zona de El Pedregal, con el dinero del credito comprara aceites para autos, el es una persona responsable y trabajadora esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva porla confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a long-standing Emprender client. He was a Kiva client for his previous loan and he is now repeating both the amount and the term. Wilfredo’s family consists of his wife and two, school-age daughters. He works as an auto mechanic and his wife sells engine lubricants. These activities provide income that allows them to support their household as well as pay business expenses like rental and merchandise purchases. He is a good, responsible client where repayments are concerned. He also has an additional source of income: he leases his vehicle for evening use. The couple managed, thanks to both their work, to buy a small house in the El Pedregal neighborhood. He will use the funds requested to buy auto lubricants. He is a responsible, hard-working man, who is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and motor oil.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat, a 36-year-old married man with two children who go to school, has been running a bookshop located in Nakuru for three years. He also has other businesses such as dairy farming and second-hand clothes sales. A hardworking and focused man, Josephat previously borrowed kes 20,000 to expand his business and is now requesting a loan of kes 35,000 to buy a cow as well as new and second-hand clothes.  He hopes to eventually own a variety of businesses and increase his profit margin four times.

loans.use: To buy a cow, new clothes and an additional stock of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys, a 45-year-old married lady with four children, has been a tailor for the past 15 years.  As a member of Faulu Kenya, she received two previous loans which she used to increase her stock and purchase a sewing machine.  In order to achieve greater output, Gladys is  requesting a loan of Kes.30,000 to purchase an embroidery machine and add to her stock of cloth materials.  She hopes to increase her number of clients in the future.

loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine and add stock of cloth material

loans.name: Gracias A Dios Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario Gracias a Dios esta ubicado en la colonia Morazan, esta integrado por 3 mujeres que se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo atras, a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellas relizan:
La señora Noemy Esperanza Z. F. tiene  de 53 años de edad, vive en union libre y se dedica a la venta de golosinas y refrescos, tiene unos 20 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. utilizara el credito para comprar carnes, verduras y refrescos.
la sra. Santos Abadesa Z. tiene 40 años de edad, vive en union libre, tiene 2 hijos, Santos tiene un negocio de venta de comidas frente a la ferreteria San Francisco en donde vende carne asada, tacos, enchiladas y frescos naturales, utilizara el credito para invertirlo en su negocio, comprar carnes, frijoles, tortillas, refrescos, papas, verduras, etc.
la sra. Francis Azucena H. F. tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un negocio de pulperia en su casa de habitacion, en donde vende abarroteria en general, utilizara el credito para surtur mas su pulperia.
texts.en:
The “Gracias a Dios” (Thanks be to God) communal bank is in the Morazan neighborhood and is composed of three women who have known each other for a long time. Following are their various commercial activities: Noemy Esperanza Z. F., 53, lives in a common law union; she sells snacks and soft-drinks. She has been in this line of work for about 20 years and will use the funds to buy meats, vegetables and soft-drinks. Santos Abadesa Z., 40, lives in a common law union and has two children. She sells prepared meals across from the San Francisco hardware store; she sells grilled meat, tacos, enchiladas and fruit juices. She will use the funds to buy meat, beans, tortillas, beverages, potatoes, vegetables, etc. Francis Azucena H., 33, is a single mother and has a grocery store in her home where she sells assorted groceries. She will use the funds to buy stock items for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans, soft-drinks, bread, coffee, cookies, rice, lard, cooking oil, churros, sauces, pasta, soups, salt, spices, meats, vegetables, cheeses, manioc, fruits, sugar, and water.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce, a 30-year-old married lady with three children in school, has been selling clothes and mobile phone airtime cards for three years. Assisted by one employee, her business is located in Kawangware, a few miles away from the capital city. Before venturing into this business, Joyce sold vegetables.  She appreciates the training she received from Faulu Kenya which helped her to generate new business ideas.  She dreams of becoming a prominent businesswoman and hopes to buy a building in the future. Joyce is requesting a loan of kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy more clothes and airtime cards to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and mobile airtime cards for sale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 26-year-old married lady with one child who goes to school. She has been selling shoes retail for four years. With the income she gets, she assists her husband, who is an accountant, with the household expenses.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Jane’s business has grown and she is able to access loans and, at the same time, save her money. She hopes to expand her business to a wholesale operation and offer better education to her children in the future.

Jane has requested a loan of Kes 15,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of both men’s and women’s shoes. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To add to her stock of shoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 39-year-old mother of three. Her husband is employed as a fireman while she runs a grocery shop. She is a hardworking lady who is also involved in poultry farming and sells food.

Monica has been saving part of her income with Faulu Kenya and also paying wages to her five employees. She has requested a loan of Kes 15,000 to add to her stock of onions, peas and cabbages.

Monica dreams of providing a better education for her children. She sees herself becoming financially stable in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of onions, peas and cabbages

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 30-year-old married man with one child. He has been running a retail shop for two years where he sells general merchandise such as household items and foodstuffs. He was previously selling secondhand clothes before he diversified to this business.

Daniel appreciates Faulu Kenya for the training they offer him and he has since acquired management skills. He hopes to grow his business to a wholesale operation and improve his standard of living.

Daniel has requested a loan of Kes 10,000 to buy two bags of sugar and two bags of flour to sell. He describes himself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy two bags of sugar and two bags of maize flour to sell

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
el señor Abel B. R. tiene 43 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 2 hijos, Abel se dedica a la 
venta de conos, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. El medio de transporte es una  bicicleta en la cual se desplaza a los barrios, colonias y caserios repartiendo sus conos. Los conos son muy bien vendidos ya que en la ciudad de San Lorenzo el clima es muy caliente y muchas personas compran los conos para refrescarse. utilizara el credito para comprar productos para la elaboracion de sus conos.
Su mayor deseo es comprase una moto para vender su producto, ya que en bicicleta tiene que esforzarse mucho para llegar a lugares largos, tiene mucho desgaste fisico.
texts.en:
Abel B. R. is 43 years old and married with two children. He sells ice-cream cones and has 8 years of experience in the business. His means of transportation is a bicycle, on which he travels to neighborhoods, villages, and districts distributing his cones. They sell very well, since in the city of San Lorenzo the climate is very hot and many people buy them as refreshments. He will use the loan to purchase materials to make his cones. His dream is to buy himself a motorcycle to sell his products, because the bicycle requires great effort to reach remote locations and he is physically exhausted.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase ice cream, cones, and napkins

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 51 years old and is married with four children. He hawks (sells door-to-door) torches (flashlights), padlocks and handbags to commuters to earn a living. He is very active and works hard so as to meet his family’s needs. He has been in this business for twelve years.

Peter hopes to expand his business since he can access loans from Faulu Kenya. He hopes to grow his business to a wholesale shop in the future. He has requested a loan of Kes 10,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to his stock of torches, padlocks and handbags.

loans.use: To buy more padlocks, torches and handbags to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Ii Group

texts.es:
El comité D. Mujeres Unidas II es un grupo muy activo y el trabajo solidario se nota en cada una D. sus integrantes, ya que todas elL. a parte D. ser compañeras en el Comité son muy buenas amigas.
Todas cuentan con una actividad independiente que les genera ganancia, así como el caso D. la señora Saviana quien después D. integrarse al comité decidió trabajar  vendiendo todo tipo D. lencerías D. distintas  marcas, ella recorre por muchas casas comerciales ofreciendo sus productos y ademas tiene clientes individuales que pagan en cuotas.
Actualmente con el crédito lo destinó  a la compra D. gran cantidad D. lencerías para vender.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas II (Women United II) group is very active, and the women work together well. The support provided by each group member is very clear; as well as being colleagues within the group, they are very good friends. Each woman has her own job which provides an income. For instance, after joining the group, Señora Saviana decided to start a business selling all types and brands of lingerie. She goes to many stores selling her products and also has individual customers who pay in installments. She now wants to use the loan to buy a large quantity of lingerie to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy lingerie

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: LA SRA. CECILIA  ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA, MUY CUMPLIDA MOSTRANDO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, ELLA ESTA CASADA CON DON MARIANO, SU ESPOSO ES JUBILADO, TIENE UN NIETO JOVEN, QUE LA AYUDA A COMPRAR LOS DULCES, JUNTOS VIAJAN HASTA EL SUR DEL PAIS, HASTA BERMEJO, YACUIBA, VILLAZON, POTOSI, COCHABAMBA Y ORURO.  LA SRA. VEND. LOS DULCES POR MAYOR QUE LOS ADQUIERE EN DESAGUADERO, EN LA CEJA - EL ALTO Y TAMBIENEN EL SUR DEL PAIS. SU MAYOR ANHELO D. DÑA. CECILIA JUNTO A SU ESPOSO ESTA ARREGLAR SU CASA, AUMENTANDO CON UN PISO MÁS, PARA TENER MAYOR COMODIDAD Y VIVIR MEJOR. EL DINERO DEL CREDITO LO UTILIZARA PARA LA COMPRA D. MATERIAL D. CONSTRUCCION, ES UNA PERSONA MUY TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE NUNCA FALLO EN EL PAGO D. SUS CUOTAS, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Cecilia is an old client who has extensively demonstrated her responsibility. She is married to Mariano, who is retired. They have a young grandson who helps her to purchase sweets. Together they travel to the southern region of the country, as far as Bermejo, Yacuiba, Villazon, Potosi, Cochabama, and Oruro. She sells sweets for a higher price than she purchases them in Desaguadero, La Ceja, El Alto, and the south of the country. Cecilia's greatest dream, and her husband's, is to improve their home, adding another floor to increase their comfort and to live better. The money from the loan will be used to purchase construction materials. Cecilia is a very hard-working and responsible person who has never missed a loan payment. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence demonstrated by the loan offer.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Florencia Arminda

texts.es: LA SEÑORA FLORENCIA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION D. MANDILES D. COCINA Y ROPA D. BEBE Y A LA VENTA D. LOS PRODUCTOS QUE REALIZA LLEVA CON EL NEGOCIO  MAS D. 30 AÑOS  DESD. QUE QUEDO HUERFANA D. MADRE, LA SRA. SUFRIO BASTANTE  A UN PRINCIPIO YA QUE NO SABIA  COSTURAR Y NO SABIA HACER NADA GRACIAS A DIOS UNA SEÑORA LA AYUDO BASTANTE LE ENSEÑO A COSTURAR Y TEJER DESD. ESE ENTONCES ELLA LLEVA CON ESTE NEGOCIO. AHORA LA SRA. ES  MUY FELIZ PORQUE TIENE MUCHOS PEDIDOS YA QUE SU MERCADERIA ES D. BUENA CALIDAD, ESTA CASADA Y NO TIENE HIJOS POR EL MOMENTO, TIENE MUCHOS DESEOS D. SALIR ADELANTE ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE SIEMPRE VIENDO QUE PRODUCTOS MAS REALIZAR PARA DESPUES VENDERLOS, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Florencia makes aprons and infants clothing to sell. She has been in this line of work for over 30 years, ever since she lost her mother. At the beginning, she suffered much because she didn’t know how to sew; in fact, she didn’t know how to do much of anything. Thanks to God, a woman helped her out teaching her to sew and knit. Since then, she has supported herself through this work. Now, she is very happy because she has many orders to fill because her merchandise is high quality. She is married but has no children at present. She very much wants to get ahead in life; she is very hard-working and responsible, always looking to make more items to sell. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and wool.

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Martha es madre de familia de dos hijos los cuales estudian, de 51 años de edad, su esposo es albañil el cual ha sido quien la apoyado para comenzar con su negocio, una pulpería. El cual inicio con dinero propio y el financiamiento que la institución dio, para ella ha sido difícil ya que anteriormente le fue mal en su negocio, debido a cambio de domicilio lo cual decide cambiar de venta y pone venta de fritanga, los meses pasan y las ventas bajas por lo que refuerza otra vez la pulpería en donde tiene una variedad de productos que se venden día a día. La cual la tiene en la sala lo que vino a tener menos espacios, menos privacidad para su familia. Es por eso con este préstamo hará una división para dar mejor servicios a sus clientes y lograr una mejor visión. Contenta con esta mejora lo que espera captar clientes nuevos, mejores ventas, lo cual vendrá a beneficiar a toda mi familia.
texts.en:
51-year old Doña Martha is a mother of two children who are students. Her husband is a bricklayer and helped her get started in her own business, a corner store. They used their own money as well as financing from the institution. Running the store has been difficult. At first it didn’t do well. Then because of a change in housing, she decided to sell fried foods. Time passed, and still sales were low, so she opened up the corner store once again and now sells a variety of products that are needed on a daily basis. Martha runs the store in the living room of their house which means that the family has less space and less privacy. For this reason she will use the loan to divide the room. She’ll be able to provide her customers with better service and conditions. She is hopeful that this improvement will bring in new customers and higher sales and thus provide benefits for the whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials to separate the living room from the store

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: Emiliana, de 38 años, vive con Julio (42), ellos tuvieron 5 hijos pero sólo viven con 3 de ellos, pues el resto se ha independizado.Junto a su esposo, se dedica a cultivar café, achiote, palta y maíz (productos naturales de la selva peruana) en sus terrenos que son propios, esta actividad  la  realiza desde hace varios años, con mucha dedicación. Lo que más le gusta es el macheteado de las malezas, ya que no le agrada  ver sucios y descuidados sus terrenos, mensualmente fumiga y abona sus plantaciones para evitar que las plagas las contaminen. Este oficio le ha permitido construir su casa, comprar varias hectáreas de terrenos productivos, además de  cubrir la educación de sus hijos. En el futuro tiene proyectado plantar mayor cantidad de café, también guarda la esperanza de contar con otro capital de trabajo que le permitirá producir y comercializar más productos oriundos de su zona.Este es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hicieron posible el préstamo que le permitirá seguir trabajando.El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en el acopio de café que pronto iniciará, para lo cuál necesita mil quinientos nuevos soles. De esta manera  espera seguir progresando para brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Emiliana, 38 years old and lives with Julio who is 42. They have 5 children and live with 3 of them; the rest have become independent. She and her husband cultivate coffee, anatta, alligator-pears and corn (natural products of the Peruvian rain forest) on her own lands. She has done this for many years with much dedication. What she likes most is cutting back the growth of weeds, since it doesn't agree with her to see her terrain in a disordered state. Monthly, she spreads manure and fumigates her fields to avoid disease infestations. This work has permitted her to build a house, to buy various hectares of productive land, and in addition, to pay for the education of her children. In the future, she plans to plant more coffee and, also, hopes to acquire the working capital that will permit her to produce and sell more products native to her zone. This is Emiliana's 2nd loan with MFP and she is very grateful for all the people who have made possible the loan that will keep her working. The money she requests will be invested in the harvesting of coffee, which begins soon. She will need 1,500 New Sols for that. She hopes to continue progressing in this manner, offering her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: IMPROVING THE PRODUCTION OF HER CROPS AND HARVESTING COFFEE

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La Sra. Graciela tiene 23 años de edad, es madre  de un solo hijo, actualmente acompañada de su pareja Augusto quien se encuentra desempeñándose como empleado en una empresa constructora. Graciela tiene un instituto de computación desde el 2.009, ella vive con sus padres en la compañía de Jhuguá Ñaro de Itá, anteriormente se encontraba trabajando en la ciudad de San Antonio como educadora de computación, pero como las cosas  le iban muy bien decidió poner su propio instituto de computación. Actualmente tiene el suyo propio, en donde estudian un total de 14 alumnos de diferentes edades.
 En dicho instituto se desarrollan diversos módulos relacionados a computación, además de interesantes cursos para cajeros y secretariado ejecutivo.
Necesita el crédito para invertir en la publicidad y propaganda de su nuevo local.
texts.en:
Mrs. Graciela is 23-years old, the mother of a son, and is accompanied by her partner Augusto who works as an employee in a construction business. Graciela has had a ocmputer institute since 2009. She lives with her parents in Jhuguá Ñaro de Ita. She used to work in the city of San Antonio as a computer teacher, but since things were going well for her she decided to start her own computer institute. Today she has her own institute and 14 students of different ages are studying there. At the institute they offer several different modules related to computers. They offer interesting classes for cashiers and executive secretaries. She needs a loan to invest in publicity and PR for her new space.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: publicity and public relations

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña Maria de edad de 34 años, es una mujer muy esforzada por sus ideales, vive en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, con dos hermosos hijos y su esposo el cual trabaja en venta en la empresa Jummy. Hace varios años doña Maria tenia una pulpería en donde apoyaba  a su esposo con los gastos,  pero como  decide terminar su carrera el cual no termino ante por que se caso y por que estaban pequeños los niños. Le quitaba mucho tiempo ya que era medicina y era casi todo el día, estudiando y pensando en un futuro mejor para la familia es por eso cierra la venta. Por gracias a Dios, y a su esposo que la apoyo siempre,  ahora tiene dos años laborando en un Hospital de la capital de Managua que se llama Hospital Alemán, desempeñándose como enfermera y cirujana el cual esta contenta por alcanzar sus meta como profesional. Con este financiamiento desea terminar la construcción de un cuarto que le falta seguir levantando paredes, poner techo, y embaldosar  ya que es de mucha necesidad para la comodidad de sus hijos. Sus planes a futuro es seguir haciendo las mejoras ya que a un no tiene cocina aparte lo que comenzara hacer. Gracias a este préstamo lograra mejores condiciones para su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is 34 years old and is a woman who gathers strength from her ideals. She lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood with two beautiful children and her husband who works in sales at Jummy. Years ago Doña Maria had a small general store in her home to help her husband with the bills, but she decided to finish her studies which she hadn't finished because she didn't have time because her kids were little. And it took a lot of time since she was studying, which took up most of the day, and thinking about a better life for her family. This is why she closed her business. Thanks to God, and to her husband, who has always supported her she now has worked for two years in a hospital in the capital, Managua, called Hospital Alemán. She works as a nurse and a surgeon and is happy to have achieved her goal to be a professional. With this loan she would like to finish building a room that still needs walls, a roof, and tiles. It's really a necessity for her kid's comfort. Her plans for the future are to keep making improvements until they have an indoor kitchen that they plan to start on. This loan will improve conditions for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to finsih putting up walls and a roof.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia tiene 40 años, es una persona muy alegre, vive con Celedonio de 67 años, con quien tiene 9 hijos, de los cuales vive sólo con 6. La casa que habitan es propia y está construida a base de madera y calamina.Desde tempranas horas de la mañana empieza a preparar los alimentos, mientras que sus hijos y esposo se encargan de laborar en los cultivos de café y maíz. Esta labor la realizan desde hace 20 años y apenas Eugenia terminar con los alimentos coge un machete para retirar la maleza de las chacras cercanas a su casa. En la foto está limpiando sus cultivos de yuca, las cuales están detrás de su casa. Ella valora mucho el esfuerzo que realiza su pareja y desea ayudarlo en todo, por eso en los próximos días contratará a alguien cambie las hojas de su techo por planchas de calamina. Asimismo viene preparando un espacio cerca de su domicilio para instalar un vivero de café que le ayude a renovar sus plantaciones con diferentes variedades del fruto.Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y ante los integrantes de su banco comunal se compromete a pagar puntualmente cada cuota para acceder a préstamos futuros que le ayudaran a progresar.Con el dinero que solicita  piensa invertir en sus cultivos, así también  comprará las calaminas para renovar su techo.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 40, and she is a very happy person. She lives with Celedonio, age 67. They have nine children, but only six of them are living. The house they live in is their own. It is made from wood and a sheet of aluminum that is commonly used for roofing. She starts to prepare food early in the morning while her children and husband take care of working with the coffee and corn crops. They have been doing this work for 20 years. Eugenia barely finishes with the food when she takes her machete to remove the weeds from the small farms that are close to her house. In the photo she is cleaning out the yucca crops, which are in back of her house. She really values the effort her husband makes, and she wants to help him with everything. To do so she will contract someone in the coming days to change the leaves of her roof for corrugated metal. At the same time, she is preparing a space near her home to set up a coffee nursery, which will help to renovate her plantings with different varieties of the product. This is her first loan with MFP. She promises the members of her communal bank that she will make each payment punctually in order to have access to future loans that will help her progress. She will use the money she is requesting to invest in her crops. She will also buy the corrugated metal to renovate her roof.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve crop production

loans.name: Sabadell Group

texts.es: El grupo “Sabadell” esta representado por la señora Rosario y conformada por 11 miembros de los cuales 4 son varones y el resto mujeres todos son vecinos de la misma zona y conocen bien sus negocios. La señora Rosario es enfermera de profesión y trabaja en la clínica Copacabana en el turno de la noche durante el dia ayuda a su esposo en la venta de medicamentos en su farmacia, ambos tienen dios niños y son muy trabajadores, la señora Rosario destinara su crédito a la compra de mercadería para la farmacia y para la construcción de un local comercial en su domicilio para trasladar su farmacia su zona pudiendo para estar mas cerca de sus hijos y para ahorrar en el alquiler de la tienda. El resto del grupo se dedica a la venta de helados, cosméticos, detergentes, peluches, refrescos, golosinas y el resto son trabajo en industrias y fabricas.  Si bien la competencia en general es bastante amplia, el grupo cuenta con experiencia y también con clientes fijos que reconocen su trabajo y demandan sus servicios, por otra parte es importante el entusiasmo que ponen a lo que hacen. El presente crédito será utilizado como capital de operaciones, para la compra de Insumos, materiales y mercadería para ampliar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos permitiendo darles un hogar mas estable a sus familias. La expectativa que tiene el grupo es de seguir trabajando y contando sobre todo con financiamiento para poder alcanzar sus metas. El banco tiene bastante experiencia crediticia ya que no es la primera vez que obtienen un crédito, pero dentro de la institución van cursando su primer ciclo.
texts.en:
The “Sabadell” group is represented by Rosario and made up of 11 members, 4 men and 7 women, all of whom are neighbors from the same area, who know their businesses well. Rosario is a nurse and works the night shift at Copacabana Clinic. During the day, she assists her husband in his pharmacy. They have two children and are very hard-working. Rosario will use the funds to buy stock merchandise for the pharmacy and to build a commercial site at her home so that she can move the pharmacy to her neighborhood in order to be closer to her children and save on rental costs. The rest of the group members are involved in a variety of commercial activities; such as: sale of frozen treats, cosmetics, detergents, plush toys, beverages, snacks; others work in industries and as factory workers. They face considerable competition but the group has experience and regular customers that appreciate their work and ask for their services. In addition, the enthusiasm with which they do their work is noteworthy. The present loan will be used for operational capital: to buy ingredients, merchandise and materials to increase sales and income making it possible for them to provide more stable homes for their families. The group expectation is to continue working and being able to continue to count on financing in order to reach their goals. The bank has considerable credit history since this isn’t their first loan. However, it is their first with this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operational capital.

loans.name: María Maritza

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 42 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada 20 minutos al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella es propietaria desde hace mas de dos años de una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros). Que adquirió con un dinero que tenía ahorrado. Este vehículo es alquilado a un chofer particular para su trabajo y constituye una fuente importante de ayuda familiar, ya que los ingresos que percibe su esposo como trabajador eventual no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.

El contínuo uso brindado a su unidad móvil ha hecho que este empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, por este motivo ella se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

María es una mujer emprendedora y bastante entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir colaborando con la economía del hogar para asegurarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, 42, lives with her husband and two children in Lambayeque, which is 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For over two years she has owned a mototaxi (motorized, three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) that she bought with some savings she had. She leases the vehicle to a driver and this is an important source of family income because the salary her husband earns as a temporary worker is insufficient to meet family expenses. The continuous use of the vehicle has caused it to begin to show signs of wear that require urgent repair if it’s to continue running properly. This brings about the need to call upon Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, to solicit a 500 new sol loan to reach this goal. María is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her family. Her greatest wish is to continue to contribute to the family’s income in order to insure a better quality of life for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For mototaxi service and repairs.

loans.name: Felix Alberto

texts.es:
Félix es un hombre discreto y muy laborioso, tiene 45 años y está casado con Rosa de 39 años, con quien tiene siete hijos. Ellos viven en su cómoda vivienda de madera ubicada en la plaza de su localidad a 22 kilómetros de la ciudad.La agricultura es la actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 20 años, cultiva café, plátanos y maíz en sus terrenos propios. Cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa, quien se dirige a las chacras junto a él en la época de cosecha para atender a los operarios que contratan, pues usualmente se encarga de cuidar a sus hijos en casa.
De toda su labor a Félix le gusta cosechar los granos de café, despulparlos, hacerlos secar, escogerlos y luego comercializarlos a los comerciantes mayoristas, quienes conocen la calidad de su fruto por el cual pagan montos considerables acorde al mercado. Como plantar café es muy rentable y le permite adquirir más terrenos, para más adelante planea alternar su chacras con varias variedades de café, asimismo quiere comprar una casa cerca de su ciudad para poder instalar una bodega.Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y refiere estar muy contento de trabajar con su banco comunal, porque sus integrantes son muy organizados, solidarios y responsables.El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en contratar operarios que limpiarán sus terrenos para que luego puedan cosechar fácilmente.
texts.en:
Félix, 45, is a discreet and very hard-working man. He’s married to Rosa, 39, with whom he has 7 children. They live in their comfortable, wood dwelling, which is located in their community’s square 22 kilometers from the city. He has been a farmer for 20 years; he grows coffee, bananas and corn on his own fields. His wife helps him with his work, going with him to the fields during harvest time to tend to the workers they hire because, usually, she stays home to care for the children. What Félix enjoys most about his work is harvesting coffee: hulling the beans, drying and sorting them for subsequent sale to wholesalers, who are aware of the quality of his fruit and for which they pay considerable prices according to the market. Because coffee planting is very profitable, it makes it possible for him to acquire more lands so that he can alternate his crops with different coffee varieties; he also wants to buy a house near his city so that he can set up a warehouse. This is his first loan with MFP and he states that he is happy to work in a communal bank because its members are very organized, unified and responsible. He will use the requested funds to hire field hands to clear his fields for future planting.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To hire fieldworkers.

loans.name: Las Mariposas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Mariposas” esta representado por la señora Flora y compuesto por 10 miembros D. los cuales 2 son varones y el resto mujeres todos resientes D. la misma zona netamente lechera y D. crianza D. ganado. La señora Flora se dedica a la crianza D. vacas lecheras a las cuales orD.ña muy temprano en la mañana para vender la leche al carro recolector D. la empresa PIL, el resto D. la leche la destina a la elaboración D. quesillo y yogurt el cual comercializa en el mercado o en ferias zonales, es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales dos van al colegio y los otros dos son pequeños, ella requiere el préstamo para la construcción y paliación D. su casa y para la compra D. insumos para sus diferentes productos.  El resto del grupo también se dedica a la venta D. leche  y los dos varones se dedican a la construcción. La competencia es granD. pero las señoras ya cuentan con clientes fijos que les compran la leche y algunas entregan a empresas procesadoras D. lácteos.  El presente crédito esta destinado a la   compra D. soya  que  es alimento para las vacas y  los varones compraran herramientas D. trabajo para agilizar su trabajo.  Este banco esta empezando su segundo ciclo demostrando responsable y honestidad con la expectativa D. seguir trabajando para crecer y poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The “Mariposas” (Butterflies) group is represented by Flora and is maD. up of 10 members, 2 men and 8 women. All are residents of an area that is almost completely dedicated to dairy farming and cattle raising. Flora raises dairy cows. She milks them very early in the morning in order to sell the milk to the PIL Dairies truck. She uses the remaining milk to make quesillo (similar to cottage-cheese) and yoghurt to sell in the local markets. She is married and has 4 children, two of whom are in school and two who are not school-age yet. She needs funding for home construction and enlargement and to buy ingredients for her various products. The rest of the group sells milk and the two male members are construction workers. Competition is high but the women have regular customers that buy the milk; some sell the milk to milk processing plants. The current financing will be used to by soy, which is the main feed for the cows and the men will buy work tools to make their work easier. The bank is starting its second loan cycle, having demonstrated responsibility and honesty; they expect to continue working to grow and proviD. their families with improved quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies and ingredients for her dairy products.

loans.name: Copacabana Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Copacabana” esta representado por la señora Noemi y conformado por 10 miembros todas mujeres residentes D. la misma zona. La presidenta se dedica a la venta D. comida y refrescos en la esquina D. la casa D. su primo, es casada tiene un hijo recién nacido y resiD. en la casa D. su primo hermano, su esposo se dedica al manejo D. un mini bus D. pasajeros, juntos tratan D. ahorrar para poder tener un lote y poder darle a su hijo un futuro mejor, es por esta razón que requiere el préstamo que servirá para agrandar su puesto D. venta y mejorar sus ingresos. El resto del grupo tiene diferentes actividades la mayoría se dedica a la venta D. comida pero también a la venta D. cosméticos, frazadas, camisas y tarjetas. El grupo tiene experiencia en los negocios que desempeñan ya que por este motivo son conocidos por sus clientes en cuanto a la  competencia es granD.  pero la gente del grupo pone toda su voluntad y entusiasmo para salir adelante y cumplir con sus obligaciones. El crédito Será destinado a incrementar su capital D. operación y a la compra D. materiales e insumos para sus negocios.  Este grupo es nuevo pero tienen experiencia crediticia porque ya trabajaron en diferentes instituciones  y conocen la metodología D. banca comunal.
texts.en:
The “Copacabana” communal bank is represented by Noemi and is maD. up of 10 members, all of whom are women, residents of the same aR.. Noemi sells prepared food and beverages at her cousin’s house’s corner. She is married and has a newborn son. She lives in her cousin’s house and her husband is a mini-bus driver. Together they are trying to save up to buy a lot so that they can proviD. their son with a better future. This is the reason behind this loan request: to enlarge her food stand and improve her income. The rest of the group members are involved in a variety of commercial activities; such as: most sell food, but some sell cosmetics, blankets, shirts and cards. The group has experience in their various fields and is well-known to their customers. Although competition is intense, the members of the group exert all their efforts and enthusiasm in order to get ahead and meet their obligations. The funds will be used to increase their operational capital and to buy ingredients and materials for their businesses. The group is newly formed but they have credit history because they have worked with other institutions in the past and know how communal banks operate.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital.

loans.name: Hayde

texts.es:
Haydee tiene 28 es una mujer emprendedora y muy alegre, está casada con Héctor de 35 años y  tienen 3 hijos menores de edad que viven en su casa propia, ubicada en una zona lejana de la selva central del Perú.El motivo de su vida son sus hijos, a quienes quiere brindarles todo lo que ella no tuvo, por eso, todos los días desde las cinco de la mañana abre las puertas de su tienda porque a esa hora sus vecinos empiezan a salir a trabajar a sus chacras y los demás establecimientos abren sus puertas recién a las 6 de la mañana. Esto le brinda una gran ventaja, pues adquiere mayores ganancias con un poco de sacrificio, además como le gusta atender y conversar con sus clientes no le parece tan tedioso, pues ya se acostumbró a esa rutina, debido a que tiene más de 4 años dedicada a esta actividad. Por otro lado, su esposo trabaja como personal de seguridad en una mina, por lo que regresa a casa cada tres semanas, pero antes de ese trabajo dejó varias hectáreas de café y plátanos listos para cosechar.
Haydee quiere darle una sorpresa a su esposo cuando vuelva, por lo que mandará a arreglar algunos imperfectos de su vivienda con madera y calaminas para que soporte el invierno en esta localidad.Este es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y está contenta de trabajar en su banco comunal, por ello ofrece un espacio de su vivienda para desarrollar las reuniones del grupo, donde participa activamente.Con el dinero que solicita ampliará su tienda y adquirirá los productos de primera necesidad que más le solicitan sus clientes; a su vez, como se iniciará la cosecha de café, acopiará sus granos para venderlos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Haydee is 28 years old, and she is an entrepreneurial and positive woman. She is married to a man named Hector and they have two young children who live with them in their own home, which is located in a quite rural part of the central Peruvian jungle. Her main motivation is her children, to whom she would like to provide everything she never had – for this reason, she opens the doors of her store at five o'clock in the morning every day, because it is at this early hour that her neighbors leave to work on their farms and other stores don't open until 6 AM. This offers her a great advantage, gaining greater income with only a little extra sacrifice. She doesn't mind it too much, either, because she enjoys serving and chatting with her clients. She has also gotten used to this routine, since she has been running this business for over 4 years. On the other hand, her husband works as a security guard in a mine, so he only comes home every three weeks. Before he started this job, however, he left a few hectares of land ready to farm coffee and bananas. Haydee would like to surprise her husband the next time he returns home, so she will fix a few of her house's problems with some wood and calamina (a mineral) to better prepare them for the harsh winter in their area. This is the second loan Haydee will receive from MFP and she is happy to be part of her communal bank – she is even willing to offer a space in her home to host the group's meetings – and she participates actively. With the money she is currently seeking, she will expand her store and she will buy the basic products that her clients most often purchase. She will also start farming coffee, which she will stock up to sell wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will expand her grocery store and start farming coffee

loans.name: Julia Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Julia Chaca es socia del banco comunal El Arenal,  vive en  la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por sus hermosas Iglesias, su Centro Histórico y pro su gente que es muy calida y amable, nuestra socia tiene 33 años de edad, se encuentra casada y ha concebido dos hijos que se encuentran de 10 y 9 años de edad y estudian en la escuela Fe y Alegría, su esposo cuenta con un taller propio de tapicería, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Julia se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa  y también ayuda a su esposo  en el taller hace doce años trabajan conjuntamente para sacar adelante a su familia y su negocio,  su horario es de  lunes a sábado hasta el medio día.

Se encuentra dos años trabajando con los prestamos realizados en la fundación,  con éstos ha comprado materiales para su taller, su ingreso al bankito fue gracias a una amiga quien la invito a que forme parte de este grupo de mujeres que buscan un mejor bienestar para sus familias, con su nuevo crédito  va a seguir comprando materiales como  esponja, clavos, madera, etc. y seguir incrementando su negocio.

Su sueño es poder llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia Chaca is a member of the communal bank El Arenal, and she lives in the center of Cuenca city. This city is known for its beautiful churches in its historical center and for its warm and friendly people. She is 33 years old, married, and she has two children, aged 10 and 9 respectively, who both study in the school Fe y Alegría. Her husband owns his own weaving workshop, but they do not have their own home and instead rent. Julia is responsible for the housework and she has also been helping her husband in his workshop for twelve years – they work together to help their family and the business prosper. She works Monday through Saturday until noon. She has been receiving loans from the foundation for two years, and with these loans she has bought primary materials for the workshop. She joined this communal bank because a friend invited her to join this group of women who are all seeking a better quality of life for their families. With this new loan, she will continue to buy materials like sponges, nails, wood, etc. to continue to expand her business. Her dream is to one day have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sponges, nails, wood, etc.

loans.name: Jesus David

texts.es: Jesús tiene 20 años es soltero y vive en la casa de sus abuelos, por quienes vela en agradecimiento por haberlo cuidado desde que nació.Sus cultivos están ubicados a 4 Km. de su comunidad, allí produce café y plátanos y a los que cada 15 días limpia, abona y les hecha insecticidas y fungicidas. La paciencia y cuidados adecuados que brinda a su vivero han logrado que todos sus vecinos soliciten sus plantas de café e incluso tiene pedidos que cubrir hasta setiembre próximo. Jesús tiene 3 años dedicado a la agricultura y ama su trabajo, pues las ganancias que percibe las vuelve a invertir en el mantenimiento de sus tierras. Asimismo está ahorrando para que más adelante pueda estudiar una carrera profesional y construir su casa propia en la ciudad, donde pueda instalar una bodega y con esos ingresos adquirir más terrenos para cultivar los frutos de su preferencia.Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y no le preocupa las adversidades que se le puedan presentar en el camino, pues asegura que no quiere decepcionar a su banco comunal, ya que sus abuelos le enseñaron a resolver los problemas y ser siempre responsable.Con los setecientos soles que solicita contratará 3 operarios que le ayuden a plantar nuevas variedades de café en sus chacras.
texts.en:
Jesús is 20 years old, single, and lives in his grandparent's house. He is very grateful to them for having cared for him his whole life. His farmland is located 4 kilometers outside of his town, which is where he grows coffee and bananas. Every 15 days, he cleans them, fertilizes them, and sprays them with insecticide and anti-fungal remedies. The patience and care that he employs has earned him the respect of his neighbors, who all seek his coffee plants, and he has orders to fill through next September. Jesús has been working in agriculture for the past three years and he loves his work; he has been re-investing his profits in the maintenance of his land. He is also saving to someday be able to study a professional career and build his own house in the city where he can install a bodega and gain more income to buy more land to grow whichever fruits he prefers. This is his first loan with MFP and he is not worried about the challenges this represents – he is sure that he will be faithful and trustworthy with regards to his communal bank. His grandparents taught him how to solve problems and always be responsible. With the 700 soles he is seeking, he will hire three workers to help him plant new varieties of coffee on his farm land.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will hire works to help him plant new types of coffee on his farm land

loans.name: Trinidad Susana

texts.es:
La  microempresaria: Trinidad C. B. tiene 35 años de edad, es casada con 3 hijos todos menores de edad y actualmente se encuentran estudiando. La microempresaria C. se dedica desde hace 7 años a administrar una pulpería con el fin de aportar a los ingresos de su hogar y en dicho negocio tiene variedad de productos por lo cual cuenta con una muy buena clientela.

La microempresaria C. ya ha sido beneficiada con un préstamo por parte de Kiva el cual cancelo en tiempo y forma, aprovechando este espacio para agradecer a Kiva por la oportunidad de haberla beneficiado con este programa y principalmente a esos  prestamistas que confiaron en ella dándole dicho préstamo.

Sin embargo aun necesita de otro préstamo para ir creciendo poco a poco ya que las ganancias de una pulpería no son las mejores y requiere diversificar más aun sus productos.

Por tal razón esta solicitando para comprar: 2 quintales de Maíz a US 26 cada quintal, 1 quintal de  Frijoles a US 44, 6 cajillas de  huevos a US 5 cada cajilla, 2 quintales de  azúcar a US 35 cada quintal, 2 quintales de arroz a US  45 cada quintal, 80 libras de  carne de res a US  2 cada libra, 2 docenas de café presto a US  25 cada docena, 3 cajas de pasta dental a US 6 cada caja, 100 libras de pollo a US 1.50 cada libra y 12 unidades de leche la lechera a US 3 cada unidad.
texts.en:
This micro-entrepreneur, Trinidad C. B., is 35 years old and married with three young children who are all currently studying. Ms. C. has been running a general store for the past 7 years with the goal of support her family's income. In this business, she offers a wide variety of products, so she has a good, faithful clientèle. Ms. C. has already been granted a loan through Kiva, which she repaid on time and fully, and she would like to advantage of this new space to thank Kiva for the opportunity to have benefited her through this program and she would principally like to thank the lenders that had the faith in her to give her that loan. Despite the success of her last loan, she needs another loan to continue, bit by bit, to grow her income. The profits of a general store are not the best, and she needs to further diversify her products. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy: 200g of corn at $52 US, 100g of beans at $44 US, 6 cartons of eggs at $5 each, 200g of sugar at $70 US, 200g of rice at $90 US, 80 pounds of beef at $2 US per pound, 2 12-packs of pressed coffee at $25 US per pack, 3 boxes of toothpaste at $6 US per box, 100 pounds of chicken at $1.50 US per pound, and 12 cartons of milk at $3 US per carton.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, beans, eggs, sugar, rice, beef, chicken, coffee, toothpaste, and milk

loans.name: Roly

texts.es: Roly es un hombre paciente y luchador, es soltero y vive con su padre en la casa que le heredó su madre algunos años atrás. Actualmente está estudiando Administración de Empresas en un instituto de su ciudad, sin embargo sigue al cuidado de su vivero de café y sus chacras, a las que se dedica, desde hace 8 años.
