A Roly le gusta ver cómo se desarrollan sus plantas de plátano, maíz, yuca y café, aunque le incomoda tener que limpiarlos a menudo, pues no le agrada machetear ni retirar las malezas. “Aunque no me guste tengo que hacerlo porque las tierras me las heredaron mis padres y tengo que hacerlas producir” menciona. Además desde que siembra independientemente ha podido solventar sus estudios sólo y eso lo ha hecho más responsable, además sueña con ser profesional y administrar más tierras, por eso estudia de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana trabaja en sus chacras. Para el futuro tiene pensado ser mayorista de café por lo que empezará siendo acopiador.Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y manifiesta que al igual que la primera vez será muy puntual en sus pagos para que tenga la posibilidad de salir adelante junto a los integrantes de su banco comunal.Los mil nuevos soles que ahora solicita los invertirá en contratar operarios para que limpien y preparen sus terrenos productivos, además comprará herramientas agrícolas como machetes, costales y canastas.
texts.en:
Roly is a patient and strong man. He is single and lives with his father in the house his mother left them as inheritance a few years ago. Currently, he is studying Business Administration in a university in the city, but he also continues farming his coffee plantation, a business he has been working on for 8 years. Roly enjoys observing the growth of his plants, which include bananas, corn, yuca, and coffee, although it can be hard work to clean them every often. He does not enjoy trimming them with his machete or removing the weeds. “Although I don't enjoy it, I have to do it because I inherited these lands from my parents and I am responsible for keeping them productive,” he tells us. Additionally, since he plants all on his own, he has been able to pay for his studies on his own, which has made him more responsible. He dreams of becoming a professional and of managing more lands. Because of this goal, he studies from Monday to Friday so that on the weekends he can work on the farm. In the future, he would like to be a wholesaler of coffee, so he will start to stock-pile his coffee. This is the second loan he will receive from MFP, and he promises to be as punctual with this second loan as he was with the first in order to continue to prosper along with the other members of his communal bank. He will use the 1000 nuevos soles that he is currently seeking to hire workers to clean and prepare the land for re-planting. He will also buy agricultural tools like machetes, sacks, and baskets.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will hire workers to help plant his fields and he will buy agricultural tools

loans.name: Esther Josefina

texts.es:
Esther C. es otra socia activa  del banco comunal El Arenal, vive en la parroquia Tarqui ubicada al  sur de la ciudad de Cuenca y tiene como atractivos las lagunas de Totoracocha y Condorcocha en las comunidades de Tutupali Grande, Esther tiene 53 años de edad es madre soltera y ha concebido 8 hijos que se encuentran de 37, 35, 33, 27, 25, 22, 21, 19 años, casi todos sus hijos son casados y viven independientes, solo tiene 2 hijos solteros el de 25 años pero vive en casa de su hermana y su hijo de 19 años quien le ayuda muy poco en la economía de su hogar, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.
 
Esther se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado 27 de Junio en su comunidad, solo vende los días domingos laborando desde las 6 a.m. hasta terminar  sus preparaciones y su mamá fue quien la enseñó a preparar y sazonar su exquisita comida. Además se dedica a los 
quehaceres de su hogar y a la cría de  animales como chanchos, gallinas, cuyes y  vacas la leche que obtiene de sus vacas a veces entrega a los comerciantes o utiliza para su consumo y sus animalitos son vendidos cuando tiene alguna necesidad de dinero.
 
 Se encuentra dos  años y medio en su banco comunal, con el  dinero  de los créditos recibidos ha logrado superarse en su negocio y hogar,  y con el nuevo crédito va a comprar aceite, sal y  quintales de arroz y azúcar  y otros productos necesarios para preparar sus platos y brindar mayor variedad a sus clientes. Tiene como meta continuar con su negocio y crecer económicamente en su vida.
texts.en:
Esther C. is an active member of the “El Arenal” communal bank. She lives in Tarqui parish, which is in the southern part of Cuenca, and is famous for Lakes Totoracocha and Condorcocha in Tutupali Grande. Esther is 53 years of age, a single mother, and has 8 children, who are 37, 35, 33, 27, 25, 22, 21 and 19 years old. Almost all of her children are married and live independently. She only has two single sons; the 25-year-old, who lives with his sister and her 19-year-old who chips in a bit for family expenses. She does not own a house; she lives in a relative’s house. Esther sells food in her community’s 27 de Julio market on Sundays. She’s open for business from 6am until she runs out of food. Her mother taught her how to cook and season her delicious food. She also does the household chores and raises small farm animals, like: pigs, chickens, guinea pigs and cows. She sometimes sells the milk she gets from her cows to merchants or she uses it for her own consumption. When she faces unexpected expenses, she sells her animals. She has been in her communal bank for two-an-a-half years. She has used the funds received to get ahead in her business and at home. She will use the new loan to buy cooking oil, salt and quintales (weight measure equivalent to 46 kilos) of rice and sugar as well as other ingredients for her meals so that she can offer her customers a wider variety. Her goal is to continue with her business and to grow economically in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, pasta, etc.

loans.name: Rita Elena

texts.es:
La  microempresaria: Rita Elena L. Jarquín tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, con tres hijas todas mujeres y las cuales se encuentran estudiando en nivel primario, secundario y universitario respectivamente. Esta joven madre desde muy joven ha venido administrando una pulpería la cual poco a poco ha ido surtiendo y diversificando mas sus productos. Con este negocio ha podido mantener su hogar, ya que su marido no tiene trabajo fijo y solamente cuando le sale alguna chamba tiene ingresos.

La señora L. ha ido con su negocio comprando equipos como refrigeradora, frezer y otros muebles para mantener sus productos, pero al igual que otras microempresarias necesita se le financie para comprar algunos productos para el negocio y poder ella invertir en otros muebles que necesita.

La microempresaria L. ha sido beneficiada con prestamos de que le ha entregado nuestra institución (ADEPHCA) y es considerada por su cumplimiento en sus pagos como categoría A por la puntualidad demostrada.

Requiere se le financie para comprar:

50 libras de queso a US 1.20 cada libra, 1 quintal de  Frijoles a US 46 el quintal, 2 bidones de aceite a US 25 cada bidón, 2 bolsones de papel higiénico a US 15 cada bolsón,1 quintal de  azúcar a US 38 cada quintal,  1 quintal de arroz a US  43 cada quintal,  3 quintales de harina  a US 38 cada quintal, 3 docenas de café presto a US  28 cada docena,  2 cajas de pasta dental a US 8 cada caja, 130 libras de pollo a US 1.50 cada libra y 4 cajillas de  huevos a US 6 cada cajilla.
texts.en:
Rita Elena L. Jarquín is 35, married, and has three daughters. One daughter attends elementary school, another goes to high school, and the third attends the university. Since she was very young this young mother has been running a mini market. She has been slowly stocking it and diversifying her products. With this business she has been able to support her home because her husband does not have fixed work. He only gets income when there is work for him. L. has been buying equipment for her business like a refrigerator, a freezer, and other furniture to keep her products. Like other small businesswomen, she needs financing to buy some products for her business and to be able to invest in other furniture that she needs. L. has benefited from loans from our institution (Adephca). She is considered as a category A because of the completion of her payments and the punctuality she has demonstrated. She needs the loan to by: 50 pounds of cheese at 1.20 U.S. per pound, 1 “quintal” (100 pounds) of beans at U.S. 46 per quintal, 2 drums of oil at U.S. 25 per drum, 2 large bags of toilet paper at U.S. 15 per bag, 1 quintal of sugar at U.S. 38 per quintal, 1 quintal of rice at U.S. 43 per quintal, 3 quintales of flour at U.S. 38 per quintal, 3 dozen instant coffee at U.S. 28 per dozen, 2 boxes of tooth paste at U.S. 8 per box, 130 pounds of chicken at U.S. 1.50 per pound, and four cases of eggs at U.S. 6 per case.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cheese, beans, oil, toilet paper, sugar, rice, flour, instant coffee, tooth paste, chicken, and eggs

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 43 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Sosimo de 51 años y sus 2 hijos, a quienes desea verlos con una carrera profesional.

Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, ropa y zapatillas. Lo que más le gusta es que con esta actividad puede dedicarle tiempo a su familia, mientras su esposo lleva 20 años cultivando café por ser un producto muy rentable,  por lo que en época a de cosecha, ella se suma al trabajo en las chacras. Esta pareja tiene la esperanza de que sus hijos sean hombres de bien, por ello les inculcan valores.
Para el futuro planean plantar más variedades de café e instalar una tienda de ropa, aprovechando que tiene personas conocidas que le hacen pedidos especiales de prendas.

Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y siempre está pendiente de cada acuerdo que se determina en su banco comunal para desarrollarlo en conjunto, pues en este grupo practican la responsabilidad, solidaridad y compañerismo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará cosméticos, gran variedad de ropas y zapatillas de diferentes tamaños, con el resto invertirá en la compra de sacos de fertilizantes y botellas de insecticidas para las plantaciones de su esposo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband Sosimo, age 51, and their 2 sons, whom they would like to see in professional careers. For the past two years, Rosa has sold beauty products, clothing and casual shoes. What she likes best is the fact that this work allows her to dedicate time to her family. Her husband has spent 20 years growing coffee, since this is a very profitable product. Accordingly, Rosa helps with the field work during the harvest season. The couple is teaching their sons values and hope that they will grow up to be good men. For the future, they plan to plant more varieties of coffee and also open a clothing store, taking advantage of the fact that Rosa knows people who regularly place special orders for clothing. This is Rosa's second loan with MFP, and she always keeps up with the agreements reached within her communal bank aimed at mutual development, since the members of this group practice responsibility, solidarity and mutual support. With the funds she is requesting, she will buy cosmetics and a great variety of clothing and shoes of various sizes; with the rest, she will invest in buying sacks of fertilizer and bottles of insecticide for her husband's coffee plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying more merchandise

loans.name: Angela Del Rosario

texts.es:
La  microempresaria: Ángela del Rosario M. Sáenz tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos todos adultos y desde hace mas de 30 años tiene un comedor en donde ofrece servicios de comida corriente y fritos.

Esta microempresaria inicio este negocio vendiendo fritos (tajadas de banano con carne de cerdo) y posteriormente ha ido construyendo su comedor, inicialmente de madera y ha ido construyendo cada pared de cemento. Por tal razón esta solicitando para poder terminar con dos paredes que son de madera y así poder garantizar seguridad en su negocio.

Doña Ángela ha sido cliente de los programas que ADEPHCA ha impulsado con créditos y con estos ha ido construyendo su negocio con mas seguridad, es una de nuestras mejores clientes por la puntualidad de sus pagos y esta solicitando un financiamiento para comprar materiales que a continuación detallaremos, cabe mencionar que la mano de obra la asumirá con sus ahorros.

Necesita comprar: 2 quintales de Hierro 3/8 a US 50 cada quintal, 80 unidades de  bloques a US 1.50 cada bloque, 2 quintales de hierro ¼ a US 50 cada quintal, 2 metros de  arena a US 40 cada metro, 20 sacos de  cemento a US 12 cada saco, 2 metros de piedrín a US 50 cada metro y transporte de materiales US 60.
texts.en:
Microbusiness owner Angela del Rosario M. S. is 54 years old, a single mother, with three adult children. For more than 30 years she has run an eatery offering popular meals and fried food. She started her business selling fried foods (banana slices with pork), and subsequently has gone about building her eating establishment, initially of wood, and gradually cement for each wall. She requests a loan in order to do away with two wooden walls, and sustain her business. Angela has participated in ADEPHCA loan programs and has built her business to the point that it is more stable. She is one of our best customers, because she pays punctually. She is requesting financing to purchase materials shown below. We should mention that she will cover the cost of labor from her savings. She needs to buy: 2 quintals (quintal = 100 lbs.) of 3/8 iron, @$50; 80 units of blocks @$1.50/block; 2 quintals of ¼ iron @$50; 2 meters of sand @$40; 20 bags of cement @$12; 2 meters of rock finishing @$50; transport of materials, $60.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3/8 iron, blocks, 1/4 iron, cement, rock finishing

loans.name: Silver

texts.es:
Silver es un joven con muchos objetivos y proyectos en mente, tiene 23 años, es soltero y vive con sus hermanos menores en su nueva casa que acaba de construir con madera y calaminas.

Como ejemplos de superación tiene a sus padres, quienes lo apoyan en cada proyecto que emprende y le enseñaron diferentes oficios que hoy en día practica. Silver se considera “mil oficios” al desempeñarse como agricultor, albañil, carpintero y hotelero desde hace 7 años.
De todas estas actividades, actualmente cuida de su vivero de café y de F. “cresta de gallo”, muy solicitadas en la zona, y paralelamente atiende su negocio de alquiler de habitaciones, ambas labores le dejan ganancias considerables que le permite vivir sin preocupaciones e incluso puede facilitarle ayuda económica a sus hermanos y progenitores.
Dentro de sus planes futuros desea estudiar una carrera profesional acorde a sus actividades, también piensa comprar terrenos para continuar investigando qué frutos de la sierra pueden desarrollarse en la selva con cuidados adecuados.  

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está seguro que no defraudará a su banco comunal, quienes pusieron su confianza en él, por eso señala que invertirá bien el dinero. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita contratará personas que le ayuden a plantar nuevas plantas de café y F..
texts.en:
Silver is a young man with many goals and projects in mind. He is 23 years old, single, and lives with his younger siblings in their new house that he just built, which is made of wood and corrugated roof panels.

His parents are examples of self-improvement, and they support each project that he undertakes. They showed him different trades, which he now puts to use. Silver considers himself a "jack-of-all-trades" since he has been a farmer, bricklayer, carpenter, and a hotel-keeper for 7 years.

Out of all his occupations, he is currently looking after his plant nursery called "Cresta de Gallo" (Rooster's Comb) in which he grows coffee trees and flowers. His products are very sought-after in the area. He is also attending to his room rental business. Both jobs yield considerable profits that let him live without worry. He can even help out both his siblings and parents financially.

His future plan is to pursue a professional degree related to his trades. He is also planning to purchase plots of land so that he can continue investigating which mountain fruits can grow in the jungle with the proper care.

This is Silver's first loan with MFP. He is sure that he will not let his Communal Bank down, since they have put their trust in him. For this reason, he states that he will invest the money well. With the 1,000.00 PEN that he is requesting, he will hire people to help him plant coffee and flower seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire farm workers

loans.name: Rowaida

texts.en:
Rowaida is a housewife and a mother of six children, four boys and two girls.  Five of them are school students while the sixth, who is over 18 years old, is helping his dad to afford family expenses.  They both work as construction workers.

The family used to own land where they grew vegetables to sell as a second source of income, but the land was confiscated because it is located where the apartheid wall is being constructed. Therefore, Rowaida rented a small shop to start a small supermarket, and she applied for a loan from FATEN to fill the supermarket with goods.

Rowaida says that the supermarket income will be used to pay her five children's school fees and other household expenses. The supermarket is located in an excellent location of the village of Qalqilia.

Rowaida comes from a conservative family, so her son appears in the picture above.

loans.use: To stock the borrower's supermarket

loans.name: Manuel Yimmy

texts.es:
Manuel C. de 52  años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposa es administradora de un hospital. Ellos tienen tres hijos de 20, 22, 18 años

Empezó hace 8 años con el dinero de la jubilación, compro una camioneta pero debido a la falta de ingresos en su familia tubo que trabajar en la camioneta haciendo carreras y llevando paquetes de las personas. 

En la actualidad el trabaja todos los días llevando carga o mercadería de las personas desde las 08h00 hasta las 20h00, las lluvias es una de las mayores complicaciones que el tiene para trabajar normalmente. 

Quiere el préstamo para arreglar el carro y poder comprar un carburador porque las lluvias no le permiten trabajar normalmente. En el futuro quiere tener otra camioneta para tener más ingresos y poder asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel C. is a 52-year-old man who lives in a peri-urban zone of Guayaquil. His house is made of cement and has basic utilities. His wife is a hospital administrator. They have three children ages 20, 22, and 18.

He started his business 8 years ago, using his retirement money to purchase a pick-up truck. However, due to his family's lack of funds, he had to use the truck to provide courier services, delivering packages to people.

He is currently working every day, delivering cargo or merchandise to people from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm. The rainy season is one of the biggest factors that gets in the way of his working normally.

He needs this loan to repair his truck and to be able to purchase a carburetor because he cannot work as usual under the rain. In the future, he would like to obtain another truck so that he can increase his income and ensure his family's future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase carburetor and auto parts

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a single woman who lives with her two younger brothers. Ghada works as a secretary in Al-Amal hospital in Jineen. She loves the comfortable atmosphere of it and that it's relatively rewarding.

One of her brothers is a school teacher and the other one is still in college. Ghada is taking a loan from FATEN to pay her brother's tuition fees and purchase a computer he needs for school.

Ghada appears in the picture smiling in FATEN's office in Jineen.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and pay tuition fees

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Emmanuel M. le está haciendo falta las protecciones en las ventanas y puertas. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder pagarle a la persona que elaborar las protecciones, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario. Ya que tiene poco tiempo que termino sus estudios como medico y esta realizando su servicio social en una clínica y el sueldo que recibe es muy bajo. 
Pero a el le preocupa la seguridad de su familia cuando no se encuentra en si casa. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que recibe ya que los gastos familiares se encargara su esposa la señora Sandra Luz Quezada quien trabaja en una maquiladora en el departamento de producción.
La persona que aparece en la foto es Doña Sandra Luz esposa del señor Emmanuel, ya que el se encontraba en su trabajo, el día de la visita.
texts.en:
The dwelling of Señor Emmanuel M. is lacking protection on the windows and doors. He is applying for the loan to be able to pay the person who makes these protections, since at the moment he does not have the necessary money. Since he has only a little time until he completes his medical studies, he is performing his social service in a clinic, and the salary he receives is very low. But he worries about the security of his family when he is not at home.

He plans to pay off the loan with the income that he receives, since his wife, Señora Sandra Luz Quezada, who works in a factory in the production department, takes care of the family expenses.

The person in the photo is Doña Sandra Luz, the wife of señor Emmanuel, since he was at work on the day of the visit.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install protection on doors and windows

loans.name: José Benito

texts.es:
EL señor José Benito M. es trabajador activo desde hace 6 años en la empresa NICARAGUA SUGAR ESTATES LIMITED  desempeñándose como guarda de servicios generales. 

Este crédito que solicito es  para pagos de cancelación de módulos en la UCC pago de vestuarios y evento, de su hija
texts.en:
José Benito M. has worked for the last 6 years at NICARAGUA SUGAR ESTATES LIMITED as a general services guard. This loan that he is requesting is for cancellation payments for modules at UCC, payment of clothes and an event for his daughter

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cancellation payments for modules at UCC, clothing expenses and event payment for his daughter

loans.name: Gonzalo Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Gonzalo es un productor que se ha desarrollado poco a poco en la actividad de terneros de desarrollo el cual ha sabido sacar mucho provecho ya que gracias a los financiamiento que ceprodel le ha brindado ha podido comprar el ganado a precios bajos y los ha vendido a precios buenos y la ganancia la ha invertido en comprar vacas paridas con lo que él ha aumentado su hato ganadero de vacas de ordeño.

Este crédito es para el financiamiento de la compra de terneros de desarrollo de un peso aproximado de unos 200kg c/u
texts.en:
Señor Gonzalo is a producer who has expanded little by little in the activity of raising calves. He has known how to do well in this business, since, thanks to the financing that CEPRODEL has offered him, he has been able to buy livestock at low prices and he has sold them at good prices. He has investead the earnings in buying cows that have given birth, with which he has increased his herd of milking cows.

This loan is to finance the purchase of calves to raise to a weight of about 200 kilograms each.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy calves to raise

loans.name: Giovanni Martin

texts.es: El Sr. Giovanni M. González, trabaja en mantenimiento Industrial en una zona residencial, es padre de dos hijos en edad escolar, diario se traslada al ray hasta su centro de trabajo anteriormente se desempeñaba como ayudante de camión vendiendo materiales de construcción en la zona que hoy es su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sr. Giovanni M. González works in industrial maintenance in a residential area. He is the father of two children of school age. Every day he travels to his work center. In the past, he worked as an assistant on a truck selling construction materials in the area where he now works.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials such as cement, iron, blocks, zinc, etc.

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es: La señora Maria Lucrecia C., es madre de tres hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos estan en edad escolar. Actualmente se desempeña en su centro de labores esforzandose grandemente para obtener los ingresos para llevar a cabo el mejoramiento de su vivienda que así lo requiere. Para ello ha solicitado un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción como lo son  cemento, arena, zinc, entre otros para así llevar a cabo dicha obra en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Lucrecia C. has three children; two of them are school age. She currently works as the reservations manager for a beach hotel. She has a life companion. Basically her activity consists of taking reservations, entering them in the system, and making sure that they are not oversold.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement, sand, and gravel

loans.name: Juanita Nayiri

texts.es:
La señora es trabajador activo desde hace 4 años en un bufet desempeñándose como abogado dando servicios legales y gestión de cobro 

Este crédito que solicito es  para compra de materiales de contruccion como perlines, zinc, madera.
texts.en:
She has been an active worker for four years in a firm. She works as a lawyer, and she provides legal services and debt recovery. The loan she is requesting is to buy construction materials like beams, zinc, and wood.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials like beams, zinc, and wood

loans.name: Jenny Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra.: Jenny del Socorro R. C., actualmente se desempeña como profesora de secundaria, también cuenta con un taxi que maneja un cadete en la capital lo cual le genera otras fuentes de ingresos este crédito lo solicito para la compra de materiales de construcción para terminar un cuarto y cambiar algunas laminas del techo ya que se acerca la temporada de lluvias y no quiere seguirse
texts.en:
Señora Jenny del Socorro R. C. currently works as a teacher at a secondary school. She also has a taxi that a driver drives in the capital, which generates another source of income for her. She is requesting this credit to buy construction materials to finish a room in her house. She will also replace some metal sheets on her roof because the rainy season is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, gravel, and sand.

loans.name: Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Argentina V. es casada, su esposo labora para una empresa llamada químico Sandino en  Managua, tiene un hijo el cual es mayor de edad, ella es Maestra de Educación Primaria desde hace 20 años en el Colegio San Luis Gonzaga siendo este privado donde se desempeña como sub directora del Colegio.
A doña Argentina se le han financiado dos créditos los cuales han sido el primero para mejoramiento de vivienda y este ultimo para gastos de medicina (consulta, exámenes y medicamentos).
texts.en:
Señora Argentina V. is married. Her husband works for a company called "Químico Sandino" in Managua. She has an adult son. She has been an elementary school teacher for 20 years at the San Luis Gonzaga school. This is a private school where she is the assistant principal. Doña Argentina has received two credits that she has used to improve her home. With this latest one, she will pay for medical costs (a consultation, tests, and medicine).

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical costs (to pay for a consultation, tests, and medicine)

loans.name: Herlin Rafael

texts.es: El Sr. Herlin Rafael Hernández G. es casado y padre de tres hijos dos en edades escolares actualmente  se desempeña como operador de maquinas industriales cuenta con dos años de experiencias y trabaja para una generadora de energía de la zona de San Rafael Del Sur. Este crédito lo solicito para la construcción de un muro de su propiedad.
texts.en:
Señor Herlin Rafael Hernández G. is married and is the father of three school-aged children. He currently operates industrial machines. He has two years of experience and works for an energy company in the San Rafael del Sur area. He is requesting this credit to construct a wall on his property.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stone, iron, and gravel

loans.name: Nicolás

texts.es:
El señor Nicolás M. tiene ya más de seis años dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de tacos. 
Al puesto le está haciendo falta algunas reparaciones, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder mejor el puesto. 
Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y planea pagarlo con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de venta de tacos.
texts.en:
Nicolás M. has been a taco vendor for over 6 years. His taco stand needs some repairs but he lacks funds to do them. He is asking for a loan that he plans to repay with profits from his taco sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make some improvements to his taco stand.

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Eva M. tiene un negocio de venta de comida en el mercado Santa Ana ubicado en el sector comida, tiene de vender 20 años  anteriormente era ayudante de su mamá pero decidio ahorrar para vender ella su producto ella vende lo que es sopa vende diario de lunes a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde, es madre de dos hijos en edad escolar se siempre se ha esforzado por sacarlos adelante ya que es madre soltera.
Tiene año y medio de trabajar con ceprodel y sus creditos le han servido bastante tanto en el negocio como en el hogar
texts.en:
María Eva M. sells food in the food court of Santa Ana market. She has been in this line of work for 20 years; she used to be her mother's assistant but she decided to save up so that she could sell her own products. She sells soup every day from Monday through Sunday from 8am until 2pm. She has two, school-aged children and she is always seeking ways to move them ahead in life because she's a single mother. She has collaborated with Ceprodel for a year and a half and the loans have been of much help to her both at her business and in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Francisco Tomas

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco Tomas R.actualmente labora para una empresa que brinda servicios de seguridad a otras empresas que requieren de tales servicios, su estado civil es casado y han procreado con su esposa un total de dos hijos un menor y el otro en edad escolar el crédito lo solicito para la compra de materiales de construcción y pago de mano de obra.
texts.en:
El Sr. Francisco Tomas R.currently works for a company that provides security services to businesses. He is married and has two children; one child is school-age, the other not yet in school. This loan will be used to purchase construction materials and pay laborers.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cement, sand, gravel

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
El señor M. es un transportista de este municipio el cual con su camión se dedica a la compra y venta de sal donde la distribuye en los departamentos del sur y occidente de Nicaragua el cual con esfuerzo propio ha logrado salir adelante en su pequeño negocio  ya que con los créditos anteriores con nuestra institución   el logro comprar su camión y así dejar de alquilar ya que antes el tenia que alquilar un camión para poder comercializar el producto.
Este crédito lo solicita para realizarle una operación que necesita la esposa de Don Miguel ya que en este instante no tenia los recursos suficientes para pagar la operación.
texts.en:
El señor M. is a trucking contractor from this town. He buys and sells salt and hauls it to the southern and western departments of Nicaragua. From his efforts, his small business has been able to survive. With earlier loans from our institution, he was able to buy his truck and cease renting. Previously, he had to rent a truck to run his business. This requested loan is for surgery that Don Miguel's wife needs. At this time, he doesn't have money to pay for the operation.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment of his wife's medical expenses

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Antonia P. M. tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, el crédito lo solicito para rellenar su venta de productos que más rotación tienen, es madre de cinco hijos todos en edad escolar cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que tiene su taller de hojalatería sus hijos en tiempos libres le ayudan a ella en la venta abren la pulpería desde las seis y media de la mañana hasta las once de la noche.
Tiene 24 años de tener su negocio que lo inicio con un capital de c$3,000.00 que fueron aporte de su esposo anteriormente ella era ama de casa  pero con el tiempo el esposo y ella decidieron poner su venta para que ambos lucharan para salir adelante para sacar adelante a sus hijos tiene cinco años de trabajar con ceprodel y sus financiamientos le han servido de mucho porque al suave le ha metido a su casa con las ganancias que le he sacado a los créditos y por que es mujer luchadora que no pierde las esperanzas de terminar de construir su casita
texts.en:
Maria Antonia P. M. has a mini-market in her house. The loan she is requesting is to replenish the products she sells the most. She has five children; all of them are school age. She counts on her husband’s help. He has a sheet metal shop. Her children help her sell during their free time. The store is open from six-thirty in the morning until eleven at night. She has had this business for 24 years. She started with c$3,000.00 from her husband. Previously she was a housewife. In time she and her husband decided to set up her sales business so that they could both strive to get their children ahead. She has worked with Ceprodel for five years. The loans have been very useful because she was able to get earnings, which she gradually put into her house. She is a tenacious woman who does not lose the hope of completing construction on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products like dairy products, general goods, basic grains, and Diana products

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: A 39-year-old business-minded woman, Lilian O. hopes and dreams that someday her fishing business will expand through the loan she is requesting from Kiva through ASHI. She hopes that she will be able to purchase additional raw materials such as fishing net, rope, bamboo, fingerlings (small fish), and pay labor expenses. The proceeds from her business will help Lilian achieve her aspiration of graduating her two children from college. She also hopes soon to have a beautiful concrete house of their own to live in. As a dedicated member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva micro-finance partner in the Philippines since 1996, Lilian is thankful for secured access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams. Despite the many trials in life that she has been through, in her membership in ASHI and in her relationship to her group members and center she remains strong, active and devoted to reach her goals in life. About ASHI As a micro-finance institution that uses the Grameen methodology, Ahon sa Hirap (ASHI), being the first practitioner in the field, saw how these poor women mothers work hard to earn money for the cash flow of her family and to provide their children with a better life. Because the micro-credit ASHI is extending to these women is delivered directly to their villages and on the doorstep of their houses, together with the loan handed over to them it is giving them hope that someday they will rise above poverty. (“rise above poverty” is a direct English translation of “Ahon sa Hirap”).

loans.use: To purchase additional materials such as fishing net, rope, bamboo and fingerlings, and to pay labor expenses

loans.name: Francisca Marina

texts.es:
La Señora Francisca Marina P. M. tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación desde hace  ocho años ella decidio poner su negocio con un capital de C$ 20,000.00  aporte de una hermana que esta fuera del país, anteriormente ella era ama de casa vivía en panamá es casada es madre de cinco hijos, dos de ellos dependen de ella y estan en edad escolar.
Se esfuerza en su negocio para poder sacar el bocado de cada día para ella y para sus hijos y su papá que esta bajo su cargo  habre su negocio desde las siete de la mañana hasta las diez y media de la noche, tiene una sobrina que le ayuda haber el negocio y su hija que en tiempos libre tambien le ayuda.
 Tiene  cinco años de trabajar con nuestra institución y ella manifestó en la encuesta que le hicimos que se siente muy agradecida con ceprodel ya que siempre le han financiado y así ella a podido surtir su negocio y poco a poco a sacado adelante a sus hijos y su hogar
texts.en:
Francisca Marina P. M. has had a mini-market in her house for eight years. She decided to start her business with C$ 20,000.00 that her sister, who is out of the country, contributed. Before that she was a housewife, and she lived in Panamá. She is married and has five children. Two of them are school-age and dependent upon her. She puts her effort into her business in order to be able to provide food daily to herself, her children, and her father, who is her responsibility. Her business is open from seven in the morning until ten thirty at night. She has a niece that helps her with the business. Her daughter also helps her during her free time. She has worked with our institution for five years. She told us in the survey that she is very grateful to Ceprodel because they have always financed her. That way she was able to slowly stock her business and get her children and her household ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise like cookies, Diana products, soft drinks, candy, gum, and milk, etc.

loans.name: Las Juanitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama JUANITAS porque su desembolso fue un 24 de Junio día de San Juan, una de las integrantes vende comida. Esta ubicado en la colonia San José Vista Hermosa, en el Municipio de Puente de Ixtla en el Estado de Morelos. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes.

La señora Angélica Rómula Nájera Vázquez ocupa el puesto de Presidenta  del grupo tiene 29 años de edad, vive en Unión Libre, estudio hasta la secundaria, vende Abarrotes desde hace 4 años,  y tiene un hijo de 8 años.

Todas las señoras de este grupo son muy luchonas, trabajadoras y emprendedoras, en especial la señora Antonia A. Guzmán, Toñita para sus amigos,  es una mujer que ha  salido adelante a pesar de las adversidades, de nacionalidad Mexicana con 58 años de edad es viuda y se dedica a la venta de comida.

La señora Toñita se dedicó al hogar hasta el día en el cual quedó viuda, por lo que para sacar a delante a sus hijos, inició vendiendo tacos en la calle,  no fue fácil, ya que no estaba acostumbrada a trabajar en otra cosa que no fuera el hogar, pero la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia la lleno de fuerzas para seguir de pie, poco a poco va haciendo crecer el negocio, sabe que aun le falta mucho por hacer, sueña con poner una palapa, por ello con los créditos que se van otorgando va comprando material para alcanzar su sueño.

La señora Teresa M. P. es otra de las integrantes de este grupo tiene 56 años sin estudios, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y se dedica a la venta de comida inicio su negocio hace 16 años.

La señora Guadalupe Sánchez R. es otra de las integrantes de este grupo tiene 25 años estudio hasta la secundaria, vive en Unión Libre, tiene dos hijos y se dedica a la venta de refresco y dulces, inicio su negocio hace 2 años.

La señora Eusebia Sánchez M. es otra de las integrantes de este grupo tiene 56  años estudió hasta la secundaria, es viuda, tiene tres hijos y se dedica a la venta de colchas y repostería, inició su negocio hace 20 años.

La señora Herlinda C. V. es otra de las integrantes de este grupo tiene 57 años estudió hasta la primaria, vive en Unión Libre, tiene un hijo y se dedica a la venta de comida, inició su negocio hace 5 años.

La señora María del Carmen S. García es otra de las integrantes de este grupo tiene 48 años estudió hasta la primaria, esta casada, tiene tres hijo y se dedica a la venta de sabanas y colchas, inicio su negocio hace 8 años.

La señora Socorro S. V. es otra de las integrantes de este grupo tiene 31 años sin estudios, vive en unión libre, tiene dos hijos y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, inició su negocio hace 6 años.

La señora Socorro M. A. es otra de las integrantes de este grupo tiene 59 años estudió hasta la primaria,  esta casada, tiene tres hijos y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, inició su negocio hace 22 años.
texts.en:
This group is called Juanitas because it was established on June 24th, the day of San Juan. One of the group members sells food. The communal bank is located in the San José Vista Hermosa residential area of the municipality of Puente de Ixtla, in the state of Morelos. This group is comprised of 9 members.

Ms. Angélica Rómula Nájera Vázquez is the group president. She is 29 years old and is cohabitating. She has a middle school education and has been selling provisions for 4 years. She has an 8-year-old son.

All the women in this group are very persevering, hardworking and enterprising, especially Antonia A. Guzmán (or Toñita as she is known by her friends). She is a person who has been able to get ahead despite many adversities. She is a 58-year-old Mexican widow who sells food for a living.

Ms. Toñita had been a homemaker until the day that she became a widow. In order to support her children, she started selling tacos on the streets. It was not easy since she was not used to working outside her home; however, her need to help her family get ahead gave her the strength to stay on her feet. Little by little, she has been expanding her business. She knows that she still has a long way to go. She dreams of setting up a palm shelter. With the loan that she will receive, she will start purchasing the materials she needs to reach her goal.

Ms. Teresa M. P. is another group member. She is 56 years old and never received a formal education. She is a married mother of two and sells food for a living. She started this business 16 years ago.

Ms. Guadalupe Sánchez R., another group member, is 25 years old and has a middle school education. She is cohabitating and has 2 children. She has been selling soft drinks and candy for two years.

Ms. Eusebia Sánchez M. is a 56-year-old widow with 3 children. She also has a middle school education. She has been selling bedspreads and pastry for 20 years.

Ms. Herlinda C. V. is 57 years old and has an elementary school education. She is cohabitating and has one son. She has been selling food for 5 years.

Ms. María del Carmen S. García is 48 years old and has an elementary school education. She is a married mother of 3 who has been selling bed sheets and bedspreads for 8 years.

Ms. Socorro S. V. is 31 years old and does not have a formal education. She is cohabitating and has 2 children. She has been selling cosmetics for 6 years.

Ms. Socorro M. A. is 59 years old and has an elementary school education. She is a married mother of 3 who has been selling provisions for 22 years.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material to build a palm shelter

loans.name: Melida

texts.es: La Sra. Melida E. M. Actualmente desempeña el cargo de directora de un colegio público ubicado en el municipio de San Rafael Del Sur. De estado civil casado dos hijos antes se desempeñaba como maestra de educación primaria. El crédito lo solicito para compra de ropa nueva y cosméticos para generar otras fuentes de ingresos para mejorar la estabilidad de la unidad familiar
texts.en:
Melida E. M. is the principal of a public school in San Rafael del Sur. She is married and has two children. She used to be an elementary school teacher. She will use the funds to buy new clothes and cosmetics in order to have an additional source of income to improve her family's stability.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an assortment of new clothes in various styles and sizes as well as cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura tiene 52 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío Quemazón, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, de la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de verduras, granos y menestras en su domicilio, el negocio nació de la necesidad de agenciarse de un ingreso que le permitiera ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia y velar por la calidad de vida de sus padres, que son de edad avanzada. Por otro lado este negocio es de mucha ayuda para los vecinos de su caserío, ya que este queda muy alejado del pueblo y ellos no tienen alimentos de primera necesidad al alcance de la mano.

Debido a que la mayoría de vecinos de la zona son agricultores y reciben sus pagos los fines de semana ella ofrece sus productos al crédito y al contado. Este sistema esta teniendo mucha acogida, asi que Rosaura desea ampliar su negocio, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de mas verduras y menestras.

Ella es una mujer bastante conocida por los vecinos de su zona, ellos la consideran una mujer trabajadora, responsable y de confianza. Su mayor anhelo es otorgarle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosaura is a 52-year-old single woman who lives with her parents in the Quemazón settlement, a rural area in the Mórrope district of the Lambayeque province, located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been selling vegetables, grains and pulses from home for several years. This business was born out of Rosaura's need to earn a living to help support her family and look after her parents' quality of life, as they are elderly. Concurrently, this business also helps her neighbors in the settlement since the city is far away and they do not have basic need items at hand.

Because the majority of the residents are farmers and receive their pay at the end of the week, she accepts both cash and credit for her goods. This system is having much success, so Rosaura would like to expand her business. For this reason, she is requesting a 1,500.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa, which she will invest in purchasing pulses and vegetables.

Rosaura is very well-known by her neighbors, who consider her to be a hardworking, responsible and trustworthy woman. Her greatest wish is to give her parents a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pulses and vegetables

loans.name: Xochilt Paola

texts.es:
La señora Xochilt, se dedica a la Venta de Calzado y Chinela, todos los días se ubica en puesto fijo  al aire libre en la 2da. Calle del mercado la terminal – León, oferta su producto desde temprana hora finalizando  a las 2:00 pm. la tarde es dedicada a su familia ya que tiene un niño de 20 meses. 
Este crédito que solicita es  para aumentar su inventario, actualmente le están ofreciendo un calzado a bajo precio por lo que quiere aprovechar la oportunidad presentada de lo cual obtendría mayores ganancia al igual que ofertaría a su clientela variedad de productos con el objetivo de satisfacer la necesidad de  ellos.
texts.en:
Xochilt sells shoes and sandals every day at an open-air stand in the second aisle of León's La Terminal market. She is open for business from very early in the morning until 2pm; the afternoons are dedicated to her family for she has a 20-month-old child. She will use the requested funds to increase her stock inventory. She is being offered shoes at a low price and she wants to take advantage of this opportunity which will allow her to make higher profits while offering her customers a greater variety of products to meet their needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Adriano

texts.en:
Adriano is a 50-year-old rice farmer who is married and is the father of two kids. His oldest child, who goes to school, is only 17 years old. His family depends on his farm so he works hard to make it productive.

Adriano joined CEVI, an MFI (micro-finance institute), in 2008. He said that its program has been really helpful to his business. He also likes its low interest rate. Adriano is currently requesting a loan of Php 14,000, which he would use to buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia, 55, is a rice farmer from Agusan Del Sur. She started planting rice in 1980.

Alicia joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in 2008 to financially support her farm. Now she has requested a loan of 14,000 Php. This will be helpful to buy farm inputs necessary for her rice field.

Alicia is the mother of ten children. With rice farming, she provides the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Gerald Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Gerald Alberto Hernández  Gutiérrez, de estado civil casado, padre de un hijo, actualmente trabaja como obrero del volante en su propio taxi, cuenta con más de cuatro años de experiencia, este crédito lo solicito para la compra de seguro del vehículo y algunas mejoras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gerald Alberto Hernández Gutiérrez is married and has a son. He has over four years experience providing taxi services using his own car. He will use the requested funds to buy car insurance and to make some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy doors for his house and car insurance.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia, 44, is a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and has requested a loan of 14,000 Php as additional capital for her rice-farming business. This loan will help a lot to purchase farm supplies.

Delia started rice farming in 2000 and tills her rice field in Agusan del Sur. She maintains the farm very well so as to have a plentiful harvest. 

Delia now has four children, her eldest being 10 years old. With rice farming, she has been able to provide the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is a rice farmer who lives in Agusan Del Sur. She just started preparing her land for planting and she needs inputs for it. The farm is her family’s only source of income so she makes sure to earn from it. Her oldest child, who is now 35 years old, also helps her on the farm.

Florenda applied for a loan from CEVI to supply her farm inputs. She asked to loan Php14, 000, which she would use to buy seed, fertilizer and other inputs.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
“I’m happy with my business because it helps provide my family’s needs especially my children’s education,” Francisca shares about her rice farm. She is 46 years old and is married with six children. Her children’s education is the top priority of her and her husband.

To fund her farm, Francisca used to borrow from individuals who charge high interest on their loans. It was hard for her because she barely had money left for her family. When she learned of CEVI, she immediately settled her obligations and joined the MFI (micro-finance institute). She is now requesting to loan Php14, 000 to fund her farm. She will buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs she needs.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca, 48, a resident from Agusan del Sur, is a rice farmer. She manages a rice field which is her main source of living. She has six children to support, the eldest being 28 years old.

Francisca lacks capital and that's why she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and requested a loan of 14,000 Php. This loan will help her a lot in providing fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Ginabelle

texts.en:
Ginabelle, 23, is a rice farmer in Bunawan, Agusan del Sur. She needs farm inputs to operate her rice field but she lacks capital. That's why she sought help from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., requesting a loan of 14,000 Php. This loan will enable her to provide the supplies needed for her farm.

Ginabelle is the mother of two children, her eldest being only 4 years old. Rice farming is the only way she can provide the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen owns a rice field. She’s 26 years old and is into rice farming in Agusan del Sur. She started her business way back in 2005. With the income she receives from her farm, the financial problems in sustaining the needs of her family are met.

Helen joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to obtain a loan for her farm. She requested 12,000 Php as additional capital to finance her business. With this amount, she can buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Hilary

texts.en:
Like other farmers in his town, Hilary depends on his rice farm to earn a living. He is 27 years old and is married with a 1-year-old child. His family depends on him so he works hard to be able to cope with the needs in his household. He also wants to start saving this early for his child’s education.

Hilary sought the help of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to gain financial assistance for his farm. He applied for a loan of Php 14,000 which he would use to supply his farm with seed, fertilizer and other inputs. Hopefully, this loan will help Hilary earn more.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
30-year-old Jessie is married to Danny and they have one child aged 20. Jessie wants her child to have a good future, thus she works hard to realize this. She currently owns a hectare (2.5 acres) of rice field. She expects her business to prosper for her to earn more and also to augment the family’s income.

Jessie applied to CEVI and would like to loan Php 5,000. Jessie will use the loan for farm supplies like urea (a fertilizer), other fertilizers, insecticide, and other items.

loans.use: To buy urea and other fertilizers, insecticide, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in 2008. She was seeking financial support for her business and that’s why she joined the MFI (micro-finance institute).

Jocelyn is 49 years old and is married with eight children. She is involved in rice farming and, like other farmers, she wants to grow her farm so she would also earn more.

Jocelyn is now requesting Php 14,000. This loan will be used to buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Johanna

texts.en:
Rice farming is the main source of living for Johanna, 34. She supports four children in her family, of whom the eldest is still 17 years old. Her rice field is just big enough to provide their basic needs.

Johanna joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to obtain a loan to finance her business with a low interest rate. She’s requesting 14,000 Php to buy farm necessities and to sustain her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
36-year-old Judith is married to Herminaldo and they have six children, her eldest being 18. She desires that her children achieve a proper education which urges her to work hard.

Judith owns a rice field and is engaged in rice farming. She envisions having a better income from her business and so improving her family’s living status.

Judith applied to CEVI and would like to loan Php 5,000. This loan will be used to supply Judith’s farm needs such as seed, urea (a fertilizer), pesticide, insecticide, diesel fuel and other items.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily, 50, spends a lot of time managing her rice farming business. She enjoys working on the farm because it provides food, shelter, and clothing for her family. Lily is married to Ruben and they have four children.

Lily would like to continue working on her farm for the sustenance of her family but is limited as to financing the business. That’s why she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to be able to obtain a loan intended for her business. She requested a loan of 14,000 Php, enough to buy materials and supplies she needs for her farm.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Rosario

texts.es: La  Sra. Elizabeth Del Rosario V. García, se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria, es casada , sin hijos, cuenta con mas de siete años de experiencia en esa actividad, los créditos que ha solicitado  han sido para la mejora de su vivienda en donde expresa que los créditos son la única alternativa para llevar a cabo tales actividades.
texts.en:
Elizabeth Del Rosario V. García has been an elementary school teacher for over 7 years. She's married and has no children. The funds she has requested are to make home improvements; she has stated that the loans are her only option to accomplish them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Forty-six-year-old Linda L. has six children whom she sends to school. She is involved in rice farming. She helps her husband make their farm productive. She spends most of her day working at the farm. She said that even though it is tiring for the most part of farming, she still enjoys her time at the farm because it’s what she loves doing. She hopes to be successful in her ventures.

Linda is a member of CEVI, a Kiva partner, and is now applying for a loan. She will use the loan to fund her farm. She will buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is a 39-year-old married woman from Agusan Del Sur. She has six children; the oldest is aged 19. She sends them to school because she wants them to be given a proper education and have bright futures. 

She has been involved in rice farming for more than a few years. She wants to grow her farm because it is her family’s only source of income. One of the challenges in her life right now is her children’s education. She said that it’s hard to keep up with the increasing school fees so she works hard to earn more.

Marianita would like to request a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos. She will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This loan will be truly helpful with Marianita’s goal to earn better.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is happy to share that her business is currently going well. She is a 39-year-old rice farmer. She is married and has three children. Her oldest child is 11 years old. 

She wants to maintain her farm’s good condition, so she spends her time cultivating it and making sure it is free of pests and weeds. She also needs additional inputs for her rice farm, so she applied for a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner. She will buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs with her loan.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Like most of the people in Agusan Del Sur, Mary Grace is involved in rice farming. She is 33 years old, married and has four children. Her oldest is aged 14. She and her husband agreed to make their children’s education a top priority, so both of them work hard to achieve their goal. 

Mary Grace is in need of farm inputs. She is seeking a loan amounting to 14,000 Philippine pesos. She will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and other inputs.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida, 46, is in the rice-farming business. She started her business way back in 1993. She is now managing a rice field in Agusan del Sur. She loves her work on the farm. She is the mother of four children; her eldest is 20 years old. She strives hard in order to provide for the basic needs of her family.

She requested a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner, to support the financing of her farm. With this amount, she will be able to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm supplies and seeds

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Thirty-five-year-old farmer Renato plows a rice field in Agusan del Sur. He strives hard, working on his farm, to support his three children. He wants them to finish their studies at school. He wants to improve his farming to have greater earnings.

He heard about Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner that offers financial assistance to entrepreneurs like him. He joined and requested a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos to support his business on the farm.

loans.use: Farm inputs

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Twenty-nine-year-old Ruby S. is a married woman with two children. Her oldest child is 10 years old. She is involved in rice farming and helps her husband till their rice farm, which is what her family depends on for daily needs. She wants to grow her farm so she could also earn more. She said that it is hard to keep up with the increasing school fees, so she has to work hard for it. 

Ruby would like to request a loan amounting to 10,000 Philippine pesos. She will use it to buy seedlings, fertilizers and other farm inputs she needs.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy, 56, runs a rice-farming business. His rice field is the primary source of income that provides for the daily needs of his family.  He started farming in 1980. 

He would like to request a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner, to purchase farm supplies. He has five children; the eldest is 19 years old. This loan will help him send his children to school and sustain his rice field as well.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Gloria Yolanda

texts.es: La  Sra. Gloria Yolanda V. M. es de estado civil casada, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, se desempeña como profesora de primaria  también cuenta con una pulpería para la obtención de otros ingresos, este crédito lo solicito para la compra de mercaderías alusivas a la época de verano y alguna mejoras en el local del negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria Yolanda V. M. is married and has two, school-age children. She is an elementary school teacher but also has a grocery store as an additional source of income. She will use the funds to buy seasonal summer products and to make some physical improvements to her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise and make some improvements to her grocery store.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Rice farming is the main source of income for Shirley, 52.  Her business is located in Agusan del Sur. She has a good harvest when the weather is good and no pests attack. She tills her rice field well to support her family.  She is the mother of seven children.

She requested a loan from Kiva's partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc., of 14,000 Philippine pesos to have additional capital for her business to buy farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Fiorella Elizabeth

texts.es: La Srta. H. E. Fiorella Elizabeth tiene 23años de edad vive con sus padres  desde muy pequeña vio el ejemplo de su madre que se dedicaba a vender productos de belleza, nace en ella  la inquietud de poder incursionar en la venta de productos de belleza y así poder ayudar a su familia, es bastante emprendedora, y posteriormente desea tener estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Miss H. E. Fiorella Elizabeth is 23 years old and lives with her parents. Since she was a child, she has seen her mother's example of selling beauty products. From then, her desire to sell beauty products was born because she wants to help her family out. She is quite enterprising, and would also like get a higher education in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business investment

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es: La  Sra. Ana Lucia García Q., es de estado civil soltera y con un hijo menor, actualmente  se desempeña como Kardista en un centro de salud del Municipio de San Rafael del Sur, este crédito lo solcito para realizar mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana Lucia García Q. is single and has a minor son. She works as a file clerk in a municipal health center in San Rafael del Sur. She will use the funds to make some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: La Sra. M. V. María Esther tiene 19 años de edad vive con sus padres a su corta edad es madre soltera, su madre quien también se dedica a la venta de ropa le inculca el negocio de poder vender ropa y demás para poder mantener a su menor hija de 9 meses de edad, una persona muy animada de seguir adelante y de progresar.
texts.en:
Ms. M. V. María Esther is a 19-year-old who lives with her parents. At her young age, she is a single mother. Her mother also sells clothing for a living, and she instills in her the desire for this business. Furthermore, she can support her 9-month-old baby by selling clothing. She is a very lively person who wants to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business investment

loans.name: Livera

texts.en: Livera B. is from the village of Aquiboro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old. Livera is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Livera operates a store to sell rice by the kilo in the local community. Livera has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Livera joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Livera is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional product to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Livera from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gene

texts.en: Gene S. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Gene is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Gene operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Gene has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Gene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gene is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Gene from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es: La Sra.A. L. Florencia 33 años de edad es conviviente, tiene 02 hijos en edad escolar a raíz de el afán de superación su conviviente tuvo que salir fuera de la ciudad para tratar de Salir adelante  vive en la casa sus cuñados, ella labora vendiendo desayunos, de esa manera trata de salir adelante, solicita el crédito para gastos escolares de sus menores hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. A. L. Florencia is a 33-year-old woman with a live-in partner and 2 school age children. Because of her partner's eagerness for self-improvement, he had to leave the city to try to get ahead. Her siblings-in-law live with her. She sells breakfast to try to get ahead in life. She is requesting this loan for her children's educational expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business investment

loans.name: Phom

texts.en:
Mrs. Phom T. is a 40 year old who lives in Kouk Roka village in the Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sokhom Un, are farmers who own a 3-hectare field and grow crops. Aside from farming, Mr. Sokhom Un also sells duck eggs to earn a small income to support his family. 

In order to support the farm, Mrs. Phom T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers. With the rest of the loan, she wants to buy pesticide and gasoline to support the farm. 

Mrs. Phom T. is the mother of four children, one of whom is a driver while the other three are students and also support their parents' business. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Vorn P. is a villager in Kdei Tnaot village in the Takeo province. She is 60 years old. She is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectares of land and cultivates rice to support her family. Aside from farming, she is also a laborer and a pig breeder. In addition to all this activity, she is a widow who lives with a child who is enrolled in the local public school. 

However hard she tries to work with her all businesses, she cannot earn enough money. Thus, in order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Vorn P. decided to seek a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en: Ma. Theresa V. is from the village of Bonbon, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 27 years old. Ma. Theresa is single and has two infant children. To make a living, Ma. Theresa makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Ma. Theresa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Ma. Theresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Theresa is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Ma. Theresa from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Dina Candelaria

texts.es: La Sra.Huaracca Q. Dina Candelaria 37 años de edad es madre soltera vive en la casa su hermanos tiene 05 hijos de los cuales depende de ella 03 los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, es una mujer muy trabajadora, empeñosa, se encuentra trabajando como empleada del hogar , a parte en temporadas de fundo también se apoya de esa manera, pero siempre se encuentra realizando algunas labor, necesita el crédito para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Huaracca Q. Dina Candelaria is a 37-year-old single mother who lives in her brother's house. She has 5 children, 3 of whom depend on her financially and are still in school. She is a hard-working woman who is currently employed as a domestic servant. Additionally, she works as a farmhand during certain seasons of the year to support herself. Moreover, she is always working. She needs this loan in order to help her children get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her children's education

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda M. is from the village of Cantaan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Luzminda is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Luzminda owns and operates a service-based business. Her main source of income from the business comes from providing transport services using her own motorcycle. For the whole day, she lets this motorcycle be rented by any habal-habal driver for 150-200 pesos per day. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over seven years. In 2009, Luzminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos from HSPFI. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide better service. This will be the third loan taken out by Luzminda from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide better service

loans.name: Vith

texts.en:
Mrs. Vith L. is 44 years old and she is a villager who lives in Kouk Doung village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Ang Morng, are farmers who own a 2.5-hectare field to cultivate rice on. In this farming, Mrs. Vith L. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water machine and fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farming crops. 

Aside from farming, Mr. Ang Morng is also a duck breeder who can earn a small income by selling duck eggs to support the family. This couple has two children who both are students in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase a water machine and fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosario Amparo

texts.es: La Sra. H. C. Rosario Amparo , tiene 35años de edad vive  en la casa de su hermana, con su menor hija de 13 años se dedica a laborar vendiendo ropa, trabaja en campañas cortas del gobierno como limpieza de calles es muy trabajadora y empeñosa, no le teme al trabajo, con bastante ganas de superación y de salir adelante ella con su hija, para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. H. C. Rosario Amparo is a 35-year-old woman who lives in her sister's house with her 13-year-old daughter. She sells clothes for a living and takes temporary jobs from the government, such as street cleaning. She is a very hard-working person who is not afraid to get her hands dirty. She has the desire for self-improvement and wants to get ahead in life, along with her daughter, so that she can give her a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Education

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en: Mrs. Choeun M., who is a villager in Trapeang Chrey village in Takeo province, is 46 years old. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell in order to support her family. She supports two children by herself because she is a widow. One of her children is attending local public school, while the other does farming so he has a lot of free time. For this reason, Mrs. Choeun M. decided to seek a loan from AMK to make more money for purchasing a new motorbike for her child to use as a motorcycle taxi driver.

loans.use: purchasing a new motorbike for her child to use as a taxi driver

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Mrs. Horn H. is a 33-year-old married woman with four children; three of them are students in the local school, and also help their parents with farming while the youngest one is only 3 years old. This couple lives in Kdei Tnaot village in Takeo province. 

Mrs. Horn H. and her husband, Mr. Ken Tim, are farmers who own 2-hectare field to cultivate rice on. Aside from farming, Mr. Ken Tim is a motorbike taxi driver who can earn a little extra income to support his family. Although they try to work hard with their different businesses, they still don't earn enough income to improve their family's living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Horn H. decided to ask for a loan to buy 500 ducklings to breed for duck eggs. This loan will increase her ability to improve the family's living conditions. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy 500 ducklings

loans.name: Sinuon

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinuon N. is 30 years old and she is a villager in Ta Preah village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice to sell to support her family, and her husband, Mr. Sophork Sok, is a battery charger in their local village.
