Although this family tries to work hard with their businesses, they can earn only a little income. Thus, in order to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Sinuon N. decided to ask for a loan to buy some piglets, pig feed, and, with any remainder, to build a pig stall for breeding pigs to start up new business. She is a mother of a child who is too young to school or work. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy some piglets, pig feed for breeding, and build a pigpen

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena Nunez, 44, is married and supports her family through her dressmaking and gown-for-rent business. She lives in Brgy 2, Sipalay City Negros Occidental with her husband, Nonito, who helps her in running the business, and their only child, who is of school age.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000, and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her dressmaking and gown-for-rent business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 13,000.

Ma. Elena Nunez is now borrowing PHP 25,000 that she can use as additional working capital for her dressmaking business. This will be her 16th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Elena aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia B. is from the village of Magting, MamB. Camiguin Province. She is 52 years old. Celia is widowed and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Celia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Celia has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Celia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Celia decided to request a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Celia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Mrs. Saret U. is 47 years old and she a villager who lives in Krang Touch village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice on to earn the family's living. Mrs. Saret U. is a widow with two children, one of whom is a farmer and also helps with the mother's farming while the second is horse cart driver. 

Mrs. Saret U. is now requesting a loan from AMK to buy a horse and a horse cart for her child's business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a horse and a horse cart

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeurn S. is married to Mr. San Som and she is 47 years old. This couple has five children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others are attending local public school. This family lives in Chi Chrab village in Takeo province. 

Mrs. Thoeurn S. is a farmer who hires a piece of land to cultivate rice on, not for selling but to support her family, and besides this, she is a Khmer noodle seller in their local village also. Her husband is a security guard who can earn only a low salary. This family has a problem because her husband’s workplace is far from their house. Thus, Mrs. Thoeurn S. decided to seek a loan to buy a new motorbike for transportation. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Ream

texts.en:
Mr. Ream C. is 45 years old and he is a villager who lives in Krang Touch village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare field to cultivate rice on to earn a living. His wife, Mrs. Leng Eng, is a duck breeder, raising ducks for duck eggs. 
          
In order to support his wife's business, Mr. Ream C. is now requesting a loan from AMK to purchase 800 ducks and duck feed. This couple has five children, one of whom is a farmer; three others are students in the local school and also help their parents with their businesses while the youngest one is only 2 years old. Both husband and wife are in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase 800 ducks and duck feed

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok M., who is a villager in Trapeang Kak village in Takeo province, is 44 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Ngoy Orun, are farmers who own 2 hectares of land to cultivate rice on to support their family. In the rice field, they have a problem because their field should have been plowed but they did not plow because they did not have enough oxen. 

Thus, Mrs. Sok M. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox to plow their field. She is a mother of five children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while another is attending local public school, and the others are construction workers. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy an ox to use for plowing

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Mrs. Ra C. is 53 years old and she lives in Krang Touch village in Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own 2-hectare field to cultivate rice on to earn the family's living. Although they try to work hard with their farming, they still earn only a little income to support their family. 

Thus, Mrs. Ra C. decided to ask for a loan to buy two mother pigs and pig feed for breeding. This loan will increase her income to improve her family's living conditions. Mrs. Ra C. is a mother of two children, one of whom is a farmer and also supports the parents' business while the second one is attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two mother pigs and pig feed

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan Y., 46, lives in Ta Ou Khang Cheung village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder and her husband, Mr. Sok Sim, is a farmer who owns a small plot of land to cultivate rice to support their family. The couple has four children, one a clothes designer, and the others in school. Although they work hard, they have very little income. Mrs. Chan Y. has therefore decided to apply for a loan to buy two cows to breed.

loans.use: To buy two cows to breed

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena V., 46, is from the village of Tagoloan Misamis oriental. She is single and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a retail store for used clothing known as ukay ukay in the local community. Lorena has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lorena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lorena from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo T. is from the village of Binunsaran, Mambajao Camiguin Province. He is 25 years old and married with two small children. To make a living, he runs a transportation service with his "motorela" or pedicab. He has been in this business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Alfredo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI and is now requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to improve his service to passengers. It will be the fourth loan he has taken out from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to improve his business

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Mrs. Neang K. is married to Mr. Poeurn San. They have two children who are too young to attend school or work. This family lives in Trapeang Kak village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Neang K. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to support her family. Besides cultivating rice she is also a pig breeder, and her husband is a construction worker. In order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Neang K. has decided to apply for a loan to start a new business by buying a cow for breeding. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sokhoeun's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhoeun P., who lives in Choes Village in Takeo Province, is 36 years old. She is the group leader selected by a group of five people who will all use their loans for different purposes. She is a dessert seller in her local village and her husband, Mr. Sarou Chhuoy, is a farmer who owns two hectares of land to cultivate rice to support his family. Although they work hard with their businesses, they are not earning enough income. Thus, in order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Sokhoeun P. decided to ask for a loan to be used to buy a cow for breeding. This couple has two children who are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Hilaria's Group

texts.en:
Hilaria S. is from the village of Culalabat, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 44 years old. Hilaria is the group leader for a 17-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Hilaria is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Hilaria owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Hilaria has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Hilaria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hilaria is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand the range of products in her store. This loan will be her seventh loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the range of products in her store

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion P. is from the village of Mabini St., Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old. Asuncion is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Asuncion owns and operates a specialized retail business. Her main source of income for the business comes primarily from her being sales agent for different brands like Avon, Fullerlife, and Everbelena. Asuncion has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Asuncion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Asuncion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Asuncion is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Despite of being 57 years old, Teresita P. still feels young at heart. She is filled with dreams and hopes for her family, especially for her three children who did not attend college or graduate from high school, although her 17-year-old youngest child is still studying in high school. Although her eldest two children are already 23 and 22 years old, Teresita still wants to support their needs because they are unemployed and will have a hard time finding employment without a higher educational attainment. She also wants to support her youngest child's college education until she graduates. To do this, Teresita needs to grow her hog raising business which she started when she joined ASHI. Profits from her business are the main source of money to support her family needs, since her husband is unemployed and is already old.

loans.use: To purchase pigs for fattening in a small pig farm.

loans.name: Mrs. Men Saes Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan in Ta Ou Khang Cheung Village in Takeo Province goes to a group of ten people. Mrs. Men S. has been selected village bank president by all the group members, who will use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Men S. owns a general store and her husband, Mr. Len Hou, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he cultivates rice to support the family. Besides farming rice, he works as a cow middleman.  Since Mrs. Men S.'s business is going well, she wants to expand, but they do not have enough money. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries for resale. With the rest of the loan she would like to buy a cart to use on the farm. She is the mother of two children who are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Mervic

texts.en:
Mervic D. is an example of a strong woman who can thrive and make a living for the sake of alleviating poverty in her family’s standard of living. Mervic’s main goal is to build a sustainable business to meet the needs of her children; therefore, she was encouraged to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 1999. The previous loans she received from ASHI were carefully invested in her fishing business. Since then, Mervic's business has been performing well and earning her sufficient income. She is grateful that she has been able to educate her children using the proceeds from her businesses as she continues to expand. Mervic and her husband, Manolito, have also embarked on operating a variety store for supplementary income.

Mervic needs a loan to help boost her business and increase her profits. Now on her fifth loan, she is requesting 25,000 pesos as additional capital for her fishing business, to be used to pay for a new motor boat and pay for one videoke (a video karaoke machine) for more revenue.

Mervic is optimistic that she can achieve her dreams of providing a good life for her children and being able to send them to school until they finish college. She also hopes to expand her business, and if possible she will get a stall in the market where she can sell her fish. She hopes that these dreams will come true and that ASHI will, in fact, give the best direction and opportunity to her family.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To pay for a new motor boat and to buy a videoke machine for more revenue.

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhoeun Saing Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has fifteen people who are villagers in Ta Ou Khang Cheung Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Sokhoeun S. is a village bank president who has been selected by the group members, all of whom will use their loans for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Mos Sam, is a construction worker and also a fisherman. Although they work hard with their businesses, they do not earn enough income. Therefore, in order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Sokhoeun S. decided to apply for a loan to start a new business by buying a cow for breeding. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in a local public school, while the other is too young to attend school or work.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Shugar

texts.en:
Shugar G. is a member of Bombong Center in Rizal South Branch (RSB). She is a 29-year-old mother married to Jason and blessed with one son. She was encouraged to join Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines because the institution helps women show their skills by lending them working capital for a business as a micro-entrepreneur.

She marks the day that she joined ASHI in 2006: she began to dream, hope, and find a way to get out of poverty. To supply additional income for her family, Shugar is interested in continuing her fishing business.

Shugar would like to receive a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase raw materials like nets, bamboo, rope, and a new fish cage. As a proud member of ASHI, Shugar is thankful to obtain secured capital to support her goals in life. Her long-term goals are to build a profitable fishing business, send all of her children to college, and invest in her home. With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is dedicated to expand her fishing business and determined to achieve financial stability for her family.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like nets, bamboo, rope, and a new fish cage.

loans.name: 06.02.01Hoang Chau-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Yên L. T. (1) is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Hoang Hoa Thanh Hoa. Yên is the group leader for a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 06.02.01-Hoang Chau-Hoang Hoa (06.02.01).

Yên is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, Yên owns and operates a fishing business. WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling lake-caught fish in the local community. Yên has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2003, Yên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yên has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to expanding her business. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND, which will be invested in expanding her business. This loan will be her eighth loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. C. T. Chieu (040) is a 52-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2. N. T. N. Mai (036) is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3. C. T. Hoa (042) is a 39-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4. L. T. Gai (002) is a 44-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

Yên L. T. (1) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở Hoang Hoa Thanh Hoa. Yên là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 06.02.01-Hoang Chau-Hoang Hoa (06.02.01).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở hồ trong cộng đồng địa phương. Yên thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Yên kiếm được khoảng 1.000.000 VND. Vào 2003, Yên đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Yên đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.000.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. C. T. Chieu (040) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2. N. T. N. Mai (036) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3. C. T. Hoa (042) là 39 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4. L. T. Gai (002) là 44 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jocelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn P. is from the village of Nattapian West, Solana, Cagayan. She is 26 years old. Jocelyn is the group leader for a 19-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jocelyn is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business that provides recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from collecting junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years, and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. She is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional waste and junk materials to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jocelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to make improvements to her house.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional waste and junk material to resell

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
With her heart filled with aspiration, Beverly P. joined Kiva's first field partner in the Philippines: ASHI. With the loans she can access through ASHI, she is optimistic about having her own business to grow as much as she wants in partnership with her husband. Proceeds from this would make her capable of improving her family’s standard of living and she would be able to support the college education of her 21-year-old brother-in-law until he graduates, since she and her husband don’t have their own child yet. Beverly is just 27 years old now but her visions are about preparing for the future, especially of their children. She doesn’t want them to experience being poor the way she has experienced it.

Presently, Beverly runs a mini grocery store in their town’s public market. She wants her store to have more kinds of items for sale and to increase its inventory so that she can supply her increasing number of customers as well as their needs. With this in mind, she is requesting a loan from Kiva through ASHI. Despite not having any children yet, Beverly enjoys her married life because she has a business and her husband is working with her on it.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her store and to increase its inventory.

loans.name: Mrs Sim Yim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of ten people, all of whom live in Preaek Ksev village in Kandal province. Mrs S. Y. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the group members. Each member will use their loan for a different purpose.
Mrs S. Y. and her husband, Mr. Kang Srie, are door-to-door noodle sellers. They have a problem in their business because their house does not have enough water to use while they are making noodles. Therefore, in order to solve this problem, Mrs S. Y. has decided to seek a loan to buy a water machine to support her business. Mrs S. Y. is a mother of two children – one is a laborer and the other attends the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a water machine to support her business

The main source of income for the business comes from selling firewood in the local community. Lanie has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Lanie joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: Ana Elizabeth P. de 39 años de edad, reside en Cojuteque, un bello pueblo el cual es muy famoso por sus embutidos, este lugar está ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a sus tres hijos de 16, 14 y 10 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ana posee una venta de mochilas, juguetes para niños y niñas, relojes, accesorios para el cabello, maquillaje y otros productos más. El negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal de Ilobasco, en donde cuenta con un lugar muy concurrido lo cual le trae grandes ventajas, ya que cuenta con una venta bastante estable. Es por esta razón que Ana solicita un préstamo para poder invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de productos, sobre todo aquellos que gozan de mayor demanda por parte de sus clientes, algunos de estos son: los juguetes y los cosméticos. Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora y esforzada, la cual se dedica por completo al bienestar de sus tres hijos, los cuales dependen por completo del trabajo de su madre. Es por esta razón que Ana desea poder seguir adelante y crecer en su negocio el cual le permita obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana Elizabeth P. is 39 years old and lives in Cojuteque, a beautiful village which is very famous for its cured meats. The town is located in the Department of Cuscatlán. She lives with her three children, aged 16, 14 and 10, who are all in school. Ana has a business selling backpacks, boys' and girls' toys, watches, hair accessories, makeup and other products. The business is located in the municipal market of Ilobasco, where she has a stall in a high-traffic area. This brings her great advantages, and her sales are quite stable. For this reason, Ana is asking for a loan so that she can invest in her business by purchasing a larger quantity of products, above all those which are in greatest demand among her customers., such as toys and cosmetics. Ana is a very hard-working and energetic woman, and she is fully dedicated to the well-being of her three children, who are completely dependent on their mother's work. For this reason, Ana wants to be able to expand her business and make progress, allowing her to obtain higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cosmetics, toys and backpacks

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán
